reviews.text: This place has the weirdest décor. I&#39;m not sure what they were aiming for but I got dimly lit Disney Little Mermaid in a dark gold-brown underwater theme. Everything is strangely cartoonish looking, which is appealing but also strange at the same time.<br><br>We had the crispy cauliflower as an app and the steak dianne + shrimp scampi with mashed potatoes to share. Not sure what happened with our order, but our cauliflower took so long to come that the manager came over to apologize and had the dish comped. Thankfully the main arrived shortly after and everything else went smoothly. The main was good and the portion sizes are predictably large, so sharing an app and a main it was more than enough food for two people.<br><br>We were so full that we had to take a slice of salted caramel cheesecake to go, because the visit is not complete without cheesecake!
I came because this place was recommended to me but I really tried three dishes and they were all tasteless and a little undercooked I don&#39;t recommend them.

I understand that delivery is new for some businesses during the pandemic and I appreciate CCF making this available. The food and selection remain excellent but I think they have made a big mistake allying themselves with DoorDash as exclusive partners. We have ordered several times now and delivery times are inaccurate, orders have been extremely late (like an hour or more late) or in one case cancelled. DoorDash also make other deliveries &#34;on the way&#34; (which may mean &#34;in the opposite direction&#34; - they even have an FAQ for &#34;why is my dasher heading away from me&#34;). I realize this is a DoorDash review but if you&#39;re going to only allow one delivery option it becomes your review.

Call me a Cheesecake Factory Groupie if you will; I love a good Cheesecake Factory. Enter my excitement waltzing into the architecturally pleasing location here in Chicago, I was excited to surpass the locally owned restaurants to wine and dine with the most basic at the Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m stoked!<br><br>Let&#39;s begin with my favorite, the strawberry martini. When I first began drinking this nectar of angels it was priced out at about $12. Fast forward to now, you&#39;re looking at a cool $15.50, however what I sipping on tonight was not sweet nectar nor worthy of a crisp twenty dollar bill. Maybe it&#39;s because I hail from California? I don&#39;t know but I expected my famed martini to be muddled with strawberries, this had a strange foam and mouthwash aftertaste. I choked it down and moved along to a Pinot noir. <br><br>Next, our stuffed mushrooms came Luke warm. <br><br>My chicken Madeira came dry, sauceless and without extra requested (and charged for) asparagus. <br><br>I give the building itself a fantastic five, but the food a cool one. The service at the bar was also stellar (apart from the disappointing martini) however he served us with a smile and with haste. <br><br>2/10 will be back<br><br>And we&#39;re back- awful service at the bar with subpar cocktails. I can justifying coming back again.

Ran into a worker there called &#34;Wayne&#34; I was picking up food and he was 100% rude. <br>Got help from someone else Tim- who was nice (thank you) <br>Then &#34;Wayne&#34; walked up to Tim and told him I was rude and wouldn&#39;t give me the food until he found out my name. 100% inappropriate and doesn&#39;t like to listen to people when they ask a question and need help. <br>He needs some customer service training

Not sure what to say here. This is a great location in the lower level of the Hancock Center right in the heart of Chicago. It was Friday night and the place was packed. We had to wait a good half hour for a table. Before I get to the food, the décor is just weird. I don&#39;t get it. The waiter tried to tell us that the restaurant theme was &#34;the Great Chicago Fire.&#34; But I didn&#39;t get a flamy vibe, I got a snaky vibe. Why was the bar area kitted out in brass cobras? The odd puffy columns and swirly serpent looking things everywhere were something out of Alice in Wonderland. It looked like a Disney Aladdin psychedelic experience of some kind but painted over to be all gold or brown or whatever. I was coming down with a cold and the décor made me a little queasy, unfortunately.<br><br>Our waiter was great. I loved him. Fast, enthusiastic, helpful, friendly - everything you could want in a waiter. The menu is huge and after paging through endless options, I gave up and ordered a giant chicken burrito - at least four times as big as any burrito I had encountered up to that time. I was able to eat about a third of it. It was only okay. I&#39;ve had better burritos, but I was hungry and I ate as much as I could.<br><br>The location is so convenient but the décor is so weird. I&#39;m repulsed by the entire vibe of the restaurant but love the location and our wonderful waiter. 5 stars for service, 1 star for atmosphere, and 3 stars for the food.
Terrible customer service no smile <br>Gives feeling of not welcome.. won&#39;t go this location again

I really like the food here. Though, when I do order from here, I try to order from their website and have my food ready for a later time. They get pretty busy so it&#39;s best to order food instead of walking in and waiting. I love the pastas, so yummy.

Don&#39;t EAT @ Cheesecake Factory unless you want Uninvited guest<br>Spoiled our dinner out!.. What an atrocious experience &amp; the manager rushed me &amp; my husband out so fast with the food we ordered.. that&#39;s crazy we was not going to eat anything from cheesecake after seeing the roach

Definitely a tourist favorite. It gets incredibly crowded during dinner time so I recommend bringing your patience (lol) or making a reservation. If you just want cheesecake, there&#39;s a separate line for that although I dislike the fact that the online orders, phone calls AND cheesecake orders all go to the same line. The portions are big so you will be filled. Make sure to grab some extra bread before you leave!

Update: My previous review was far too generous and I had to revise. Cheesecake Factory delivers the same consistently bad service and you will see the same theme in my previous post. After living in Chicago for two years and going to 300 different restaurants in the City during that time frame, this Cheesecake Factory is by far the worst restaurant in the City. I could not in good conscience recommend anyone to eat here. Customer service is nonexistent and that is far from exaggerating. I have been to this place far too many times trying to give it a chance, wanting to like it so badly, and it fails every single time whether dining in or carrying out. The first thing you have to know about this place is that you will not have a meal shorter than two hours. And if you are carrying out, expect to wait a suspiciously long time; long enough that you start to wonder if they completely forgot you placed an order. Doesn&#39;t matter what you order, dining in or taking out, if you&#39;re coming while the place is empty or full, or whether it is lunch, dinner, or somewhere in between. Everything from receiving drinks to finishing the meal and waiting for the bill takes a significantly long time and the pacing is horrifyingly bad. The servers are extremely inattentive. You will not see your wait staff much, and when you do, they will walk right by you without saying a word. If they do stop by your table, they will be uncomfortably rude and/or cold for no reason. <br><br>We waited 20 minutes to be greeted at our table once seated, waited another 15 minutes to order because the server didn&#39;t want to take our order when first greeted, an hour had gone by until we were served our entree, our bread came after we were halfway through our entree, another forty minutes had gone by until we were served our cheesecake, and another thirty minutes went by until we received the bill. We had to ask a hostess, a busboy, another server, AND the manager to get bread, cheesecake, AND our check. All SEPARATE occasions. The waitress was completely dismissive, rude, and clearly did not care about the tables she was waiting. This is not atypical for this Cheesecake Factory. This quality of service happens every single time; they go above and beyond to be consistently horrible. I have never been served by someone even remotely personable or customer service oriented at this Cheesecake Factory. Cheesecake Factory should be embarrassed of this location. It is clearly in need of serious work. The quality of service is wildly negligent.<br><br>TLDR; If you are short on time/simply want to enjoy a meal within two hours time and you prefer to be waited on by someone who doesn&#39;t have an attitude, do not come here. You will not have any of those things. Not a single one. Otherwise, if you don&#39;t mind the slow service, extreme lack of attentiveness, rude/uncomfortable wait staff, questionable lack of bread, and long periods of wait time, this place is just fine. Just don&#39;t expect your drinks to be refilled. Ever. I am not exaggerating.

Deep within the dungeons of the Hancock building lies this golden treasure treat of an eatery... start on your quest to find it but beware... the dragon of popularity protects this location making it near impossible to get a chance at even looking at the menu of valuables let alone possibly sampling any of the gems this cavern holds!<br><br>Basically... this location is busy! And there is a big wait! <br><br>However we got lucky... as We donned our shinning armor and unsheathed our terrible swords... for We would be brave and fearless with a fantastic meal as our reward! <br><br>We got seated... rather quickly and our server was pretty good!We ordered and waited drooling.... <br><br>the amazing things we saw there weren&#39;t meant for mortal eyes... a thousand screaming patrons the tables filled with their cries (for more!) and the food whose smell arouse from the pots of Gods cooking with flavors from the pits of hell. (Just perfectly sinful food!)<br><br>So into the book of choices the monster we set chase (man the menu here is just huge) hoping to find that rarest of gems for that of which to stuff our face. <br><br>We were hungry and we wanted a good meal. I got the nachos, my wife the 4 cheese pasta, my oldest the kids pasta and my youngest some spaghetti. The food was excellent.<br><br>Away we scampered with out treasure chest stuffed full (the portions are pretty big) and quickly escaped on swift feet before the full on rush of the raging bull. (We kept eyeing desert but just decided we were stuffed!) our treasure secured and us in our chariot rolling away... we yelled... &#34;we will be back, you can bet on it, some soon day.&#34;<br><br>It is a great location and has great food!

A great experience.<br>Can&#39;t believe it took me so long to go to this Cheesecake Factory again and can&#39;t believe how far they managed to exceed my expectations again.<br>This is a huge Cheesecake Factory with capacity to seat several hundred people at the same time, the staff were kind and checked in on us multiple times, they also seemed to be having fun amongst themselves which is always a good sign, and the food - the definition of deliciousness. <br>We were a party of 4 and for appetizers we stared with the Kale/Brussel sprout salad with Cesar Salad and our meal consisted of the everything flat bread pizza, the Bellagio chicken and a classic burger. All these were extremely tasty to say the least, the potions were huge and the prices decent.<br>We ended our meal with a fresh strawberry cheesecake one slice of which satisfied 4 of us and all of this cost us under 150$ inclusive of the tip!<br>Incredible!
I went there with friends . We have hesrd so much about their cheesecakes. It was great . Service and food<br><br>My friends visited from  out of town and i made right decesion to take them there

The food was delicious and the servings were colossal (had leftovers for a few days), the service was good despite it being Saturday Evening and it was PACKED.<br><br>My only complaint is that I went back two times to request my mother&#39;s coat.  It was cold outside and my mother had worn two coats to the restaurant. Her Patagonia Purple Coat must have slid off the booth onto the floor-the restaurant workers including a manager said they could not &#34;find it.&#34; This was frustrating.

Very good for a chain!<br><br>I am a local resident, and I love coming here: Good prices for the portions and great selection of food, especially if you come with a large group -- everyone can find what they want. We&#39;ve been to other cheesecake factories - and this one is my favorite. <br><br>Most chicken dishes (I dont remember the names) are delicious! The cheesecakes are overpriced, but yummy!

Overall: As long as you know you&#39;re about to dine at a cheesecake factory, this location does its job well and is a great spot.<br><br>The good: All the typical fixens that come with TCF: bread, huge menu, and over-indulgent yet delicious food. We only got cheesecakes for dessert late one night, but man did it hit the spot. The peanut butter cup fudge ripple was exactly what the sweet tooth wanted, and the service was friendly and quick.<br><br>The not-so-good: Like everything at the TCF, the portions were too big. My eyes are always bigger than my stomach, so naturally I ate my whole piece and it was too much to handle. <br><br>Atmosphere: 8/10<br>Service: 9/10<br>Food: 8/10

I love coming here and getting a slice to go because it&#39;s easy and simple to go in, order, and be out within 10 minutes. The new cinnabon cheesecake stole my heart though. This was a slice of heaven, cheesecake and cinnamon roll in one dessert.

One of the worst service experiences I&#39;ve ever received. Let me start this, however, by saying that I really enjoyed the food. I ordered the factory burger, one of my favorites, and this was by far one of the best ones I&#39;ve ever had, unfortunately the service was much to be desired.<br><br>To begin with, our waiter didn&#39;t come to take our order until 15 minutes passed. Forgivable of course because things get busy sometimes. When our food came out, he stopped by to ask if my table wanted a refill on our waters, and we said yes. After this point, HE NEVER SHOWED UP AGAIN. For half an hour we waited for the water refill. My boyfriend and I looked around for him, but he never passed by our table and was instead in the other half of his section the whole time. It came to the point that we were so thirsty, my boyfriend had to take the water bottle from his own backpack to refill our glasses. Ridiculous.<br><br>We had been done eating for a good 15-20 minutes, and still, nothing. I flagged down one of the other waitresses and asked for our bill because we wanted to leave. Her response, &#34;Let me get your waiter.&#34; 10 minutes passed, nothing from him. We flagged down ANOTHER waitress for boxes and the bill who got us both in less than one minute. At that point we were very upset and informed her of our horrendous service. She asked if we wanted to speak to the manager, but honestly, we were about to leave so what was the point. Right as we were leaving our table, we finally see our waiter who apologized for being gone THE ENTIRE TIME we were there, but by then, it was way too late.<br><br>Will more than likely never come back. This experience was just ridiculous and a waste of my time. A shame since I thought the food was good.

Such disappointing service every time. I used to love going when I lived in San Francisco. This location in Chicago is well below the bar of being acceptable. <br><br>20 minute wait time for our appetizer while sitting at the bar? No attention paid; just leaves us disappointed.

I came here to meet a friend and family. I&#39;ve been here countless times, and have been rarely disappointed, but lately I only come once or 2x a year. I wonder if they are understaffed, and that&#39;s why there are SO many service issues.<br><br>We grabbed a table in the bar area, after being told it was a 20 minute wait. They have GOT to add more LIGHTS in there! I kind of know the menu, but still needed to use the flashlight on my cell phone to read it. Jacob,or server, was pleasant and helpful but a little overwhelmed. <br><br>We ordered drinks (the Cheesecake Factory private selection wine is pretty good, and I don&#39;t like Cab Savs really) but a big error occurred: one of our party ordered a prosecco, and despite the darkness, she was able to spot some orange pulp. <br>Bleh! probably left over from a mimosa. He was very apologetic but it took a while to bring the replacement as he needed a manager&#39;s signature to remove then re-ADD the drink(it should have been free or half price. Study the glasses and silverware BEFORE eating/drinking, patrons!)<br><br>The food was fine. We shared avocado egg rolls, gumbo, and key lime/mango cheesecake with macaroon crust. Our other party had a veggie burger, salmon with mashed potatoes and asparagus, chocolate mousse cheesecake, and lemon/raspberry cheesecake. <br><br>One of our party had to leave early so her bill was rang up separately with no problem. (I wish American restaurants would be better about offering separate bills; when I travel that&#39;s the first thing they ask at sit down places: &#39;separate checks&#39;??) Everything else was fine, but I wish they would lighten up the place, double check the dishes, and WHY is the upstairs room closed?

I love the Cheesecake Factory!! <br>I came here for dinner with my boyfriend whom was starving. Sadly, we waited about an hour for our food to be placed at our table. <br>I always order the Louisiana Chicken Pasta and my boyfriend ordered Miso Salmon. Of course, when our food finally arrived, everything was delicious! <br>Our waiter, Crystal, was very generous and kind. I also love that the Cheesecake is wheelchair accessible, since I am wheelchair bound. <br>Overall, we left content.

The Cheesecake Factory has lost its mojo and based on the food, I have to wonder if this particular TCF is going under. We&#39;ve been to the Oakbrook CF twice and this one in the past month. All three visits were so below par I can&#39;t give more than a 1 star. Last night at Michigan Ave our fried Calamari appetizer was cold. They brought another after we were halfway through our meal. It too was cold AND it looked like they had scraped the bottom of the calamari supply. The pieces were few, tiny, dry, and AGAIN cold. <br><br>My Thai Lettuce wraps had 3 tiny bits of grisly rubbery chicken. I order this EVERY TIME I go to a Cheesecake Factory. There is supposed to be 5-6 pieces. <br><br>My Old Fashioned was so watery it wasn&#39;t even a light brown. It looked more like my husbands Chardonnay (which was missing half the pour). What kind of Old Fashioned isn&#39;t a dark brown? There was no orange peel or mottled bitters as promised by the waiter. <br><br>The only good part of our visit was the service. Our waiter was above average. <br><br>Our love affair with The Cheesecake Factory is over.

This is not a review for in restaurant dining. We just ordered takeout.<br><br>The food was ready on time and tasted great. The only issue we had was the line to pick it up at the bakery. After standing in line for 15 min, we went to the bar to get help instead. If your going to combine bakery and order pickup or any services, that position should be adequately staffed.

Honestly did not enjoy my meal. This place is so famous, but food a tad subpar. The cheesecake is ABSOLUTELY worth it, but not the food. The chicken tortilla soup was pretty bad, along with the chicken salad sandwich :/ The salad had an incredibly putrid smell to it. Very nice bartender though, and surprisingly good service considering the insane amount of people there.

Don&#39;t waste your time. This has to be the WORST Cheesecake Factory restaurant in the world. The food took forever and it was substandard at best.<br>The kitchen staff has no respect for the quality of food they prepare. Our food should have never been served in its condition.

While the cheesecakes are good (too sweet for some but you are eating cheesecake and not broccoli..) the reminder of the menu is dreadful... we visited on a Friday and the staff was great  and friendly. We order calamari spinach dip and sliders for starters, then we had the fish and chips, jamaican shrimps and the fish tacos... <br>It was a nightmare.. you could know right away that all foods were frozen before...  the fish had no taste at all and was as chewy as a card board.. the calamari was more of the breading than the fish and honestly the taste was that of a low quality frozen and heated in the microwave taste. The jamaican shrimps were so sweet to hide the taste that it was hurting my brain to eat it.. the cheesecake we had for desert was less sweet... the spinach dip was still watery from the unfreeze... <br><br>Overall I would say it was the worst restaurant experience I had in Chicago and I have seen my share of weird places.. <br><br>Note: the cheesecake was fine. Or maybe we were so disgusted and hungry after the horrible meal that a half descent desert tasted like 3 star Michelin desert...

Who doesn&#39;t love a good cheesecake after a pizza dinner? At least that is what 4 out of the 6 of us thought after we enjoyed a Chicago style pizza in Avondale, Illinois. We hopped in an Uber and ventured to the Magnificent mile to walk to the Cheesecake Factory at the John Hancock Center.<br><br>Once there, we drooled over the selections in the display cases as you walk in. We went to put in our name and they had a table ready for us at 9pm. We ordered some cocktails and waters all around. After perusing the extensive list of 33 types of cheesecake and 9 other specialty desserts we made our choices.<br><br>We ordered the Original cheesecake &#34;The one that started it all,&#34; the Adam&#39;s peanut butter cup fudge ripple, the Reese&#39;s peanut butter chocolate cake cheesecake and last but definitely not least...Craig&#39;s Crazy Carrot cake Cheesecake. We all sampled each other&#39;s so people could try cakes they had never ordered and only two of us could finish the cakes. Thank goodness for togo containers! <br><br>Always a 5/5 for the cheese cakes and the service was exceptional and very attentive 5/5.

Clown show at the hostess stand (as usual).  We come to Chicago regularly and this place is located across the street from the American girl store.  Lovely day outside with sun.  They have seating outside with umbrellas for shade. They insist on seating people in order of table opening outside. There were 4 - 5 tables needing busing then they were ready.  They first get to our group of 3 and sit us in table in sun without shade.  I asked if we could get anyone of the other 4 tables that were in shade.   After an eye roll and extensive discussion on how this could work they reluctant gave us table in shade.  <br><br>Roll forward the next 4-5 groups who rolled through with similar situation. One group were told they could. It be seated at one of the 4 other tables in shade as people would be seated behind them on list in those tables.  This group looked confused that a groups behind them in line would get the table that was clearly available.  After a uncomfortable discussion with the host the group elected to not be seated and leave.  However after a few moments they were returned back to a shaded table.  <br><br>This happened another 2 times until one group finally accepted the table.  <br><br>At what point does the Manager or GM or this large restaurant take some leadership and up train the staff to use common sense and customer service proactive engagement for satisfaction before having the diner start in a negative position.  <br><br>Admittedly the hostess team were not likely the highest on the pecking order for decision making capacity or permission. I suspect they are just doing exactly what the protocol calls for regardless of situation and customer service needs.  To be frank they are killing the wait staff on tips as this starts the diner already upset.

The &#34;Drake Effect&#34; brought me to Cheesecake. I now understand why he loves to go here.<br><br>The menu is incomprehensively vast. None of the food tastes like it was frozen. You get phenomenal bang for your buck and don&#39;t have to worry about running into any of your friends from West Loop. Service was decent.

This is The Worst customer service experience I&#39;ve ever had. starting from the host to the server, <br>ther food used to be good years ago not anymore the place hasn&#39;t been re-done in 20 years I feel like it&#39;s falling apart

This was our first time to visit The Cheesecake Factory. We had lunch and then had to run to catch our boat tour so we had to go back after the tour for the Cheesecake. This place won&#39;t disappoint. Food was great and the Cheesecake gave me the shivers. I fixed that with 2 double espressos. Perfect end to an great day.
Really poor customer service. The manager was super rude when we complained about the food quality.

TOUCHDOWN!<br>We flat out love this place and could not wait to try it. My wife and I grabbed dinner here while I was in Chicago on a business trip (it happened to be next door to our hotel). <br><br>The atmosphere was fun and lively with a retro decor that harkens to the 20s and 30s. The service was quick and the waitress was engaging and very nice. <br><br>There are like 6,000 items on the menu and they&#39;re ALL GOOD. I had the grilled chicken and avocado club sandwich and it was killer good! Honestly, I struggle ordering something else here. The bread was lightly toasted with a hint of butter and the chicken had great flavoring. It comes with fresh avocado, lettuce, and tomato. The sandwich itself is large and I struggled to finish it (but managed). It comes with fries which I have to say are a slight upgrade to fries I&#39;ve had elsewhere. <br><br>We absolutely will be back when we come to Chicago again.

I had an awful experience here. They really need to work on their Skinnylicious Menu. I was impressed with the calorie count and the variety of options they had. I ordered the Skinnylicious Chicken Salad Sandwich and substituted the garden salad with the skinny Caesar. The food took a while even though it was a Thursday at 2PM, and the place was fairly empty, but that&#39;s not a problem.<br><br>The biggest problem was the food. The chicken salad was basically chicken bones mixed with mayonnaise and topped with lettuce and tomatoes. I could&#39;ve broken a tooth. The only reason why I&#39;m giving 3 stars is because our waiter was extremely understanding and took the meal off our bill (also because I only took one bite and couldn&#39;t bare to finish the rest). <br><br>I&#39;ve been to The Cheesecake Factory numerous times. The first few times, it was pretty decent, but the last couple of times that I&#39;ve been here, it&#39;s just gone downhill.

My second time at The Cheesecake Factory and it was overall a good experience. I went with a group of 6 people on a Monday for lunch and we still had to wait in line for food - For me, busy restaurant means good food, so we waited.<br><br>Our waitress took at least 30 min after we sat to bring our bread/butter (I actually had to ask another waitress to tell our waitress to bring it to us) - not good. The bread itself was tasty!<br><br>I ordered from the Skinnylicious menu and I can tell you already - DO NOT DO IT, small portions. I had the Turkey Avocado Sandwich with a side salad, even though it tasted ok, it was a small portion. Next time I&#39;ll just order the regular turkey sandwich and make sure I&#39;ll just eat half. I wouldn&#39;t order it again.<br><br>My friend had the Shrimp Chicken with Rice and she shared it with her mom. They both enjoyed it and said they&#39;d order again. Another friend had the lunch special Salmon with mashed potatoes and broccoli - regular size meal (she said it was good).<br><br>DESSERT:<br>- The Godiva Brownie Sunday - it looked great but the brownie was hard and it was just OK. (So not worth it)<br>- White Chocolate Macadamia Cheesecake - sweet and delicious<br>- Lemon Raspberry Cheesecake - sweet and sour and delicious

Nice location in downtown Chicago. This spot is underneath ground level which is pretty cool. We sat on the patio and our server was great. I had the blackened salmon with garlic mashed potatoes and broccoli. My wife had the vegetarian lasagna. The bread kept coming and our drinks stayed filled. Great experience!
The flavor of the crispy crab bites was very good, but the texture was mushy.  I would have preferred a fresher taste.

I never eat at chain restaurants but I was at the Broadway Playhouse and STARVING after the show. It was kind of cold out and I didn&#39;t feel like wandering around so I crossed the street and was quickly seated at a small booth in the bar area. <br><br>I wish I could recall my server&#39;s name because he was wonderful! He had quite a few tables going but he never seemed frazzled. I just had some of their Factory Nachos with chicken but the menu is roughly the size of an encyclopedia; I can&#39;t imagine anyone having a problem finding something that they&#39;d like. Their nachos are awesome- perfect ratio of toppings to chips, nice cheese sauce as well as some shredded cheese and pickled jalapenos which I LOVE on nachos. <br><br>I didn&#39;t get any cheesecake because I had been to Sprinkles before the show so I had sweets waiting for me. I don&#39;t know that I would go out of my way for The Cheesecake Factory but I thoroughly enjoyed my visit and would definitely come back if I was in the area again.

After receiving a response from The Cheesecake Factory I have lowered my rating to 1 star. It obvious they don&#39;t comprehend the problem at this location.<br>It all comes down to management and their inability to correct the problems in the kitchen. A manager brought us our food.<br><br>The original review is below.<br>It took an unusually long time (about 45 to 50 minutes) to receive our order. We had ordered an appetizer of sliders to share as an evening snack. The &#34;sliders&#34; we received should have been called &#34;cinders in scorched buns&#34;.  We had requested cheese to be added to the sliders. We received what looked like one slice of American cheese quartered and put on cold as an afterthought. The sliders were supposed to have grilled onions; someone in the kitchen forgot that.  In any context, it was a sorry excuse for a meal.<br><br>I&#39;m glad this wasn&#39;t my destination restaurant for our visit to Chicago. The Cheesecake Factory has a standard of quality to protect. Unfortunately, this location has a major problem achieving the consistency we expected, an especially dangerous liability considering their location in the &#34;Magnificent Mile&#34;.

We got here at 7:30.. Didnt get our food (2 people) until 8:50 only to have it come out cold and not the correct meal we ordered. We saw the server maybe 2 times and I had to get up and ask a host for a manager at 9:10 because the server never came back. Use to love this place and always had fast service but now it&#39;s really going downhill. Also there was no wait and a bunch of open tables so their was no excuse for it taking so long.

In case you&#39;re looking for a short novel to read, come here and look at their menu.<br><br>Food isn&#39;t amazing but it&#39;s above average for a chain restaurant. Large proportions. And if you like cheesecake, you should definitely get a slice. Its not necessarily different from anyone else&#39;s cheesecake but it&#39;s still satisfying.

Let me start off by saying I love Cheesecake Factory and the food is always amazing, so my only slight issue was that the waitress just seemed like she couldn&#39;t be bothered  with us and that was faIrly frustrating but over  all awesome food.

Service was good and quick for cheesecake to go. A wide variety. Typical amount I&#39;d expect to pay for a slice of cheesecake. I got the salted caramel. I&#39;m typically a fan of salted caramel anyways so of course I liked it. I would try another option next time around though, for variety-sake.
My favorite chain restaurant! There isn&#39;t one near me, but while in Chicago last week, I made sure to find one and had my favorite dish, Pasta da Vinci. It was everything I expected and more!

I went here for a mother&#39;s  daughter brunch on a Sunday , the place was a little crowded but we were seated quickly.  The over all experience was just ok. I orderd the chicken and biscuits, it was ok. The biscuits were burnt but the chicken and sauce  was ok. My guess ordered the shrimp scampi, he liked it. My mom had the steak and veggies  she loved it. We ordered cocktails they were over priced and not good. Our appetizers came out 5 minutes before our food. Make sure you check your receipt we were over charged for an item we didn&#39;t order. The waiter was ok he seemed over worked.

Just had to visit another Cheesecake Factory and this one didn&#39;t disappoint! Sat at the bar as just came here for cheesecake and prosecco.<br><br>This time I tried the tiramisu cheesecake which was lovely and light and delicious as always.
Desert= one of the simple pleasures of life. Hmmmm hmmmm good!! Pictured is key lime cheese cake, with black coffee. Oh Yeah!!!

I went for the first time for my birthday dinner and it did not sit well in my stomach. We waited 45 minutes and spent most of that time in Water tower killing time waiting. I knew I would have to wait so I wasn&#39;t bothered.<br><br>When we walked back in near the hostess, a busser asked us if we were just 2 and sat us down near the kitchen. So we didn&#39;t have to wait more. That was nice to be seated so fast.<br><br>We got bread, drinks and our food in a timely manner, but halfway through eating my food my stomach hurt and I had to run to the bathroom. I got the bow-tie pasta with chicken and it did look greasy. I wouldn&#39;t go here again. I avoided the cheesecake, too. I didn&#39;t have an appetite to eat it. For birthdays, they only decorate the dessert cheesecake plate with happy birthday and you don&#39;t even get a discount or free cheesecake. Not worth going to again. I should have avoided this chain from the start.

A group of four of us came in this past Saturday night. Our mistake was staying even though we were told there was a long wait. We were told half an hour and it ended up being around 45 minutes. There was no place to sit inside while we waited because there were so many people also waiting. We waited in the mall lobby and hoped the buzzer they gave us would work from a distance. <br><br>After it buzzed we were told to wait on the side. It felt like wherever we stood, we were in the way and were told to move again. Finally, we were led to our table.<br><br>The first thing I noticed is that this Cheesecake Factory is very cavernous and dim. Our table was sticky and the utensils were placed directly on our table. The lamp on our table had a broken bulb and it kept turning off. We waited a very long time for our server to come greet us. Actually, every time we waited for our server, we were left waiting and waiting. It was quite disappointing. I wonder how badly mismanaged this restaurant must be since it is large and maze-like. Did the server have tables on another far end of the restaurant?<br><br>The first entree I tried to order, chicken marsala with mushrooms, was actually something they could not make at the time because they had run out of some ingredients. I ordered Thai coconut-lime chicken and it was great. I just wish I hadn&#39;t waited so long for it. We ordered our cheesecake to go and I found a hair or clothing(?) fiber (not sure which but it was light colored) in my dessert when I got home. <br><br>Look, I know it was a Saturday night. I don&#39;t blame the server because I know he was just doing his job. The long wait times have to be a managerial issue. I think the kitchen is on the far end of the restaurant from where we were sitting. <br><br>I will never return to this Cheesecake Factory. If our table is ready, I expect for you to be waiting for me to come up to the host stand - NOT to be kept waiting and told to move constantly. I go to the Old Orchard Cheesecake Factory all the time and have never been so dissatisfied with how long I waited for water, drinks, food, the check, and dessert. All of the above took forever.

So yes they have tons of cheesecake.  And breakfast.  And pasta.  And salads.  And tacos.  And.  And.  And. <br>So service was quick.  Food was very good. Steak tacos and avocado salad very good.  They didn&#39;t have any meatballs for the spaghetti.  Otherwise well done.  <br><br>Decor is crazy.  Almost organic.  Like in a cartoon.   <br><br>Worth the trip. Especially if you have a family with you.  Mom and dad can get bar drinks!

Normally I am happy with the Cheesecake Factory on Michigan Ave, but this time not so. We waited 45 minutes for our drinks after two of four had gotten their drink. Bread was on the table but it got cold as I cannot eat bread without anything to drink. <br><br>Our waiter came out with a Riesling and we had to tell him this was not the sparkling wine we ordered. <br>We waited again to get the sparkling wine. That&#39;s when my husband had enough and went to get the manager In the meantime the sparkling wine had arrived. But it took us another 20 minutes to also get the sparkling water. The food arrives simultaneously. <br>We got a sincere apology from the manager, and free deserts on the house. He was serviceminded and sweet. <br>Our waiter did not bother to take the shrimp peel and breadbasket and crumbs off our table as we had the dessert so needless to say he was useless in his position. There weren&#39;t that many people there (for a change) and he should easily have managed the basic things like getting us drinks and cleaning our table.

This was a beautiful experience. My first time at the factory, and I will definitely be back. Alexi S , our server, was amazing. He was very patient and friendly. Food was delicious. Music was ambient. Memories will be cherished.

I&#39;ve came here a couple of times and the food is always great. <br>It is usually busy, yet the waiting isn&#39;t that long, it&#39;s around 5-10 minutes. The service is friendly and the waiters regularly visit your table for updates or concerns.<br>It is a lovely place .

Mediocre lunch restaurant in the 875 N Michigan building.  The Cobb salad had hard boiled eggs which were not fresh and fake bacon.  Lettuce was old.  The bathrooms were ill maintained and unclean.  Not a pleasant experience.

Mostly because the staff is rude. I asked if i could sit outside and the lady at the counter rolled her eyes and told me &#34;we&#39;re not servicing outside, if you want to sit there you need to order to-go&#34; <br><br>Had a strawberry margarita that tasted like ice without some flavoring.<br><br>The actual dish was good.

Who doesn&#39;t love the Cheesecake Factory? So many cake options to choose from. I love the vanilla bean cheesecake and Louisiana Crunch chicken. I enjoy going here to eat then I usually head up to the 99th floor (I think it is) and check out the signature lounge for great views and drinks.

I came here with my boyfriend for my birthday. Also, my first time here. It wasn&#39;t busy. Possibly 10 minutes after I got my food the waitress was checking on us at least every 5 minutes. My boyfriend finished eating before me and the waitress is acting like that means I&#39;m done too. She gave me a box and asked if we wanted dessert when I&#39;m not even done. We didn&#39;t spend over an hour here, which I&#39;m disappointed about. I felt so rushed that I didn&#39;t even finish half my food. I have a small mouth. Come on. I did take cheesecake to go though because I want to eat that in peace.

Let&#39;s start with the good part of the review first. <br>I love their complimentary bread. Distracts me from thinking about when the ordered food will come. We ordered the Luau salad. Let me tell you something, that salad was GIGANTIC AND DELICIOUS. The portion was good enough to share with 2-3 people. The second dish we ordered was the Chicken Picatta, it was good but a bit too sour for my taste (had lemon in the sauce). <br><br>As for appetizers, here comes the bad part of the review. We ordered the portabello, zucchini and avocado fries and the blue cheese pear flatbread (Pear blue cheese flatbread?). I expected shaved pears on the flatbread but instead there were this huge chunks of pears which made the flatbread disgusting or maybe it was the taste of those chunks of pears. I took all the pears out and it was a bit better.<br><br>The avocado zucchini and portabello fries, they tasted pretty good. It was hard to tell what I was eating but my mom had an incident with the dish. She took a piece and started chewing and few seconds after I see her face change and pull out something from her mouth and seconds after a second thing from her mouth as well. She found TWO pieces of wire (one was probably 5cm long and the other one was 1cm long). We were all shocked and immediately called the waiter. I was so upset because it happened to my mom and if she swallowed those pieces of wire it would have been a bigger deal. I informed the waiter we found two pieces in the food while she was eating it. He called the manager and she spoke to us. She told us she knew exactly where they were coming from (fryer baskets). <br><br>The mananger kindly apologized and offered us complimentary dessert. We didn&#39;t want to make it a huge deal since my mom was fine and it was only the shock at that moment and a lot of customers sitting around us noticed the incident, so we took a piece of cheesecake and left things that way. We asked if the item could be removed from the check since we barely touched it and her response was &#34;of course, absolutely. I will take care of that&#34;. When we asked for the check... THE APPETIZER WAS CHARGED! It was probably miscommunication but we told the server that the manager clearly stated that we were not going to have to pay for that appetizer. The server took care of it and we tipped him accordingly since the whole thing was not his (or the manager&#39;s) fault.

I am a healthcare worker in from out of town working with Covid patients. I&#39;ve been here for two weeks and I have seven weeks to go. This has got to be the absolute worst service and meal I&#39;ve had so far. I called talk to the manager Tom. And he simply said too bad so sad nothing I can do. Never dying here again! Not only am I making this post but I will put this on social media and tell all of my colleagues that are stuck in this hotel.

Great atmosphere <br><br>Great location <br><br>Great environment <br><br>Great food<br><br>Only disappointment was staff had no idea we had been seated and no idea who was supposed to serve us.  <br><br>A little unprofessional for this business which surprised us.

I always enjoy coming to this place. Weather its a special occasion or just want to have great time with friends this is my favorite spot. There complimentary chocolate bread are my favorite. Every time i try new dishes and this time i tried bistro shrimp and avocado rolls and both were very delicious. My friend ordered chicken and they were also juicy, tender and flavorful.  Apart from food the this location is very happening as compared to other in suburbs. Environment is very lively.  Its in Hancock tower and of course it has to be attractive. Every serve person we meet are very friendly and gentle. Love to come here again n again.

We came here after visiting the American Girl Doll store with our daughter. It was very busy and had to wait 15 minutes for a seat. It is downtown so we expected it to be busy. We were seated in the bar area. Personally I do not like the that the lights are too dim and it is like a maze trying to find the restrooms. We were here during lunch and it was sunnier out, so it may have played into our experience. Our service was good as he was very attentive and brought things out quickly. I really like the fresh bread specifically the brown wheat bread. I like that they have the skinny or low calorie options. I had the skinnylicious burger which was done right and tasted good. My 9 year old daughter had the kids buttered pasta with parmesan cheese. Her portion was huge and took the rest home for the next day.

Came to Cheesecake Factory from Navy pier before making our way to the Willis Tower to get a quick snack. We sat at the bar and got a couple of appetizers. Service was quick and food came out quick as well. We didn&#39;t get alcoholic drinks but even so, the bartender was pretty nice.<br>We came on a early evening Friday. Dining room was not full, but there was quite a bit of people. Based on my experience, this was a great choice to get an early snack before dinner.

We always end up here after a day of shopping at Water Tower Place and fortunately wait wasn&#39;t bad to get a table .<br><br>We ordered whole bunch of things from gumbo, chicken sliders, eggplant parmesan, pasta and chicken with couscous. I didn&#39;t get any pictures because my phone was out of battery ...everything tasted okay but I wasn&#39;t happy with our servers attitude. Not nice at all!!

If you like Cheesecake Factory dishes don&#39;t go there !!!! Go somewhere else !!! The food maybe ok but customer service 000000 they don&#39;t know how to to it !!! We had a dinner with my girlfriends and the man and women at the reception are so rude OMG I had a baby and he was crying I asked them maybe I&#39;ll sit next to window and they said they can&#39;t I have to wait like 20 min more but I saw the empty tables near the window !!! They were so rude I would never go to this place maybe different Cheesecake Factory but not this ONE

I brought my wife &amp; mother in law here for a birthday brunch. Our waitress was Angela and she was amazing. Made our experience pleasant, despite the rainy, gloomy day outside. Will return &amp; recommend!

We arrived at 4:50. Seated 5:10. Not bad especially for Saturday. Food didn&#39;t arrive until 6:45.  Waiter didn&#39;t check on us for at least a half a hour. My fish tacos had been sitting for awhile somewhere and now lukewarm. My bfs pork chop/mashed potatoes/green beans were hot and delicious!  Dirty dishes took 30 min to clear and cheesecakes another 15. Really ridiculous timeframes. Table behind us ordered after us, same waiter but received food and dessert and were gone before we even received our food. Boo.
Grabbed some food to go. Ordered chicken tenders and fries. Was disappointed they didn&#39;t give me my fries had to return after I left to get my fries but once I got my fries they were fresh
last visit was a desaster<br>i order the asian tacos  whit chicken <br>the chicken was raw<br>the server give me a free slice of vanilla cheesecake and i just  pay for my coffee

This Cheesecake Factory on Michigan Avenue is really something. Don&#39;t get me wrong, having a nearby Cheesecake Factory with its massive menu and variety of food can really come in handy to quench whatever your fix is at any given moment. Unfortunately, I came here with my wife and nothing about the experience was delightful. <br><br>After being seated we didn&#39;t get bread, we asked for it, three times, to three different waiters and eventually got it. I waited over an hour for my food to come out. The manager said only a few more minutes, which turned into 20 more. When the food finally came out, the teriyaki chicken was undercooked and filled with crunchy tendons, gross! This was not farm to table...how about frozen dinner to table, anyone?<br><br>Ultimately, the manager did everything he could to rectify the situation but the damage was done. I know the restaurant can get quite busy but a restaurant must, always, do their utmost to be attentive to their customers and, follow through with what they say. I ended up getting the chicken pineapple salad, which was pretty tasty. But again, I really can&#39;t get over the lack of quality service here, much room for improvement!

My husband was a really, really hungry.  We stopped in and they seated us within 10 minutes. Our server, Mike was great!  He was very well mannered and knew the menú very well - all 20 pages of it!<br><br>I&#39;m a picky eater, and yes for someone who doesn&#39;t like creamy foods, I should not be where the name of the establishment has the word &#34;cheese&#34; in it, but my husband was really hungry and we had just left the observatory at the Water Tower, The Cheesecake Factory was right next door. <br><br>Mike understood my food quarks, and suggested the &#34;Diana Dine&#34; and it was delicious!!!<br><br>Mike was absolutely outstanding!!!

Updating my review now bc of the corona virus outbreak here in Chicago. Cheesecake Factory has closed it doors and left their staff with nothing. These poor employees had to cash out any pto time they have and use that or just file for unemployment. I understand it&#39;s harder for small business owners but for company like this with an owners net worth of 88.2 million dollars it&#39;s disgusting! The GM on this location is trash and has no compassion for his team. I know several employees from here and my hearts go out to them. This company is an absolute disgrace

I am so very disappointed that this restaurant has basically gone down the tubes.  The service is good, but the good quality and taste declines with each visit.  I must say that I cannot return.  I don&#39;t know what happened. This used to be a happening spot where the wait could range from 1 to 3 hours.

They accommodated a day-of group of 35 for us. Amazing customer service. My man Ro held the fort down for 35 orders, hero!<br><br>Clean and busy. 5 stars for location and appearance of restaurant.<br><br>5 stars for taste of food. <br><br>Park in the Hancock tower parking and they&#39;ll validate it down to $15 for 3 hours. Major key.
Great place stopped in for a piece of cheesecake and ended up eat dinner really good food !

The bathrooms are bad and very outdated. The restaurant needs to partner with the Hancock building and immediately paint the entrance door to the women&#39;s bathroom; the paint is peeling off. It looks horrible. <br><br>Sunday brunch was a big disappointment. I ordered the waffles with strawberries, pecans and cream. The chef forgot the cream. They brought back the plate with drizzles of cream on top. Very disappointing. Nothing special at all. The waiter forgot to bring my husband&#39;s Monte Carlo sandwich. At the end we were glad he did because the pancakes, eggs and sausage we ordered was just ok. I was amused to see the chef walk around the restaurant given our meals. <br><br>My mother&#39;s salmon was good and the cheesecake was delicious. Overall we were very disappointed because the restaurant did not come close to our expectations based on previous visits. We&#39;ll skip brunch going forward.

The Cheesecake Factory has always been the ultimate high school date place. <br><br>Pros: <br>- Obviously the Cheesecake! I&#39;m a fan of all the cheesecakes that incorporate some type of chocolate cake. <br>- The restaurant is huge so the wait is not as long as it may seem when you walk into the place. On a busy Saturday my friend and I only had to wait between 20 to 30 minutes. <br>- The employees, from the waiters to the busboys, here always seem to maintain a positive attitude even when they are obviously swamped with the amount of tables they have to juggle<br>- Depending on what you order you can get a large meal that is probably at minimum two servings for a reasonable price. <br><br>Cons: <br>- This location it&#39;s always packed with tourist so you&#39;re always guaranteed to wait no matter the time of date. <br>- If it wasn&#39;t for the Cheesecake I don&#39;t think anyone over 18 would eat here. The food quality is sub par at best so they give you a serving size that could feed a family of 4. <br>- Due to this location always being so busy you always have a 50/50 chance of your food being cold. My friend and I was excited for our fries to arrive and when they finally did the fries were ice cold. The plate was hotter than everything that I ordered.

Today I went to the Cheese Cake Factory to Celebrate My 51st birthday and IT WAS HORRIBLE!!! I went for the Cat fish only to find out they no longer serve it and the waiter was unhelpful and could not tell me anything about the other entres. I WAS SO DISAPPOINTED and I could not believe I spent money on THE WORSE MEAL I HAVE EVER HAD!!! I will never go back to The Cheese Cake Factory!!! What a horrible Birthday dinner!!!<br>I had the Salmon and Steak for $20 and the Steak was horrible. I must admit the Salmon was great but for the price the dinner was horrible. I spent $90 and the BEST thing was the Cheese Cake. So disappointed!!!

Prepare yourself for this tourist haven.  It&#39;s loud, hectic and dark due to the location in a below-grade plaza.  There are times I&#39;ve gone in here, and the wait was over an hour.  Today, I got right in.  The ambiance is dark, with a distinctive Alice in Wonderland feel to all the curvy columns and bubbly ceiling.<br><br>The food wasn&#39;t bad.  Three mini loaves of bread as a start.  The sweet corn tamale cakes were a nice appetizer.  The lunch special was a little bit of a letdown since they were out of turkey.  The Renee&#39;s Special chicken-almond salad sandwich was salty, and the small ciabatta it came on was dry.  The side Caesar salad was fine, and the tomato-shrimp soup was thick and tasty.<br><br>Our waitress was overwhelmed (aren&#39;t they always at big family places like these?), but she was very nice and kept the drinks flowing.

Well to be honest I visited many branches of the Cheesecake Factory resturant in Jeddah and Bahrain it was different. What I don&#39;t like is the table is so small and close to each other but the food taste was good.

This one hurts a bit - but here we go...<br><br>The CCF is a staple, a tried and true, a vet amount rookies, etc. my last visit however, not the case. My wife and I have been going to CCFs for years. This most recent visit was the worst. Our server was rude, slow and inattentive. The food was brought out wrong and it was as if she felt that was my fault. <br><br>When I asked for them to remake it - (Cobb salad sans avocado) she rolled her eyes harder than a teenage girl in a disagreement with her mom about her going-out-outfit. <br><br>When asking for the check the eye roll came back and she took my card and did not return for 10 minutes. Almost out of spite (I get that kind of reaction from most women).<br><br>I&#39;ll still be back because I&#39;m a sucker for cheesecake and have no moral principles. BUT I&#39;m a millennial so I&#39;m gonna bitch and complain while not doing anything about it!

Haven&#39;t had a problem with the food at all. In fact, I love their cheesecake. The problem here starts with the servers. I get that it&#39;s stressful and they&#39;re tired but there is absolutely no need to snap at customers when they ask for something simple like, &#34;Can I have more bread?&#34; It was a simple question and i didn&#39;t expect the server to yell at me the way that he did, and then come back to tell me something again. I hadn&#39;t had a problem with any of the waiters before but this one was particularly rude. I spoke with management (Darren) and while he was nice enough to have a different waiter help me I still can&#39;t say I&#39;m feeling like I want to come back after that experience. Also, this is on a Sunday not a huge crowd in fact, no wait at all.

I came here on Friday around 6pm and was seated immediately. I&#39;ve been to other Cheesecake Factories in other states so I expected a wait so that was pleasantly surprising! It was pretty busy, though.<br><br>We had a table of 4 and ordered a round of drinks, like I said it was busy so it took about 30 minutes for our drinks to come out. The server apologized for the delay so that was nice for that to be acknowledged.<br><br>We ordered the pretzel bites and the spinach dip for appetizers. The cheese dip was cold for the pretzel bites but they were DELICIOUS regardless so we didn&#39;t want to complain. The spinach dip was sub par, it was 98% spinach which was fine. It was just not very dip-like, it was just soggy sautéed spinach with chips essentially. <br><br>The food took a while to come. Id say about 30-45 minutes maybe. I got the Honey-truffle chicken which was a fantastic choice! Very high quality chicken with a crisp. Others at the table all got pasta dishes that were very large servings. It&#39;s spendy here but you get a lot of food!!<br><br>Our waiter Brandon, despite the busyness, was very nice and attentive with the water. I give him 5 stars! <br><br>The cheesecake is hands down the best cheese cake I&#39;ve ever had! Chocolate chip cookie dough is what I always get!

Stopped by for lunch with a friend and were seated right away. After sitting for a couple minutes (nothing inordinately long) the waitress comes by with some waters and takes our drink order, also asking if we were ready to order. I had a salad, my friend had a soup/sandwich combo, and my other friend had a burger, ordered as medium. We waited 45 minutes for our food, while other people around us were seated after and got their food before us. The waitress walked by multiple times looking at our table but never saying a word. When the food finally arrived, my friend bit into the burger and it was rare. Not medium, not medium rare, but rare. We flagged the manager down, showed him the burger and asked what temperature he thought it was cooked to. He looked perplexed and said &#34;medium.&#34; My friend said, &#34;Really? You don&#39;t think that is rare?&#34; And the man proceeded to shrug his shoulders and say &#34;I don&#39;t know what you want me to do.&#34; No joke. I wish someone would have taken a picture of my facial expression. I was stunned. He offered to take the burger and cook it further, but my friend declined, as she explained to him it already took 45 minutes for us to receive it the first time. The manager literally just stood there acting as if he couldn&#39;t be bothered with this. I said, &#34;Well, you&#39;re standards must be different than other restaurants.&#34; He just looked at us wide eyed and made no apology. He did ask however if I wanted more soda. <br>The waitress finally came back around after being m.i.a. for quite some time saying that she would bring us more drinks, not asking if we wanted more. She comes back with a tray FULL of beverages but stops at another table, sets the tray down and proceeded to take an order at another table. Then she takes the drinks to all the other surrounding diners before us. Comes to our table and asks, &#34;Do you want more to drink?&#34; I reply with a &#34;No thank you.&#34; Keep in mind the drinks were on the tray! And she said she was going to bring us more. My friend asks for the check. At no point did she offer up an apology for how long the food took, or asked about the burger...nothing. Just a slap of the check on the table without any comment, not even a f*ck you. <br>Needless to say I will never be back and hope the manager learns some serious customer service skills. And I truly hope if The Cheesecake Factory people read this, you legitimately do something  with your staff. They were horrendous.

The BATHROOM is DISGUSTING! Pools of standing water in the stall I went into, wet &amp; dry paper towels everywhere, over flowing garbage can. Sink facet would not stay on. Hello communicable disease.<br><br>I mentioned this to the manager (only guy with a tie on a 96 degree saturday... easy guess) he was busy chatting with workers, stopped to to nod &amp; frown his concern &amp; went back to his no doubt deeply intense gossip time. Before we left I went back into the ladies room... zero change. So I can just imagine the conditions in the kitchen... &amp; I ate here. Whelp it&#39;s always nice to lose a lb or two, though food poisoning isn&#39;t the best way. Fun FYI tip to Chicago visitors - Northwestern&#39;s emergency room is on Huron.<br><br>We sat at an outside table whose previous occupants probably had quinoa as much of it was still on the table. No new napkins or silver ware - we had to ask - just a sticky table. <br><br>I&#39;m neighborhood &amp; would have suggested better elsewhere but family wanted to go here. <br><br>I know they don&#39;t care from the never ending flow of tourists - but ick, ick, ick! Sooooo many better quality &amp; hygienic restaurants in the area.

If I had to recommend one dish, it would be the Chicken Madeira! Literally the best thing ever. They also have the best mashed potatoes I&#39;ve had, and the combination of the chicken, sauce and asparagus is just so good, you can&#39;t go wrong with this. The chicken is always perfectly cooked. This is my go-to order every time!<br>Had the chicken taquitos appetizer, and it was really nice. Very crispy and leave you wanting more.<br>We also had another chicken dish, but I don&#39;t remember the name. My sister had one of the peanut butter flavored cheesecakes, and said it was really good, but also too heavy. She had to save some for later.<br>The brown bread they serve when you arrive is so warm and is probably bread goals. Its got a perfect subtle tinge of something sweet which probably comes from some chocolate. I asked for extra and the server happily got me some. I also bought 3 whole baguettes from the bakery before leaving!
I just love that you can get slices to go. If you want to go for a meal, go early on a Saturday for brunch. There were plenty of open tables.

SERVICE: <br>Annalise is a beast. She is the fastest bartender I&#39;ve ever seen. Actually i don&#39;t think I even saw her. She was mostly just a blur... making drinks for servers, for everyone at the bar, and taking orders from the bar swiftly and accurately. She even had time to joke with servers and be a generally positive person. If I were put in that kind of situation, I would be barking at everyone. <br><br>FOOD:<br>The eggroll sampler is the most poppingest menu item at Cheesecake. I&#39;m a fan of chain restaurant food. It&#39;s taken me a long time to get to the point of openly admitting it, but here I am. And I&#39;m proud. <br><br>DRINKS: <br>Drinks come out fast at the bar. Again, this is probably more of an Annalise thing, than an establishment thing.

So we went for lunchtime on a Sunday. Got seated right away but our server took a hot minute to actually come acknowledge that we were there. So we sat there without water, menus or anything for a good 10 minutes I would say.  We ordered the avocado egg rolls (you can never go wrong with them). Then my girlfriend and I split a large southwest salad which was alright but didn&#39;t compare to other SW salads I&#39;ve had before. Was kinda disappointed and expected more. We also got the beer battered fish tacos that were super bomb. Made up for the salad. However we than got two pieces of cheesecake, for for Then and one for later and they server forgot silverware and we stared at the piece for a good 5 minutes. After digging in the piece was so small and they put so much whip cream to cover the fact they had made the pieces smaller and didn&#39;t change the price. Honestly was so disappointed with the size of the slice it wasn&#39;t even worth getting them next time. Overall, wasn&#39;t bad but the slices of the cheesecakes now is utterly crap and not worth the $9+

I always like the food at the cheesecake factory and this one was great too however the person I was with got a veggie burger that she said had no flavor.  I had the lunch sized salmon and it was very tasty.  The decor in this place was over the top. It reminded me of the kids Aladdin movie. The restrooms were clean and service was good.

Would give this location 0 starts if I could. Came in for lunch on a busy Saturday afternoon. Was seated in a position where we could see the kitchen area from our booth. Witnessed very very GROSS and disturbing things occur. <br><br>One waitress was walking around eating bread over top of a customers plate (as crumbs were falling onto it). <br><br>As the chef put two plates up on the counter another waitress looked at them, must have noticed that one plate had more fries than the other and she used her bare hands to grab fries off of one plate and transfer them to another. <br><br>Silverware on the table had food on them when we arrived as well. <br><br>I had no appetite and did not end up eating my meal. Notified the manager of these things and he barely apologized and did not comp us in any way. Needless to say we will not be back here.

This is my absolute favorite Cheesecake Factory location- it&#39;s the one that I grew up with. The interior is really cool and unique, and it&#39;s nostalgic for me. It&#39;s always a pleasant treat for me when I get to go there.<br><br>Like other Cheesecake factories, the menu is huge, and the portions are too. You better come hungry, because the food is ridiculous. It&#39;s a little bit pricey, but it&#39;s worth it considering you pretty much get two meals out of it. Plus, the honey wheat brown bread is amazing all on its own, and it comes free to the table. The service is always great at this location- they&#39;re always working fast and hard, and are always friendly. <br><br>Most recently, I went with two of my friends. We started with an appetizer, the Parmesan-Garlic Cheese Bread. It was unexpectedly awesome. It was super cheesy and garlicky, and is one of the best garlic breads I&#39;ve ever had. I&#39;d definitely order it again. One friend ordered the  Grilled Pork Chop with applesauce, mashed potatoes, and spinach. He devoured it, and thought it was exceptional. The other friend ordered the Fried Shrimp Platter, which is the only thing she ever orders there, so she thought it was great. I ordered my favorite Chicken Madeira, which was delicious as always.<br><br>Naturally, we also ordered cheesecake. Both of my friends ordered Fresh Strawberry cheesecake and really enjoyed it. I got the Mango Key Lime Cheesecake. It was pretty good, but I don&#39;t think I&#39;d order it again. It was too tart for me.

There cheesecakes are mouth watering...so many different flavor to chose. There foods are unbelievable large in size and you will need a box. The environment is nice and cozy...a little pack day to day. There is no valet parking you will need to park on the street.

Me and my brother waited for 30 min for a table although we saw lots of empty tables for us to sit, the food was ok but we had to wait for another 30 min for our main course.<br>Very disappointing, don&#39;t think I&#39;m gonna eat here again.

My food is terrible! <br><br>There is absolutely no seasoning on my food. Completely bland!<br><br>Recommendation: use seasoning ! I do not care about having decorated food if it&#39;s disgusting. Looks good but tastes bad.

I&#39;ve been to cheesecake factories all over, but this one is just cool. It has an awesome view and ambiance. And as always, the food is always great. Our server Ashley was also super nice and helpful.

I visited this location for my 21st birthday, and OMG I was blown away by the decor of the resturant. <br><br>The lights were perfectly dimmed. The light fixtures and seats were all a perfect bronze color. I was just breathless with just the overall appearance of the resturant. <br><br>I can&#39;t remember what I ordered, but I remember the food tasting so good. Once the food touched my pallet I decided that The Cheesecake Factory would be my favorite resturant, forever. <br><br>The waiter, hostess, the manager, and everyone were so pleasant. The service made everything a great experience. I really appreciated being treated nicely by the resturant staff. <br><br>Oh...and the cheesecake was phenomenal. I ordered the oreo cheesecake, and OMG I was speechless. Never, have I ever, experienced cheesecake like this before. <br><br>This location has got to be my favorite location. I&#39;m so glad that I got to experience this place for my 21st birthday.

Yes, it is National Cheesecake Day which calls for longer waits and more business. Luckily, my mother and I grabbed a table in the bar section (first come/first serve) within about 10 minutes of arriving. <br><br>SERVICE: BAD! Our waiter seemed to be out of it. Every time we asked for something he forgot. It would take 2-3 times asking or having to ask another sever before getting something. <br><br>FOOD: I ordered a Kid&#39;s gluten-free pasta with Alfredo. My mother had Spaghetti with Meatball which she liked. When my pasta came out it was not done with a hard texture. I know GF has a different texture but this was terrible! I sent it back and within 10-15mins I had a fresh bowl. This was somewhat better but not the best GF pasta I have had. Thankfully the manager took off my pasta!<br><br>CHEESECAKE: This restaurant has one cheesecake that is currently gluten-free: Godiva Chocolate. It is delicious and definitely the best part of the meal. Also, because it is National Cheesecake Day it was half-price! <br><br>I would recommend skipping the food and maybe going for dessert. You can also just order the cheesecake To-Go through the bakery.

Service took absolutely forever! The salmon was cooked perfectly but from the time we walked into this extremely dim lit place, the waiting began. We never got drinks refills and the server was nowhere to be found. We actually had to track down the server to get our check as it took us awhile even for that. I like this chain and love Grand Lux Cafe, but this place is not for me.
Dirty bathrooms... poor service half the family give. Food then the other after 8 min by the time ours was cold. Long waiting nowhere to sit comfortably to wait, slippery floors!
It is a very nice restaurant! I have been to Chicago for one year but this is the first time I came here! Amazing! The decoration is good, so does the service!

Stopped here on our way to iO Theatre.  This restaurant is fantastic!  The portions were huge and reasonably priced, the wait time was non-existent and the staff were very pleasant and attentive.  It was packed, but it was a Friday night so that was to be expected.  10/10 would recommend!

I know this is a national chain, but I gotta say it&#39;s pretty darn good, prices are a little expensive but you get so much food for it. Also their menu is so huge and vast, with so many different options. I got the grilled chicken and avocado sandwich, but there were easily 5 other things I could have gotten. As for the cheesecake, there are so many different flavors that look so good, I could have gotten at least 10 that I liked, but I ended up with the cookie dough slice. Everything tasted very good, and there&#39;s enough on the menu to warrant me coming back multiple times in the future. Also the designs on the inside are cool
Pot sticker app was very good. Crab dip was amazing as well food over all was really good and the drinks were amazing. The best thing I like they have diet menu as the call it skinnylicious menu.

I went there with my kids on Spring Break, staying at a nearby hotel, and our hotel didn&#39;t have room service that night, so we just wanted to walk over and grab some dinner.  <br><br>The kids got antsy waiting for a table, so I asked the lady at the desk if we could get our order to go, and she said I had to order at the bakery counter, so I did.<br><br>I ordred and we waited and waited ... and waited ... I kept asking if it was ready yet, because the kids were even more antsy at this point, and now it started raining.<br><br>He then decided to tell me that it takes at least 30 minutes!!!!<br><br>I was livid.<br><br>In all the time we were waiting, we could have gotten seated and ordered our food.  <br><br>I called for the manager.<br><br>I told him what happened and that the lady should NOT have sent me up to the bakery if it was going to take that long, and I couldn&#39;t believe his response ... he goes ...<br><br>&#34;Well, they don&#39;t have computers over there.&#34;<br><br>Um ... hello, really?  They had a screen they were looking at when they were attempting to seat us.<br><br>I don&#39;t think so.<br><br>Never again.<br><br>40 minutes later ... got our food ... had to walk back to our hotel in the rain.<br><br>Thanks for the great customer service, Cheesecake Factory.  Thanks for the great Spring Break memory of their first time there.<br><br>My kids and I will never go there again.
Nice portions, good food, good ambience, great service. I highly recommend the warm crab artichoke dip appetizer.

I always enjoy coming here to have my favorite Shrimp scampi dish and a slice of key lime cheesecake.   First off our waiter was not a normal State .  He seemed rushed and not at ease at all which made me ill at ease .  Secondly my dish was not hot .  It was barely warm, but I did eat some of it .  It would have been my usual shrimp scampi I love if it were hot . Unfortunately I didn&#39;t even want to be there anymore we paid our tab and left .  Tragic.

I really wanted two slices of cheesecake for my birthday tomorrow. Since we were only two blocks away and I have my final tomorrow, my boyfriend and I decided to stop by today to get them. <br><br>The cashier wasn&#39;t friendly, or welcoming. She was blah and like a robot doing her job. She could&#39;ve been nicer. But whatever, maybe she was there all day?<br><br>They gave me a crumbled slice of cheesecake, and the other was a small slice. When my boyfriend asked the cashier about the slices, Paola, the cashier, said &#34;Maybe this one&#34; and took the slice that wasn&#39;t crumbled and exchanged it for a slightly bigger piece. My boyfriend spent nearly $20 on two small pieces of cheesecake, and there wasn&#39;t an apology or understanding or anything.<br><br>The lemon raspberry cheesecake is ehhh. Do not recommend. The bottom was a little soggy and while it has an acceptable lemon flavor, so does the raspberry sauce on it. Could&#39;ve tasted the actual raspberry part of it more. 1/5<br><br>The white chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake is bomb. We get it every time we stop by. The raspberry and white chocolate work amazingly together, and while the raspberry is a bit tart, the flavor really comes out. 5/5<br><br>The white chocolate raspberry cheesecake is why they&#39;re getting two stars. Wish I could give 2.5, but for the service I&#39;m rounding down.

I seriously love the cheesecake factory! I have not been to cheesecake since I have lived downtown ( 2 years or so). but I woke up in the morning and all I wanted was a chicken caesar salad from the Cheesecake Factory, and now it was my mission. <br><br>I came for dinner with a friend on Friday and it wasn&#39;t super busy ( we were expecting an hour plus wait) there was a table ready but we opted in for sitting in the bar. We sat down and started looking over the cocktail menu and then our waiter popped by. He helped us out narrow down our decision. I ordered the Blood orange Margarita ( without sweet and sour). I was not a fan whatsoever it was way too sweet for me so for my second drink I went with the safe choice of champagne. We were ready to order pretty much right away because we were starving. I ordered the appetizer chicken ceasar salad and my friend got the sliders with fries. I know the menu is extremely overwhelming with all of their options but I typically order ONLY the chicken caesar or the miso glazed salmon.  <br><br>While we waited we noshed on some yummy cheesecake factory bread. the second best part to their caesar salad :). The food came out and it was delicious as always. <br><br>ALSO!!! to finish off our waiter was amazing. He was funny, attentive and very helpful.

I came here for my birthday celebration with my sister and Marissa made sure that I have a good time and celebrated my birthday in a good ole Cheesecake Factory way. We were there for happy hour and I know I appreciate half priced apps and drinks. I still had to order my fave Dolce de Lexie cheesecake in celebration of my birthday. We may have save me money on the happy hour menu however we definitely paid the cost for parking... my advice Uber. The 3 hour parking rate of $15, for the John Hancock building doesn&#39;t go into effect until after 6, when happy hour ends... Convenient!

We have eaten at several Cheesecake Factorys but this one is special because it&#39;s always on our stop whenever we come to Chicago.  Very nice decor inside and the food is always great and dont forget the cheesecake!  Hopefully we will be back in February and see you then.

Me and my friends went here last night and had a terrible experience. My friend ordered a burger and asked for it to be well done, but when she bit into it the center was very pink. My other friend ordered the fettuccine alfredo and it was overcooked, soft, and soggy. Our waiter and the manager were very nice and brang them new plates and gave us two free cheesecake slices. However, this morning I was eating my leftovers of the thai lettuce wraps and found an unusual small black and yellow bug in my lettuce. It was in one of the creases in the lettuce. I thought it was a seed at first because there was many black little seeds in the sauces and vegetables, but when I looked closer there was little legs and clearly an insect. I&#39;ve never had a problem with any other cheesecake factory. Disgusting.
I love the Vanilla bean cheesecake, the menu is very similar to the Grand Lux as that is their sister company..however they have the most delicious pumpernickel bread ...unlike the Grand Lux..
Combo of salmon and steak Diane very good but steak overcooked. Asked and received a side of Miso sauce that was able to salvage the steak.

Waited for 2 hours after the order was placed. I agree they were busy but I feel they should have more waiters in such a situation. The waiter even got anger at us for even after waiting for one and half hour for asking him about the food. The manager seems not to care about the situation.

The Rundown: The interior of this place feels like you sitting an a magical mushroom cave or something. Food wise the portions are huge and the menu is the same as I remember from over 10 years ago. Service was good but could be a tad bit speedier.<br><br>Overall: A-OK<br><br>I think at one point in my life I was going to Cheesecake Factory once a month. I&#39;ve always been a fan of their pastas, specifically the Pasta Da Vinci (Sautéed Chicken, Mushrooms and Onions in a Delicious Madeira Wine Sauce Tossed with Penne Pasta and Parmesan). Cool to see that their menu looks relatively unchanged for the most part. More recently I tried the Louisiana Chicken Pasta (Parmesan Crusted Chicken Served Over Pasta with Mushrooms, Peppers and Onions in a Spicy New Orleans Sauce), and it was delicious and definitely enough to feed two. Prices still seem to be the same from what I remember years ago as well and great to see they don&#39;t hike up the prices for being in a tourist heavy spot along Michigan Avenue. Anyways, even though it&#39;s a chain, it&#39;s great to see they&#39;re still serving up huge portions of quality food that I remember from long ago.  <br><br>&#39;Til next time, cheers!
