What is there not to like? The menu has a million choices for everyone, and each location is consistent. I&#39;ve been a regular since the days when everyone and their mom had their bday dinners here growing up. I loved it when I was vegetarian and would order the Portabella burger and the Japanese eggplant burger and STILL LOVE IT. Current go-to&#39;s are the Shrimp Bistro Pasta and the Louisiana Chicken Pasta, and of course the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake. Portions are HUGE and they are always accommodating about splitting portions. And who doesn&#39;t love that FREE brown oat bread? Gimme.

not amazing, not great. just average<br><br>1. had 3 different servers<br>2. 1st waiter forgot to add an item to our order, we told the 2nd waiter, 1st waiter came back up to us and gave a b.s. excuse, said he didnt put down the item because it would take too long. it was a turkey sandwhich!!!<br>3. its kind of dark in there.<br>4. its kind of busy so im guessing everybody is rushed and it becomes less of a personal experience.<br>5. the complementary bread was kind of bland/boring compared to other cheesecake locations.<br><br>also, parking in that area is $15<br>on a side note, the decor also seems to be outdated.

This is probably worst Cheesecake Factory place. I have tried other locations and I have always left with smile on my face. At this location servers are racist and have disgusting attitude. I am allergic to meat they served me wrong dishes twice. I specified everything during placing order. They are very busy as it&#39;s located on Michigan Avenue, I get it but little bit of kindness and professionalism is expected when you pay decent amount of money. After my first bad experience, I gave one more chance  to this location, I was more disappointed as again they served me wrong dish again and food took so long to get to my table. I wish I could give zero stars to the place.
Food was good however the service kind of sucked in this branch. We skipped the dessert because they failed to bring it so we said just cancel it. When we asked for water we had to follow up.

All I can say is that the food is so good. I got the chicken and biscuits and it was too good. The people were very nice, nice environment, and they got our order 100% right when we had like 5 people.
This is by far my favorite place to get deserts! the only downside is that we have to pay for parking and sometimes it&#39;s super packed.

I have had Yelp for years and have never written a single review. However, my experience at this Cheesecake Factory location warranted feedback. If there was an option to give (0) stars..that would have been the preferred option. <br><br>My family (which consisted of a party of 6) decided to celebrate my dad&#39;s birthday at this location. The only good thing I can say about the entire experience is the hostess and the bartender on staff. The bartender was very attentive, offered drink suggestions, and really was enthusiastic about our celebration. When we were seated at a booth was when things went from good to worse! After 25 minutes+, our server came over to take drink/appetizer orders, we weren&#39;t quite ready to order but had informed the server that he could bring us bread and butter, and that we were celebrating my dad&#39;s birthday. His demeanor was short, impatient, inattentive, and unpleasant - as he never acknowledged or even said Happy Birthday to my father and rather dismissed it and reconfirmed the water/bread order.  His dismissive response resulted in us requesting a different server, which in return, we were asked to move to a different table to be accommodated.<br><br>Upon moving to the &#34;next&#34; table, it took another 30 minutes to be acknowledged. Once the server came to deliver waters, my father (the birthday guy) said that he was happy to finally see someone as we were ready to order. The server, in response, said that the reason that our service was delayed because we were switching &#34;back and forth between tables&#34;. Once our party observed the  same dismissive treatment as the first waiter, we told him that they were making an uncomfortable and unpleasant experience for my dad&#39;s birthday. Instead of apologizing and trying to better the experience, he delivered waters and also never acknowledged the birthday, Once Again! Then the manager comes to the table with bread minutes later and has yet the SAME DISMISSIVE attitude. Once we addressed our issues and told him that service was no longer required, due to the lack of appreciation of our business and attentiveness, he was a replica of the culture of the poor service. Not once did he apologize for our unfortunate/discomfort with the first 2 servers, he instead welcomed the idea of us patronizing another establishment instead. <br><br>We left displeased, unhappy, and highly disappointed as we frequented this location throughout the past, and service on a &#34;regular&#34; day (opposed to a birthday celebration) was NEVER as bad! <br><br>Luckily upon leaving, we went to the Signature Room and were treated with Great Service and Appreciation of us choosing them to help celebrate such a significant milestone. I write this in hopes of improvement of overall service and to also give heads up for anyone looking to celebrate at this establishment.<br><br>Thank You.

I was really skeptical about getting the &#34;BANG BANG CHICKEN &amp; SHRIMP&#34; only because it was Thai. Thai is usually spicy. I wanted to enjoy my meal not have to fan my mouth....BUT I ordered it anyway... &amp; I&#39;m glad I did !!!! It was AMAZING!! Flavors were very consistent across the palette. It was very delicious. It came served over your choose of brown or white rice. I ordered white with mine. Definitely a 10/10 highly recommend .

Cheesecake usually delivers on a good meal, but this review is about the service. Our server Kelly A. was nothing short of amazing. Attentive, funny and overall provided a great experience. This level of service is not always easy to find and exceeded our expectations. My wife and I had the Chicken Romano, (white sauce) extra on the side. The ultimate margaritas were delicious as always. Thank for the hospitality Kelly.

If you&#39;re looking for a good Jambalaya and a great slice of classic cheesecake for dessert, The Cheesecake Factory is the place to go. I remembered how much I enjoyed eating at a Cheesecake Factory location in Southern California, so I decided to have a go here in Chicago.<br>I ordered the Jambalaya and asked the server to exchange the rice with regular pasta noodles. Noodles absorb the sauce so much better than rice, especially with such at The Cheesecake Factory. No extra charge, so I recommend this.<br>Their portions are huge. No matter what you order here--not just Jambalaya--you get enough food to fill 2 regular stomachs. The food is delicious, and that seems like a default. I came here twice since I moved to Chicago a little more than a month ago, and both times got me satisfied to the fullest.<br>The service is great too. The servers are professionally trained and are polite at every move. I give high respect for the manager.<br>I will definitely visit here often as I settle in Chicago.

Don&#39;t know how to start. Ok service waitress Roxy told us she&#39;s still in training and oh well yes she needs more help. We waited 45 minutes for appetizers not to mention dinner. Whole experience was over 2 hours.

This place has seen better days.  The space is ugly, dirty and in need to repairs and maintenance.  The booth I was in was somehow attached to the behind it.  Everytime my &#34;neighbor&#34; changed positions I got a jolt.  The food was average, I had a burger that had no flavor, even though it had cheese and bacon and some kind of special sauce on it.  My companion had a salmon dinner that was much better and she enjoyed the fresh veggies although that had been stir fried rather then steamed.  <br><br>The waiter is really what disappointed.  They restaurant was 1/3 full at 8 PM on Wednesday night.  We waited for our initial greeting for 7-8 minutes, water came shortly thereafter.  Then we waited for 10 minutes for him to take our drink order and told him we would order food as well since it was taking so long.  We waited another 5 or 6 minutes for wine to be delivered.  The food came shortly after that but our meals we not delivered together.  I just hate that.  Even a diner can get all the food out at the same time.  I do not recommend.

Some people love and swear by The Cheesecake Factory. I think it is overrated and expensive. Yes, it is in downtown Chicago and conveniently tucked away in the John Hancock Observatory, next to the Water Tower Place. The ambiance of the place is romantic bordering on too dim of lighting. Creative props goes to the designers with the decor that makes both the interior and the exterior visually pop. Vast menu with diverse entrees and cheesecake.  Service is okay and did their job. The chicken taquitos were tasty but essential you are getting two chopped up into 4 for over $6.  The chicken alfredo is usually delicious but tonight the chicken was very dry though plentiful. For a pasta dish to be almost $23, it failed to deliver. The spicy cashew chicken was a very odd interpretation. It was deep fried chicken pieces similar to what you would find in a General Tso&#39;s dish mixed in with a thick sweet and spicy sauce. The best part of the dish was the rice and the cashews which is not saying much. The only part of the meal that met our expectations and in my opinion, is the only good part of the Cheesecake Factory was the cheesecake. It was delicious and well worth the price.  This place is worth the visit for the cheesecake alone but don&#39;t expect to be wowed by the overpriced entrees.
Chris the manager is useless. Really bad customer service. For a restaurant in downtown Chicago, you&#39;d think management would be better. Don&#39;t recommend anyone going here.

For whatever it&#39;s worth, my dad has declared this the nicest Cheesecake Factory he&#39;s ever been in. Pro tip: On nice days, a table on the patio is worth it. On weekends, and even weekdays, the wait can be long. It&#39;s a popular spot for tourists and families. Bring your patience as there will be screaming kids. And you can expect the food and dessert to be just like any other Cheesecake Factory. But I will always keep coming back here for one main reason - the Buffalo Blasts. They are seriously one of the best things I&#39;ve ever eaten.

Oh how I love form letters... and how I love the insults that come with them. Dear The Cheesecake Factory (Chicago) GO FUCK YOURSELF. YOUR GROSS, NASTY and you can take the $25 gift card, which isn&#39;t even enough to go back to your restaurant and not have to pay something , shove up your kitchen staffs asses a d Kiss my busy good buy. Seriously you bring food that looks like some ate off of to myplate to my table and expect me to pay you give you another try... I might have fucked stupid at one point of my life, but I dumped him, Like I am dumping your asses.
Even though they were closed, by 38 minutes, they helped us to some great cheesecake! They could have just said no, but they didn&#39;t! <br>THANKS!!!

The food was excellent and the service was better!! The place was packed with people but they run like a well oiled machine! <br><br>Our server Logan was fast &amp; friendly! We never had to look for her, Logan was always checking on us. There was also a manager, Raven, who came through the dining room and introduced herself. As loud and busy as that restaurant was, the entire experience still felt very warm.<br><br>You would think that&#39;s the end but it gets better!! We left a shopping bag there under the table. I told my wife to call and she basically laughed at me. She thought I was crazy to think they would have the bag. So I called, and sure enough a manager, Domingo, had my bag in the office already. He took the time to ask me for my info to mark the bag further.  Domingo said the bag is waiting for me!<br><br>As big and busy as this place is, they have a system in place for everything! Thank you!

Oh my goodness I love this place: perfect location, yummy cheesecake at a really convenient price (7.5, and we are talking about THE cheesecake, people!) a huge menu with options for every taste bud, ridiculous huge portions (everything, no matter what, is for sharing), nice staff! I can go on and on.<br><br>But please, do yourself a favor an ask for the dulce de leche cheesecake and simply enjoy! It&#39;s amazing, soft, creamy but the flavor is mild and perfect. I think I will come back tomorrow just to eat another slice of that mana from the heaven. The banana fresh is also good, but... Dulcce de leche! <br><br>The only cons I find is that the decoration looks like a huge Vgg, if you know what I mean, that&#39;s weird right?

This is the worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to and frankly, one of the most disappointing restaurant experiences I&#39;ve had in a while. <br><br>The service was terrible. Took about 25 minutes just to get a cocktail and the place didn&#39;t seem that busy at the time. Then the food took another 20 minutes after that. 10 minutes into eating my food, the waiter is practically kicking us out of our table to make room for the dinner rush. Hey, I&#39;m a paying customer too you know. <br><br>The food was alright but honestly with the experience I had, I wouldn&#39;t ever come back. This place left an unfortunate taste in my mouth.<br><br>Hire some more waiters if you have to.

The food was good and there was a lot of quantity. However the service was god awful. I&#39;m not sure if it was because it was a Sunday, but the waitress first brings out the wrong order saying that it was for another table then takes another 2 hours to get ours ready. Then when we are done and need the check it took another hour to get the waitress attention. She then has the nerve to say have a good day on my receipt when I just spent 5 hours at a restaurant. Absolutely absurd.

Dinner started well. Table of 4.  Sodas. Ordered. Good.  Food was brought out. One person got a burger, but server said &#39;fries on their way&#39;. Later, server came back and said, &#39;fries coming&#39;.  Then server never came back. We flagged him down and asked for a refill of Coke Zero.....but they ran out in the time we&#39;d been there.  Never came back to refill other drinks. After we were ALL finished eating, server brings fries. My friend said, &#39;it&#39;s too late now. I needed them with my meal.  Please take them back.&#39;  She suggested they comp her meal b/c she had a plain hamburger and promises of fries, but no luck in the 40 min we were eating. It really did set a negative experience. <br><br>Server came back and said no comp, but could have a piece of cheesecake.  Not a great solution for a diabetic. <br><br>Service was terrible.  It&#39;s like they&#39;re always busy so they don&#39;t care if you&#39;re happy or if you come back.  Luckily they don&#39;t need our business.....because we&#39;re not going back. <br><br>Food we had was tasty-the only reason for a second star.

This is one of the nicest Cheesecake Factory and the location is phenomenal. It is the perfect place for a quick lunch or dinner. Specific to this location, the food was mediocre, but our server was probably the BEST ever. I wish I could recall his name, but he was so sweet and helpful. They have a lot of staff so it is still organized during the crazy rushes as well. Its a bit pricey, but completely worth it.
This place is the best good food good service always stop here when in Chicago could use a little more lighting but don&#39;t let that stop you

I can&#39;t believe that this place have 3 stars?! This place is amazing, the food is delicious and the service is amazing, but the reason for my review is Frankie the bartender, He is Amazing, to see this guy making hundreds of drinks in a minute was Unreal...

Great Cheesecake Factory! The waiter was extremely friendly and helpful finding great choices on the menu. The apps were served quickly and the the food as well. Everything was cooked to perfection. We even got validation for our parking garage ticket to receive a discount! Will definitely be back.

First of all this place has a weird deco, it looks like the Flintstones live there!! It looks like a cave and it&#39;s very dark. I don&#39;t get the whole concept of it.<br><br>Our waitress was super nice but she had so much tables to attend she nearly came to check ours. I went with my husband and my younger to celebrate his 10th birthday, you will think an over priced place will at least give a free dessert for the birthday boy!, nope you had to buy the stupid cake so they can sing happy birthday. Our waitress told us they don&#39;t t do anything for birthdays at least you buy the cake -_-. I think if we are paying $15 per plate at least they could be nice about it and give him something. After she gave us our check she came out with a Sunday for my brother, ok that was nice of her but it was a slap on the face. There was no nearly any ice cream and it&#39;s was topped with lots of heavy whipped cream.  Now that&#39;s what you call cheap, my brother even started to cry when he got that nasty ass piece of shit ice cream.<br><br>Now for the food I had the meatloaf, it was good but a bit salty, my younger brother has the pizza now that was the only good thing of the things we order. My husband had the burrito it tasted like chipotle not good sigh!!!! We had a nasty experience will never go back!! I don&#39;t recommend this place to any tourist and I live here!!

This was my first time going to Cheesecake Factory after hearing from my daughter how good the food was.  Imagine my disappointment when we experienced the worst service. I could possibly understand if the restaurant was packed, but it wasnt.  We were seated within 15 minutes of our arrival.  Starting with the waitress who took about 15 minutes just to acknowledge us and that&#39;s it.  After another 10 minutes we finally had water brought to us.  The rest of the evening went downhill from there.  Drinks were another 20 minutes, entrees another 45 minutes.  The only positive experience was from another waiter who took the time to ask if we were ok and if we wanted to speak to a manager who could possibly at least provide us with a dessert for the long wait.  When the so-called actual manager came by our table to speak with us he was very robotic and dry.  As if we were interrupting his evening and did not want to be bothered with this trivial matter.  Not apologetic at all and no offers of anything for our frustration.  The other waiter who noticed our disappointment was more genuine and honestly sorry for the poor service.  He should be the manager!  So for my first time at the Cheesecake Factory, the food was good, but overshadowed by a bad waitress, terrible kitchen service, long waits, and a non-chalent manager.  We hopefully made an impact, however slight, by not leaving a tip.  Not certain whether they care or not, but there it is.

After getting trapped at Chicago 360 (warning it takes forever to go up AND back down) we were starving and wanted to eat something quick. We were seated quickly and then everything went downhill from there. <br><br>We sat outside and I order a coke which took 15 mins. We finally got bread after 25 mins (I had to ask), and we finally got our food after sitting there for 45 min (we ordered right after we were seated). Never got my coke refilled, and of course when it was time to pay the check, he finally moved his ass to process my card.<br><br>Why is it so hard to get decent service in America?? I&#39;ve served before and it&#39;s not that hard. Yes you gotta move your ass, but good service equals consistent tips.
Food and drinks are always good. Service is mediocre but then again I never really expect much from a chain restaurant

The Cheesecake Factory is the type of restaurant you go to that never let you down. Sure the wait time can be unpredictable but after a while you kinda know when it&#39;s peak time and when it&#39;s not. With that being said my cousin and I went on Monday, National Cheesecake day, with the intention of trying the funfetti cheesecake and to catch up. I decided on another flavor which was absolutely exquisite and my cousin tried the funfetti one and she really enjoyed it. We also had meals. My cousin had the chicken parmigiana sandwich and it looked pretty good, she said it was good. I had the beef pit dip sandwich and it was REALLY good. The bread was soft, the au jus was good and the meat tender, flavorful and plentiful. Our waitress was attentive even though it was crowded.

Located on the sunken plaza at the base of the John Hancock Center.  A somewhat dark room, with daylight from windows on the plaza not penetrating far into the labyrinthine interior.  Decoratively a bit unsettling, full of pink, bulgy organic shapes--Jonah might have felt right at home.<br><br>We arrived around 2:00 on a Sunday afternoon.  The place was crowded to the point of discomfort, but we were handed a pager, and seated within about 20 minutes.  Our server came at once, though the food was then rather slow to be delivered.<br><br>The menu is typical of the Cheesecake Factory chain:  Lots of variety, most things dependably well-executed, portions probably too damned big.  We ordered a couple of old favorites, and a couple of things new to us:<br><br>- Taco sampler.  Four different kinds of tacos with four dipping sauces.  Adequate as an appetizer for two, and could serve as a perfectly satisfactory entree for one.<br><br>- Thai lettuce wraps.  My wife&#39;s go-to Cheesecake Factory choice.  Delicious and messy; a few toothpicks might help with some of the structural engineering problems.<br><br>- Cashew chicken.  Big chunks of sautéed white-meat chicken, cashews, green onions, white and black sesame seeds; rather dry, but what sauce there was, was mildly spicy.  Choice of white or brown rice.  Pretty good, though many Chinese restaurants do this sort of thing better.  Probably not something I&#39;d order again, with so many other dishes waiting to be tried.<br><br>- Mango Key lime cheesecake.  Our usual favorite from among the large selection of the house&#39;s eponymous specialty.<br><br>Restrooms clean, but at least one of the stalls in the men&#39;s room was out of toilet paper; this had not been corrected fifteen minutes after being called to the attention of a server.<br><br>On all of the bus lines on North Michigan Avenue.  Five blocks from the Chicago Avenue station on the Red Line.
If you come here make sure you ask for Jonathan. By far best service and an even better bartender. I come here all the time and by far amazing service.
Such a beautiful place indoor. From floor to ceiling just LOVELY. And the food is absolutely fantastic. Server was great. Cheesecake the BEST. You should try it!

Love it here! The biggest menu and lots of indoor and outdoor seating. It seems to always be busy but they get people in and out quickly. Event just going there for a slice of cheesecake is a fun outgoing where you won&#39;t leave hungry or disappointed. All of their dishes and drinks are delicious<br><br>Unfortunately I had to update my review. We recently ordered delivery from here and I got my go to which is the barbecue chicken salad. On the receipt it clearly reads no tomatoes ( THATS IT). In this $16 salad, it&#39;s missing the avocado, apple, and bacon. I&#39;ve had this salad numerous times and know what comes in it. Safe to say I&#39;m extremely disappointed. Also, there&#39;s little pieces of tomatoes. WORST PART! It&#39;s missing the crunchy onion rings on top. This is more like a McDonald dollar menu salad.

I love most cheesecakes and desserts at the Cheesecake Factories, but I must say that not everything else on their menu is as good. (There are, of course, a number of bakeries who make better items, but many are harder to find than this chain.) A great food item to get for lunch or dinner is the Herb-Crusted Salmon in lemon sauce with delicious mashed potatoes and asparagus! My mom and I really enjoy this item, and I was surprised to taste something this good here in comparison to other average dishes served here. Most dishes are huge there, but ask your waiter about the sizes and the smaller lunch portions. I&#39;ve shared a delicious special 30th Anniversary cheesecake/cake and other desserts with 1 or 2 other people after a big meal. I must say that the Chicagoland and Indianapolis locations have pretty much the same quality.<br><br>Yum, now, excuse me while I go Google chees

Giving it a 3 star mainly because the service was awful and the food wasn&#39;t that great, but the cheesecake was awesome. Came here not really expecting that much and basically got just that and then some. <br><br>To start off we where seating outside and when it started raining our waitress was no where to be found and when I tried to talk to another waiter he just ignored me didn&#39;t even acknowledge me. That was frustrating.<br><br>Appetizer was the egg roll sampler which was really good just wish our waitress would of told us what sauce was what. <br><br>Ordered a simple mac &amp; cheese burger medium. Don&#39;t know why they asked how I wanted to cook because they overcooked it anyways. Burger was kind of plan after the Mac and cheese was gone. I had it with the blood orange Mojito which was a very good drink and was truly better than the burger. <br><br>For the finale I ordered the ultimate red velvet cheesecake with a coffee no compliance cheesecake was awesome just wish I would&#39;ve got a refill with my coffee. <br><br>Probably will be back again maybe try a different location but just come in for dessert too many good places to eat around Chicago!
Pretty nice cheeses cake and the location is great. You can either stay blin the table for more or just grab something to go. Flexible

I have never eaten here before but I have come here as a Doordash driver and done over 50 deliveries and every single one has been late for pick up. I have received every excuse in the book. I also know being told they push delivery service orders last and do not do orders first come first serve which slows down a restaurant. I would never go here to eat and waste money with them. If there was a no star rating this place would be worthy of it. I also filed complaints with Doordash against them in the hopes things will change. Time will tell it changes anything. Hopefully this bad review will do something!
Food was good as always. Really surprised me the ratings on this restaurant. We ate about 6:30 and didn&#39;t have a wait. Service was really good.

First off food was definitely good. This is why the one star because everything else except the food was below standard. We&#39;ve been bringing our kids here for years. 7 teens now always loved the food but this time the service and kitchen had so many issues, you cannot even begin to imagine.  Platters came out one or two at a time, steak was over cooked. Had to be remade and was still a bit over cooked. Items missing chicken on side had to be asked for twice, mushrooms that I ordered as a side for my Thai lettuce wraps didn&#39;t come out. I even forgot that they were ordered.  When I asked about them I was told the order got cold and was being remade. Had to order extra dressings 3 times. It was not that busy went in around 3 and they seated us (9) right away.  The whole dinner was off but to the point that it wasn&#39;t enjoyable. the kitchen had error after error.  Not sure if it was things weren&#39;t entered properly or the runners moving plates out incomplete but it took over an hour to have all of our plates completely served.  When they brought back steak they forgot to bring fries at same time another 15 min before we got those. <br>Clearly no longer a brand that cares about return customers. What a shame. Kids love it there and Food is actually very good. Just with all the hitches and incompleteness, you can&#39;t enjoy your meal as a group.<br>Server did apologize, and managers did comp the steak and other items with errors. Unfortunately, I won&#39;t trust this chain again with a large group again. Service and organization was just a hot mess.

I can only speak to the cheesecake but as you may have guessed, it was pretty of the charts AMAZING!! We came here for dinner but there was a long wait and this was on a Tuesday night (so maybe call ahead or be prepared for a wait) so we decided to get cheesecake. The wait for the cheesecake was 10 minutes but it was so worth it. There are steps to sit on outside the restaurant, perfect spot to share a bit with your love (or your enemy if you&#39;re using the cheesecake as a peace offering). Great spot to eat if you&#39;re in the area. In the bottom of the John Hancock tower.

The worst service in Chicago! I usually love The Cheesecake Factory, but this unit is one of the worst restaurants I have ever been! This is the second time I go there. The first time we could not get a waiter and our silverware was nasty dirty. So now I was giving them a second chance, but I had a horrible experience again!! The service is terrible and our waiter was super rude. I definitely do not recommend this place. Go somewhere else!

Very unimpressed with this place. We were told to sit anywhere on arrival while everyone else who arrived after was shown to a table. Our server took ages to come to the table and didn&#39;t introduce himself. Our order was messed up several times and there was issues with the cheque when leaving. Possibly the worst customer service I have ever seen.

I came here with my sons and there was about a 25-30 min wait on a Friday night which I guess wasn&#39;t too bad. It took a long time for the appetizers and entrees to come out and when they did, they were just warm. I ordered the Chicken Madeira which is my absolute favorite dish from Coopers Hawk. I thought that it would be similar but it was not. The chicken was dry because there was not enough Madeira wine sauce on the dish. The temperature of the food probably also contributed to the dry taste. It reminded me of the experience that I had at the Grand Lux Cafe.

There is so much selection it might be overwhelming to some people. I find it great! But whatever your taste and whatever your mood you&#39;ll be able to find something you like. The cheesecake goes without saying. So many options and all so delicious!! Love it here!

I&#39;m happy we came, despite the so and so reviews. We went to the 360 Chicago observatory. This place is a next to it, hidden gem in a great location.<br>Perfect place for a romantic dinner or bday celebration. For a Friday night,  there was no waiting for a party of 2. Geat, fast service. Recommend Andrew to be your waiter, very nice and fast. <br>Ordered stuffed tortilla, orange chicken and a piece of cheesecake. We had to take half of the food to go because the portions are generous. Little pricey, but totally an indulgence worth it !!! Food fresh and hot!

I ordered through doordash and had the worse food experience ever!!! I paid around $80 to get EXTREMELY OVERCOOKED fried food! 3 out of the 5 items I ordered were fried and all of those 3 items were not edible. The 4th item was a dip and it was over salted. The only item was able to eat was the slice of cheesecake, which is not cooked inhouse I assume. I called and spoke to Tony (A manager) to let him know about my experience and he just told me &#34;I&#39;ll let the chef know&#34;. I told him based on my experience I wasn&#39;t gonna eat with them again. He could care less. Being in the food and beverage industry many years ago, this is an opportunity for a restuarant to make things right. NOT the cheesecake factory they don&#39;t give a sh#t!

I got into town super late and we were looking for somewhere to get a quick and light bite to eat.  One doesn&#39;t usually associate The Cheesecake Factory with a quick and light bite but we both ordered the White Chicken Chili with brown rice which is on the Skinnylicious menu.  It&#39;s just the right size portion where you&#39;re satisfied but don&#39;t feel like you&#39;ve eaten tons and tons of food.  It&#39;s got just a little bit of spice and I like the texture of the brown rice in it.  It&#39;s clean and the service was decent and friendly.  They move a lot of people in and out here every single day. *Side note: I think this was the first Cheesecake Factory I ever ate at 15+ years ago.

Its a good place but the wait time today was over an hour.i know its weekend but still one hour to get a slice of cheesecake and then 20 mins aftr ordering u have to wait.other than the wait time it is a good place with a variety of desserts options

I ordered a chicken Santa Fe salad tonight for carry out and was told it would be half an hour.  Over an hour after I got there the food finally came without even a apology for the ridiculous wait.  I get home to find out they forgot the chicken in the salad!  I paid $17 dollars and waited over an hour for a container of iceberg lettuce ...not even with the chicken included...I called back to let them know and they wouldn&#39;t even transfer me properly to the manager to let them know.

My wife and I were in Chicago on vacation and we were pretty hungry haven&#39;t not eaten so we decided to stop there after a long day of sight seeing. The place was huge but pretty empty at 7 PM which should have been a warning sign but when your hungry you overlook such things. The waitress greeted us and was very nice and gave us water and asked if we wanted any additional drinks besides water to start we asked for a few minutes to decide and said she would be back in few minutes to take our order. When she finally returned I requested a lemonade and we placed our food order and also asked for more water. 15 minutes passed and no lemonade no water so I had to flag someone else down to request more water for our table. When the food eventually showed up (I had the chicken carbonara and my wife had an order of the lettuce wraps) mine tasted little burnt but I chalked it up to maybe one piece got  overdone but as I continued I kept tasting it and I realized the entire thing was over done and burnt. I was starving so I ate it anyways because I wasnt about to wait another 20 - 30 min to get a replacement and by the time we finished our meal I never received my lemonade even after I mentioned it when the waitress dropped off our entrees. In some defense of the waitresses she seemed stressed or preoccupied the whole time so there may be some bigger issues with the establishment especially since my wife had to tell some one that the womens bathroom was completely out of toilet paper and when I went to the mens room it smelled like urine and was not maintained either. I did tell the waitress I was not satisfied with the quality of my meal and she did offer to have another made to go but we were on our way to the Hancock tower so I didn&#39;t have any thing to put it in and she said she would get the manager. The manager came over and apologized for the meal and he too asked if he could make me another one and I told him we were on time crunch and wouldn&#39;t be able to wait or take it with me. He begrudgingly offered to comp my meal but he had a look on his face that he didn&#39;t want  to do it and thought I was being unreasonable. Overall it was a disappointment but like I said that location must have other issues that I dont know about because I have been to Cheesecake Factory(in Texas) where I live and that place was great.

Are you kidding me??? I don&#39;t see general questions from contact me page anywhere. Don&#39;t waste my time anymore and make sure your staff is not cheap about giving extra forks to your customers.

The only time I have cheesecake is on rare occasions when I go to the US. This was one of the occasions. My husband and I ordered the lemon and raspberry cheesecake as well as the ultimate red velvet cake cheesecake for take away to eat at our hotel room. The cheesecakes were good, however the red velvet cheesecake was a little too sweet for my taste. The other one was also sweet, although the sweetness was balanced by the slightly acidic raspberry coulis it was served with. Flavour-wise I give the cheesecakes 3.5 stars. For a really really delicious 5 star cheesecake, check out my review for Texas de Brazil!<br>When it comes to the service, the guy who took our order, I believe his name was Juan, was very nice and friendly. He happily answered any questions the customers had about the different cakes and also came with suggestions based on your preferences. The service is a clear 5 star rating. <br>Although the awesome service brings up the rating, I would like to base this review on the food experience alone, which is why I give it 3 stars.

Cheesecake Factory is a religious experience every time I come to Chicago. <br><br>The food is always consistently good, no matter what you pick. The price is reasonable for Chicago standards. The food portions are huge. <br><br>Nice place as well. Had indoor seating and outdoor. <br><br>Recommended.

You can never go wrong with Cheesecake Factory&#39;s dessert selection.<br><br>Wanted to try a lighter slice of cheesecake and decided on their &#34;30th Anniversary Chocolate Cake Cheesecake.&#34;  It was a good choice!<br>2 layers of moist chocolate cake w/ 2 layers of original cheesecake &amp; chocolate ganache. <br><br>There are a few other non-Cheesecake selections like the Lemon Cream Torte that is also very good!<br><br>Ample outdoor seatings in the John Hancock sub-level to enjoy that delectable slice of heaven!
Not a bad wait and well worth it.  Try the Chicken Madeira.  I had it without the cheese.  Superb!

Service was so slow! Sat in the bar immediately, which was great. We were there late at 1030pm, yet the kitchen seemed like it couldn&#39;t handle the amount of orders or something. <br><br>For two people, waited 45 minutes for food but it wasn&#39;t terribly busy. Manager came up and apologized for the wait even though we didn&#39;t complain. Even after telling us it would be &#39;right out&#39;, it still took 10 more minutes. <br><br>Server was very slow and couldn&#39;t multitask well. Food was good as usual though.

Bums me out to write a negative review but our experience tonight was a 2 out of 5 stars....and that&#39;s being nice. First, we waited at our table for over 8 minutes just to get a waiter to say &#34;I&#39;ll be back because I&#39;m going on break&#34;.  The &#34;fill in&#34; waiter was awful and never checked on our table. We had to wave her down three times. Bread arrived at the same time our food did. Food was brought out missing fries and it took over 10 minutes to get the fries, ketchup, and ranch. It should of never taken that long especially because it was busy but not over packed. Second, the restaurant was filthy. Stuff all over the floors and dishes still sitting on tables 10 minutes after guests had left (staffing issues??). As we walked up the stairs to the exit you can see how dirty those stairs are....food and crumbs everywhere. I&#39;ve never seen a Cheesecake Factory that run down. In addition, the lady bussing tables in the bar area was using a dirty rag that she stuffed in her apron (is that normal?). <br>On a positive note.....the cheesecake was really good.

Stopped in for lunch after going to the 360 in the Hancock building. The restaurant was fairly busy but I was seating quickly. Brandon D was great. <br><br>I ordered the chicken bellagio which was to die for. While I waited, I was given a basket to two mini-loaves of bread - a ciabatta and a dark, oaty bread that was super soft and yummy. <br><br>I&#39;m only giving four stars because the entree portion is so huge I couldn&#39;t finish it. <br><br>Now, it has to be some sort of crime to go to Cheescake Factory and not have cheesecake. So, I got it to go naturally. ;) Red Velvet that is just amazing. <br><br>I would certainly return to this CF again. And, if I ordered the bellagio again I&#39;d ask if I can get a half order!

Food was subpar at best. Overpriced for sure. Atmosphere was good, waiter was really good too. To me they&#39;re on the same level as Applebee&#39;s but they carry more food. My burger was good, my GFs food was good also. I&#39;ll come back to here but not just on a whim.

Tonight I went with the cookie dough cheesecake, although I had to narrow it down to a top 6 from their 20-25 options before finally choosing it. I don&#39;t regret it either! It was so good. It definitely can be shared between 2-3 people though (TIP). On the way out of the restaurant, I began to regret only coming for dessert with how delectable the dinner plates of other guests looked. I will certainly head back to try a few of those!

Absolutely worst experience I have had in years.  To start, we were told that we would only have an hour wait for a party of seven.  They called us 20 minutes later to say our table was ready, only to tell us that they misheard us and thought we had a party of two.  They then said they would handle us as soon as possible.  Forty-six minutes later, we asked when our table would be ready and were told we were the next large part to be seated.  They called us about 10 minutes later and we stood up front waiting for another 11 minutes while they were &#34;cleaning&#34; our table which was not true as we were staring at the table we were going to be seated at in the bar area since they first paged us.  <br><br>It felt as though they were punishing us for telling them they put down the wrong number in our party.  The food was just OK.  The kitchen was extremely slow.  The hosts up front were very curt practically to the point of insulting.  The only saving grace was our server Sharon, who was very attentive and and polite.<br><br>I won&#39;t be going back any time soon and and would recommend that everyone stay away.
Very crowded with Michigan Avenue shoppers/tourists, service was a bit slow, and the menu has everything you could imagine on it because they specialize in nothing.

My daughter and I visited here on this past Thursday night before we left town. We were hesitant as the last few  reviews on Yelp were not too good. But we dove right in and we&#39;re glad we did. The service was great! The food fantastic and the atmosphere was great! Thank you! Best cheesecake and my bacon bacon cheeseburger was the best!

I came with my boyfriend on a sunday night. We ordered a caesar salad, diane steak and carbonna pasta. First off we ordered the steak medium rare it came well done. The carbonna was very bland. We didnt really like anything we ordered. The bill came out to be 87$ with drinks too pricey especially considering the food was subpar. The server rarely came to check up on us. But the drinks especially the mojito were really good.

Not bad food, but the spinach dip was not dip. It was more like a dry cold dish of spinach. It was cold too. Ask service was terrible, I have never gotten bad food or service from this cheese cake factory before, wonder what&#39;s up!!

The interior had great design and was clean, but food.... was terrible. All 4 of us eat food separate because As not made at once for all of us enjoy together All but one dish came out cold, waitress came asking how is everything on several occasions and two times we needed to remind her about forgotten drink and a dish

fun experience. went for just a fun date night, only had to wait for about 10 minutes. was sat at a bad table in the corner right next to the kitchen, didn&#39;t complain about it though. food was great, our server was able to keep up with our refills. cheesecake was amazing. prices are good too.

TOURISTS DONT GO HERE! I am not a tourist but I wouldn&#39;t want someone from out of town to think this is how Chicago is. You know how you think people only review when they&#39;ve had a bad experience? No--This place is truly horrible. All of the other reviews are right on. <br><br>The restaurant was half full the whole time we were there. Its pretty simple actually- we sat down, no one came to take our drink order for about 10 min. Finally an older lady took our drink order. 20 minutes went by, she ran by almost laughing, &#34;I&#39;m sorry, I&#39;ll have those drinks in a minute, I just spilled something on myself....&#34; ???? Then we waited another 15 minutes and decided to get up and leave. She was walking up with our drinks, and as we were leaving she said, &#34;Ohhhh come on!&#34; As if we had done something wrong.<br><br>I asked the hostess if we could speak to the manager. The manager came up, ignored us and started quietly talking to the hostess. The hostess mentioned to the manager that we wanted to talk to him. He looked at us and continued talking to the hostess. We just left.<br><br>It was really bizzare. I felt like I was in a parallel universe. It just ruined the evening. But they don&#39;t care because they don&#39;t have to.

This is an amazing place. It was yummy. The kids chicken strips made our 7 year old very happy! Our 9 year old had a yummy cheeseburger. Only complaint is the lighting. It&#39;s too dark in this place.
We had a reservation for 12 and they were ready for us. Sat down right away and they took orders and got everything right! And of course then there&#39;s the cheesecake!

I came here with a friend who treated me to lunch and I swear their dessert just took me to another level.....I had carrot cake and my friend had the salted caramel cheesecake. Not only was dessert good, but our pizza too was delicious. Carla was mine and my friend&#39;s server she&#39;s really friendly and always checked on us if we needed anything and she was also very fast with getting stuff situated. It&#39;s best to go during the week when it&#39;s not really crowded because the spring and summer months are when there&#39;s increased traffic coming into the restaurant. They do have outdoor seating only during the spring, summer and early fall months(while it&#39;s warm outside) Overall the experience was great and plan on doing it again soon!!!!!!

Ordered pick up, they gave me an estimated wait time of 30 minutes. Took an hour and 30 min. So I had a really great time waiting outside with my dog in 30 degree weather while my family waited inside for our food. <br><br>They messed up our order, and didn&#39;t give any utensils as I asked. So I&#39;m currently eating this garbage with a coffee spoon in my hotel room.<br><br>I would never return to this location and would never recommend it to anyone. Awful awful service.

The service at this cheese cake factory is slow and sub par. Refills took forever, 15 mins to get the bill, another 10 to get it brought back for a signature. When the server was told the meal wasn&#39;t that great she just smiled/chuckled and walked away. I ordered fettuccine with chicken. The sauce had the consistency of water and wasn&#39;t creamy. The chicken was the most bland chicken I have ever got and the entire plate came out luke warm. I love cheese cake and the meal was so off putting that I skipped getting dessert on the off chance it would be as bad as the meal. There is one of these back home in Ohio but this experience was so bad it&#39;s doubtful I&#39;ll give my local one a chance. My recommendation is to steer clear of this one and find something else in the area.

I am usually a fan of the Cheesecake Factory but i had horrible service today. To begin the host was very rude and nasty to me when I requested to sit in a booth, even though I made it clear i&#39;m happy to wait. The host was very aggressive and the manager justified it by saying &#34;he can&#39;t help it&#34;. They sat us at a dirty table with crumbs and food still on it. Once we sat I had to ask the waitress to bring us straws 4 times, it literally took 20 minutes for her to finally bring them. We finally decided to leave after waiting over a hour and our appetizers still wasn&#39;t there. The waitress then says that the grease trap was dirty and they had to clean it. A hour wait for 1 order of egg rolls is ridiculous. After this experience I don&#39;t think i&#39;ll ever go back, at least this location

So frustrated. I ordered ahead of time but the server taking my order over the phone didn&#39;t know what the &#34;cakepay&#34; app was (so I could pay ahead of time). Now when I get there I&#39;m forced to wait almost 30 minutes instead of just picking up quickly at the counter because I couldn&#39;t pay ahead of time due to lack of proper training and staffing assignment. Even after the manager came over and helped the server still wouldn&#39;t release my food to me despite me showing my receipt on the app until the manager came over AGAIN. Now my lunch is cold and I&#39;m late back from my break because of this whole mess. So disorganized and frustrating to say the least.

I&#39;m livid right now. Called to place an order for pickup. Got there early and asked to be seated instead. I don&#39;t care if I pay more for a server I still want the same food. The two women hosting seemed to assume I wanted to cut out the waiter/waitress. Still they said they could seat me upstairs. I ordered to go cuz I have work in half an hour. They kept me waiting for a good twenty minutes seating party after party. Then I ask if they can at least check on my food and they tell me, &#34;Oh, go check at the bakery counter.&#34; It&#39;s been waiting there and is now cold. F*ck you both. I&#39;ve done nothing and you treated me like shit. You two don&#39;t deserve a job.

Ate here for the 1st time today! Our server was okay - at times we had to wait and it wasn&#39;t that busy. We had the Buffalo wings for an appetizer and we were told the sauce was not hot and more<br>Mild, but it definitely was hot! Great portion of food! Had the chicken Parmesan sandwich and it was huge! Great value! Ordered a dessert to go and was disappointed that it was not edible when we got home. Overall, great experience, will definitely be back!<br><br>Thank you for your comment back! Overall like I said it was a great experience and I will definitely be back! I have no doubt it will be a 5 Star! Everyone&#39;s tastes buds are different so his idea of hot was different then mine - next time we just try something else :)
Worst service ever. Got our buzzer called and waited an additional 20 minutes to get seated but we left so don&#39;t know how long it would take to get seated. Worst service ever.

Cheesecake Factory is usually a consistent restaurant. The food is usually good and they have a lot of options. This time my friends and I went it was not a pleasant experience. My 2 friends both ordered pasta dishes and one was over cooked and the other was way too dry like it had been sitting out. I ordered chicken pot pie and the potatoes tasted like they cut them up and placed them in the dish and it wasn&#39;t cooked. They were hard and raw. I wouldn&#39;t recommend this place if you&#39;re visiting Chicago. Just not a good option.

Really crappy dining experience . Dirty table, dirty cutlery, loud, loud waiters yelling at each other, piss poor slow service and average food. Hence one star rating. To be honest I would give them a zero star rating if that was possible. And the cherry on top - my steak came out cold!!!!! Figures as I was waiting long enough for it. What a dive.
Fried chicken sliders were delicious. Great location and good service. Always a good go to spot for an easy lunch with lots of choices.

Normal Cheesecake factory in the basement of the John Hancock. The menu is the same everywhere. But that lemonade is something that I cannot forget. I find myself trying to order it at restaurants that are not the cheesecake factory!

Tourist Trap located in the basement of the 4th tallest building in Chicago.  Sounds like fun doesn&#39;t it...NOT!!!<br><br>I feel like I have grown up beyond the Cheesecake factory.  I am so tired of the menu.  It is so big that it takes about 20 minutes to look through it before you can finally decide what to order and then the waiter comes over, after 20 minutes to tell you the specials. Honestly!  Just print them up and insert them in the front of this massive book they call a menu.  I believe less is more and the menu here wants to make everyone happy and in the end it makes no one happy!  And the evidence is in the lossy food they push out of the kitchen.<br><br>On my most recent visit I asked the hostess to have a booth because this was going to be a working lunch and we needed some room to layout our documents and make notes.  She took me to a table that had benches...I asked her if she considered it a booth and she said yes.  I then informed her that my colleague was not going to be happy but she insisted it was a booth.  So we sat down and literally our chest were at the table height.  There was no way we could even write or take notes. I hate to say I told you so but I am going to say, &#34;I TOLD YOU SO!&#34;<br><br>So we got up and asked her again if we could have a booth.  It was already after 1pm and we had missed the lunch crowd, so there were plenty of booths in the back.  She then took us to a booth that had been half cleaned but not on my side.  I grabbed a clean napkin from another table and picked up the dirty tray and moved it to the next table. I then used the napkin to wipe up the mess.  It was awkward with me just standing in the aisle and I was not about to sit on top of a mess.<br><br>The bus boy arrived and started to clean our whole table again.  He then grabbed his dirty gross full of wet food tray. Next he took silverware from the table that the dirty gross full of wet food tray was sitting on top of and placed it all in front of me.  Honestly I was so grossed out.  Someone call the health department!  How oblivious could this guy be?  This is just bad management and a corporation that does not care about keeping things clean for their customers.  I got up again and went to a different table to get myself some fresh silverware, a new plate and a clean napkin.  <br><br>We ordered our food and made a few simple requests.  For example, I ordered my turkey sandwich to have mayo on the side.  Guess what?  I got mayo on the side and also got mayo on the sandwich.  Really?  Again the kitchen did not care enough to read the notes of the waiter.  I did not send it back because we were having a business meeting and I just needed to keep working and eating at the same time.  I also got my salad dressing on the side too and it never came to the table.  I had to remind the food runner about it and eventually the waiter brought it.<br><br>My buddy got the fish tacos and when I asked him how they were he made a face that told me they were not really good.  I am so glad we did not share them because I would have been mad.  He then said, &#34;I do not even like this place it is just so close to the office!&#34;  Not to self...find a new restaurant to have our lunch meetings in!<br><br>So yes this place is a tourist trap.  It is one of those chains that all of the hungry shoppers on Michigan Avenue from out of town end up in because it is familiar to them.  Now do not get me wrong there cheesecake is good and maybe cheesecake on this visit would have made me feel better or even 4 star-ish but cheesecake and business lunches do not go together.<br><br>The food here is not that great.  In all of the years I have still not found anything on this menu that just jumps out and says, &#34;Order me all of the time!&#34;  In fact, I just give up!  This place is a cheesecake place that happens to serve bad food too.  And when I say bad food...I mean food that is not even special or good.  I was also not happy with the service.  A hostess who could not actually give us a booth even though there were a bunch available.  A busboy who really did not care if his dirty disgusting tray was touching clean silverware and plates.  Someone could get sick because of this.  Food that had special requests made but none of the special requests were even carried out correctly.  <br><br>This place just keeps packing people in and does not care to make it the best experience ever!  And that is sad with all of the amazing restaurants in downtown Chicago.  I wish you would clean up your act cheesecake factory and have a little respect for the product you are serving the public.

The good the bad and the ugly:<br><br>The GAUDIEST restaurant I&#39;ve ever seen personally. <br>My dirty silverware, just so off putting<br>A nice, but no name server as an &#34;order taker&#34;<br>No saucer OR spoon for my dbl espresso, not happy.<br> <br>This pizza is pretty &#34;picture perfect&#34;<br>Avocado club screams yummy value<br><br>Tiramisu was stellar, yet the beauty of a classic dessert from Italy was taken away with a half a pound of whipped cream they put on the desert- there&#39;s literally more whipped cream and than there was desert, very sad.

It&#39;s been a while since I have been to any Cheesecake Factory. The decor here in the Chicago place is awful. The food was good. Drinks were good. But for myself only, I had two top shelf long islands and dinner, I also ordered a cheesecake to go. 75.00 for myself with tip. Was it worth it, no not really. For that, I wish I went somewhere else. I remember the piece of cheesecake to be huge. I got a tiny little sliver. So many other options. Go somewhere else for that price tag.
We order chicken teriyaki the portion was big and the flavour very nice also .<br>Me and my son eat and left food on the plate it&#39;s enough for 2 people and 1 kid:-)

It&#39;s good food and great service but when this place gets packed (often at this location), it&#39;s hard for staff to keep up with the amount of customers coming in... I have been to better Cheesecake Factories for sure. Choose different location if you can.

Had an amazing experience at The Cheesecake Factory and our waiter Lucas was amazing. He was very attentive and helpful. The portions are huge so I would split or plan to have leftovers. Had the Tex mex eggrolls, miso salmon, and gumbo. The main courses came out before the app so they took it off the bill, which is such a simple gesture that is greatly appreciated.

My boyfriend and I just both literally got home and threw up. We ate chicken and shrimp and never ever ever going back there again. We live in Chicago and was just looking for something easy and cheap. Better off going to a real restaurant and not risk food poisoning or cheap service. Lesson learned. So gross.

We were dining with a party of 8. From the get go our server was on point. The service from Shanelle was outstanding. Never had to ask for water or tea refills (which is huge in my book). She was knowledgeable, patient, pleasant and overall amazing. To top it off, all of our food was great. From the steaks to the spaghetti and meatballs and my miso salmon, everyone wiped their plates clean and had cheesecake for dessert. I had the mango key lime cheesecake which I thought was the perfect blend of sweet and tart. Good job Cheesecake Factory!  We&#39;ll definitely be back.

Beware, if you&#39;re headed to Cheesecake Factory for their happy hour specials and think you can take advantage of their $15 parking validation you misread the details just like I did. $15 parking validation doesn&#39;t go into effect until 6pm, once the happy hour special is over. Reading is essential kids. The $37 parking fee I got overshadowed any dining experience I thought I was enjoying! If parking isn&#39;t an issue, then their happy hour menu is worth a visit. For a table of three adults, four drinks and four appetizers ordered, the bill was around $60. Their avocado eggrolls were my favorite!

Getting seated was quick.  It was the service that was lacking.  It took over 10 minutes for someone to acknowledge our party and at least offer waters.  The food was warm but we asked for additional grated parmesan and extra plate which never came.  Are off the bread plate for meal I was sharing.  <br><br>The overall feeling was they are understaffed for the crowds they serve.  Perhaps having a designated assistant per area that helps the wait staff would be great.

Hurts to write this review because my waitress was incredibly sweet and attentive, plus the restaurant looks like you&#39;re in a unique version of Alice in wonderland........BUT the food is just o.k. I ordered the same dishes from other locations, and they have tasted like heaven, but again, the food here is just o.k. The same taste wasn&#39;t there. Some foods were over cooked, burned, or just tasteless.

Another great place to visit, I came here with friends for a late dinner and decided to go with one of the salads on the menu! <br><br>It took them a few to get us seated but not that significant delay for a last call. I ordered BBQ chicken ranch salad which tasted great and the portion is huge, definitely for more than one person! Could be also shared for the whole table. <br><br>Now lets talk about the taste, i loved it, the combination of the greens, chicken with BBQ sauce on top and the crusty fried onions on top!<br><br>I took one star off for their lack of order in bringing food to the table, the cheesecake came 1st then the bread &amp; butter then the food! But i wouldn&#39;t be blaming them it is the end of the day! <br><br>One of the awesome places to try in chicago for sure.

My husband and I dined there on our 5th wedding anniversary a couple weeks ago and it was too chilly to eat outside, but we were seated right away.  It took awhile for our server to greet us, which seemed odd since it was slow.  Once she did greet us, she did a great job and the food was superb.  My complaint is about the atmosphere.  It was so dark in there that we had to use the flashlights on our phones to read the menu.  The music was so incredibly loud that even my husband, who works commercial construction &amp; is used to loud noises, said that it was ridiculous.  And what&#39;s up with the ceiling?  Not sure what it&#39;s supposed to be, but it looks like a bunch of butts falling from the sky.  The whole experience made me feel so claustrophobic and awkward that we asked to take the dessert to go.  Turn up the lights and turn down the music so people don&#39;t have to shout to hear each other.
Huge portions and pretty tasty food. The noodles I had were uncooked though so that was disappointing. Got service and sat quickly.

Me and my husband ate here our second night in Chicago and it was amazing. He got the crispy pineapple chicken &amp; shrimp with brown rice and I had spicy chicken chipotle pasta. Both were delicious!  We shared an appetizer of &#34;buffalo bursts&#34; and a few pineapple mojitos which was hands down the best cocktail we had our entire stay in the city. Were from Alabama and had never eaten at the Cheesecake Factory because the closest location is 2 hours away from where we live,  but now we will definitely be making the trip on date night.
Haven&#39;t been here yet but I thought I&#39;d mention that this was Chris Farley&#39;s favorite restaurant in Chicago. He&#39;d eat here very often. He lived right upstairs.

Lets start with the good. The guac and steak and salmon along with the drinks were all good. But thats where it stopped.<br><br>Cynthia was our waitress, she was a nice enough lady but a terrible waitress. It took close to 10 minutes to come over and greet us. She took our drink orders and got those over to us but forgot the water, the first of 4 times asking for water. Then we ordered our appetizer and dinners. The app came and we still didn&#39;t have silverware or plates until she came and checked on us and we had to ask. The guac was great, but we had to wait another 35-40 minutes for our meals. For our second round of drinks she brought me a margarita instead of Sangria and said &#34;they are both Mexican drinks&#34;....(FALSE). When my meal actually came out she forgot my creamed corn.. I believe the main issue was that she decided to not use a note pad so she had to come back and confirm what we actually wanted.<br><br>The most aggravating part of the whole experience was that every time she made a mistake she would make up some long excuse to try and make us feel sorry for her. She even mentioned that her son was at another table and that they were caught up talking. The dinner was hard to enjoy because we were getting increasingly more upset with our service as the night continued... <br><br>A manager stopped by our table to check on us:<br>Manager: &#34;How is everything this evening for you?&#34;<br><br>Me: &#34;......um just alright&#34;<br><br>Manager: &#34;Alright, well I just wanted to check to make sure everything was going well. You&#39;re <br>welcome.&#34; **briskly walks away**<br><br>SOOO AWKWARD!!! What was the point of even checking on us?!?<br><br>This was the WORST service in my entire life.. the reason I created a Yelp account. To the management of Cheesecake Factory I would require Cynthia to take some training classes because she was not up to par with serving standards....

Look, I&#39;m going to be honest here: I do not eat at Cheesecake Factory, because their food is just too much, and I don&#39;t want to get diabetes. However, I must say that the bar is simply amazing. I&#39;ve never seen bartenders work more efficiently and without breaks. The drinks may be a bit pricey, but they&#39;re not unreasonable given the location, and I promise you won&#39;t ever have something as wonderful as their strawberry martini. Just last week I drank over $100 worth of them in one sitting.<br>So if you care about not getting fat or acquiring diabetes, don&#39;t eat there. But if you like a good drink and a fantastic bartender, head directly to the bar.

I called for carry out twice and both times was told &#34;20 minutes.&#34; I arrived 20-25 minutes later both times to find that my order hadn&#39;t been put in yet, so I had to wait another 15 minutes. Luckily, I wasn&#39;t in a rush, but I definitely won&#39;t be here if I do have to be back at my desk within a specific amount of time. <br><br>While I was waiting the second time, I asked for a jar of their salad dressing to take home. The cashier asked me three times which one (&#34;sesame soy.&#34; Say that 3 times fast!), and she still gave me the wrong one. Food: win, Service: fail.
When we came to the table it was still dirty and there was no silverware. The food is good though .. Prices are high and the wait is long, but if you can make it through..

I love going to the Cheesecake Factory! They usually have excellent food and excellent service. However, I will never go to this one again. <br>I thought it was going to be a positive experience since we got seated right away and the hostess was friendly; however, everything went downhill after that. We waited over an hour for our food to come out. We didn&#39;t get our appetizer we had ordered. Then they didn&#39;t even bring out the fries with my boyfriend&#39;s burger. We brought these issues to their attention and they said they would bring the fries right away and make sure we weren&#39;t charged for the appetizer. Ended up having to wait another 30 minutes for some fries. They offered us cheesecake on the house and ended up charging us for it. I was done complaining to them. I literally spent over 2 hours in this restaurant with negative impression. I will never be back to this location.
For some reason I find that my wife always orders a better tasting dish. Don&#39;t know how she does it. Anyway, this place never disappoints.

Cheesecake.  Oh. Cheesecake. Parkyr was over the moon about the smooth creaminess. Cute outdoor patio at this location as well with a sweet fountain to enjoy or the dark sensuous detailed ambiance indoors is wonderful and so very private to have great conversations.

Never been to a Cheesecake Factory before. Can&#39;t say I&#39;ll be in line to go back. <br><br>We just wanted a nice dinner with our kids on our last night in Chicago. We checked in at 4:45 and it was an hour wait. We waited outside where a ton of other people were also waiting. <br><br>It was pretty much an hour and it was our turn. We were seated in a corner booth. At least 10 minutes later our hurried waiter finally appeared. We ordered our drinks and meals at that time. At least 10 minutes after that our bread came. At least 15 - 20 minutes after that our food came. <br><br>I got the chicken bellagio which was actually wonderful. My husband had the chicken and biscuit which was just &#34;eh&#34; and the kids had mini corn dogs, chicken strips and pasta Parmesan. My daughters fries were not brought out with her meal and she was pretty much done eating by the time they arrived. <br><br>The waiter never really asked how we were doing. He was running around like a maniac which made us feel hurried and on edge. NOT a relaxing meal. He did keep our glasses full. <br><br>We ordered our cheesecakes to go. Paid and left.  Within 20 minutes of leaving all four of my kids were sick with upset stomachs and diarrhea. Not a good experience when you have one bathroom in the hotel and they are fighting over who has to go worse. Something they used in the food destroyed their bowels. After an hour they were good again. <br><br>We brought back two slices of cheesecake. A cherry and a dulce de leche. Must say &#34;super disappointed&#34;. Very little flavor, whipped cream was blah- had absolutely no sweetener in it and might as well been butter on top. Couldn&#39;t finish either slice. <br><br>For $77 with a tip on top of that- I will go eat elsewhere.

The food was really good. For all my gluten-free people, the gluten-free menu was really good, it had a wide variety and you get a lot of food. The service was okay our waitress couldve been friendlier but was efficient.   definitely worth it!

Just went in to pick up a cheesecake to go, and Katrina the cashier who helped me did not like the fact that I did not tip her for her service. Even though the only service I received was to cut a piece of cheesecake and put in on a plate. When she called my name for my name she tossed my bag on the counter and said my name with attitude. Incredibly terrible service. I havw been to over 20 cheesecakes around the U.S and I have never received this service from a pick up order. I did NOT dine in or anything. Katrina is unbelievably rude and im glad I did not tip. Tips should not be demanded or required, they should be given when an actual service is done and if the person has gone above and beyond a bigger tip is given.
Amazing food and service every time we come here . The wait here is never long the longest we&#39;ve waited for a table was maybe 15 minutes on a Saturday afternoon. My kids really love coming here
This place is always busy.  Our waiter was good and attentive.  Food was good. Not great just good.  Cheesecake was excellent.  Next time I will eat somewhere else but get cheesecake to go.

Had a great experience at The Cheesecake Factory at the Hancock building<br>Our server, Jamari E, was fantastic. He was genuinely concerned about my sons food allergies, confirming what was safe and what wasn&#39;t safe for him<br>Great service!

Ordered through Doordash Delivery a sandwich and a bowl of ice cream. Online it shows three scoops with whipped cream. Received one and a half little scoops and no whipped cream. Also the sandwich was cold. ($30 delivery and tip). Very disappointing!
One of my favorite places in Chicago. I ordered Grilled Pork Chop and it was AMAZING. The service was phenomenal! They were all so kind and friendly. Awesome location!

The lines are long sometimes and it can be crowded due to the location. No reservations can be made. There are so many gluten-free options here and the staff try their best to prevent any cross contamination. If it&#39;s your birthday, they will come and sing you a song with your cheesecake. I think you get a free sundae if you don&#39;t buy a cheesecake.

I have been coming to this location for more than 20 years and it has always been one of the best places to people watch or get lost in the cave if dining inside; except this trip proved to be rather disappointing in both quality of food to the price and speed of service. While I would recommend coming here for a nice little break from Michigan Ave., stick with the cheesecake and a cup of coffee. There are much better options to spend money on in ChiTown.

It is pathetic place. We were first placed a table that could fit just 2 people and then when we got the table it was highly unhygienic. The person cleaning the table used wet cloth with no disinfectant and then he used the same hands to give us cutlery. The table also had wet spots. <br>We went with 2 kids and we were told there was no kids menu and they served my kids with adult glasses. I warn people who have families please go at your risk of health

This location is located at the bottom of the John Hancock building. It&#39;s such a beautiful location! They are always super busy but the wait time is never too long. You can either eat inside or outside but I prefer eating inside because the fountain outside is kind of loud.<br><br>Service here is impeccable! I&#39;ve never had bad service here. They get your food out to you pretty fast too. <br><br>We got the avocado egg rolls for our appetizer and it was OK. Not as good as other places. It was kinda too thick for me. Their calamari is amazing. I always get the fettuccine Alfredo with broccoli and portobello mushrooms and I&#39;m always satisfied about halfway through the entree because it&#39;s such a huge portion. My husband orders something different everytime we go from burgers to steak and he is always satisfied by the end of the meal. Their cheesecake here, just like any other Cheesecake Factory is to die for! I try to get something different every time, and I&#39;ve never been disappointed. But I think my most favorite thing about this restaurant is the vibe. It&#39;s dim in there with the beautiful city outside.

Staying with my family on Michigan Ave. and needed somewhere to eat. Walked into a very crowded Cheesecake Factory and headed straight for the bar. We found an open table quickly but it was quite dirty.<br><br>The service was great, however, the food was less than desirable. We shared the nachos that were just &#34;ok&#34;. This location in general lacked the charm. <br><br>Will not return, mostly based on that I don&#39;t come down to river north often.

Service was unbelievably slow. Sure they were busy but after being seated it was clear that the servers and other personnel didn&#39;t care. To make matters worse I got food poisoning and have been puking my brains out.  Do t bother with this restaurant.  There are plenty of other great options in this area.

Disappointed with this location, the lowest I have every rated a Cheesecake Factory was a 4 before.<br><br>After walking in drenched from the soaking rain and the restaurant not being very busy we were ignored for a few minutes...and were finally seated.<br><br>The next thing the bread that was brought out was totally hard and stale, and they did not bring any of that brown oat bread, just the white stuff (everyone else got a mixture)  Suffice to say after one bite we moved the bread to the side.<br><br>The meal and Cheesecake were good, but when finished the meal we had to wait 15 minutes to order Cheesecake even though the restaurant was not busy. <br><br>I am sure it was just one of those things that happen but it was my worst Cheesecake Factory experience.

Seemed like a solid idea. Order a late meal online and walk across the street from our hotel to pick up, easy-peasy.  The Cheesecake Factory, nothing stellar but consistently average. The online order placed with confirmation that order would be ready in 25 minutes. Stroll across the street a few minutes early and check in with the cheesecake counter guy, he informs me kitchen is running about 10-15 minutes behind, no sweat I&#39;ll just sit outside in the plaza for a few minutes and then I&#39;ll be on my way. 30 minutes later counter guy is getting hounded by an irate customer in a similar predicament as I, numerous food delivery guys (door dash, grub hub, etc.) milling around waiting for their orders. Manager finally is summoned to deal irate customer #1, he handles it admirably, but their is no satisfying this one. Counter guy let&#39;s me know my order is coming together and is being staged on the counter with all their finest takeout packaging, he notices a few items missing and alerts the kitchen. We&#39;re now past an hour after ordering, about 20 minutes later part 2 of order arrives, I approach manager and ask if he&#39;s aware of the huge backlog, he assures me my order is ready to go, then I remind him that half of my order has been sitting on the counter for about 20 minutes and my hotel room is not equipped with a microwave. He offers a slice of cheesecake to ease the pain, I tell him cheesecake is no match for the bitching and moaning I&#39;ll get when I show up to the hotel room an hour later than expected with cold food. I am if he thinks they can re-do the order, he looks at me like I&#39;m out of my mind, but obliges. Text my wife to let her know what&#39;s going on, she informs me both kids have fallen asleep. I track down the manager to let him know it doesn&#39;t look like it&#39;s meant to be, he&#39;s sincere with his apologies and refunds my credit card. Bottom line, their online ordering system is not synced up with their kitchen and the inundation of food delivery services have completely overwhelmed these type of operations. Lesson learned, room service ain&#39;t that bad after all.

This place is absolutely horrible. Our party had to wait over 1.5 hours to get a seat. Not only was the wait horrible, but the service was deplorable. Once the pager rang out party had to wait an additional hour to get a table. This was after multiple complaints to many different servers, managers, and owners. On top of all all of the waiting our party was was promised and free appetizers (probably, so I won&#39;t post a bad review) and it took more than 45 minutes to arrive. <br>In all the wait time to get a table, the service, and the kitchen preparing time are all horrid. If it were possible the place would receive zero stars from me.

Horrible service don&#39;t recommend this place wait to crazy service is really bad, we wait so much to get seated and to order a cheeescake so much almost 1 hour, definitely not coming back here this specific location .:( so sad I expected more I brought friends and family very disappointed.
Would get five but for<br>Some reason they always run out of ice cream. Maybe you should consider ordering a larger quantity if you know you run out.

They get two stars for their incredible service and cheesecake, but our food was terrible. Pasta carbonara was almost inedible because it was SO salty! (And I&#39;m usually a pretty heavy seasoner myself. This was just too much.) The Bacon Bacon burger...  is it possible to have too much bacon? Yes. The burger was perfectly done, but the toppings killed it. Too much cheese, too much bacon, too much... stuff. We were bummed. But our server was excellent! <br><br>Francisco never let our mugs run dry of water and we were majorly dehydrated when we got there. He refilled it at least three times!
