As a former server, I know how hard it is to get the details right when you&#39;re slammed busy, and he did great! Very happy with him. I just wish our food wouldn&#39;t have been so awful.
Absolutely loved the Hershey&#39;s Cheesecake! Amazing proportions and a really pleasant ambiance too!

Came to this location right under or on the ground level of the Hancock building.  It was a late Monday night.<br><br>If you really want to impress someone I would suggest coming to this location as I stated is located under the Hancock.  <br><br>I came for desert only and got the Reese&#39;s Cheesecake.  It was extremely good but also extremely rich.  I should of gotten a glass of milk to go with it.

If you have a large group of people and everyone wants something different then this is the place to go.  Their signature lettuce wraps are excellent (pricey).  This one is right below the John Hancock Building and gets very crowded and the seats are VERY close to one another and loud.  Not a great place for a quiet date unless you get a booth in the back.  As for the cheesecakes, there are so many to choose from and I have never had a bad one yet.  The lemon meringue is a recent one I&#39;ve tried and if you like lemon it&#39;s fabulous.  There is a little bit of coconut in it.  Definitely worth a try but beware it is pricey.

Ate gumbo with shrimp and chicken 7 to 8pm at The Cheesecake Factory Magnificent Mile North Michigan Ave.  between 7-8 pm... The shrimp tasked &#39;ok&#39; (nothing special) -- the chicken had no taste whatsoever and a very odd soft weird spongy texture. I left the last few pieces on the plate and didn&#39;t manage to finish this entree. I should add that the rice tasted crisp and in a watery lump presentation wise heaped in centre of plate. Walked home... by 11 severe gas, nausea and cramping then by 11:30 until 1:30 multiple rounds of violent vomiting and projectile vomiting. Reported to board of health online.

Very nice place! My last lunch in Chicago was here and I&#39;m not regret! Avocado rolls were tasty, but portions here are too bigAnd prices as well. Anyway I want to visit this place again and try here cheesecake!
We had a large group here for a birthday and our waitress was fantastic. She was attentive and friendly. Our food was great and so was the cheesecake. The birthday girl had a blast.
Great ambience and tasty vegetarian food. Cheese was in  abundance with choicest veggies and great pasta.

One of our favorite restaurants at n Chicago. Even though a chain, still it is very good. Their menu is extensive and it will take you a few minutes to read through. At the end you will not know what to choose from because they have a lot of good choices so you need to come back and try the one you like. <br>They also have gluten free and healthy portions to choose from. <br>I love coming here when the wether is nice and can sit outside. The atmosphere inside is good as well, pleasing to adults and children. <br>Another great meal last weekend with the family. <br>We will come back when the wether warms up.
Beautiful and tasty cheesecakes everywhere! <br>Really hard to make a choice! :)<br>Nice place to go w friends or family!

I ordered Thai lettuce wraps like always and mango smoothie. They are quite good. My boyfriend ordered New York steak, it&#39;s ok. We also had chocolate mousse cheesecake &amp; coffee. The cake is ok but they don&#39;t have good coffee.

Went to Cheesecake Factory on Christmas Eve. Had to wait for 45 minutes even though I was told to wait for only 15 minutes. Anyway, after this got shown to my table and had a great server which made up for the initial mess-up. Ordered Bang bang chicken n shrimp along with Chicken with cashew nuts... Both were great... Though it could have been a tad bit more spicy. The kiddie meals (cheese pizza n chicken tenders) were also nicer than most places. The kids had fudge sundaes which were great and the cheesecake slices (keylime n original) were melt-in-ur-mouth. Overall, a great meal n a wonderful experience for 2 adults n 2 kids in $65. <br>The only thing I&#39;d change is the portions..... Seeing mountains of food makes me lose my appetite a bit :)

This is a chain restaurant so the food tastes the same as it does at every other Cheesecake Factory. However, the service leaves A LOT to be desired. <br><br>When we sat down our waiter said that he would be back to take our drink order and when he came back he brought waters for all four of us with him. (The waters aren&#39;t significant now but they will be). After he took our drink order (two iced teas, one diet coke, one strawberry lemonade) and appetizer order, he came back with the two teas and said that he had completely forgotten the diet coke and needed to pick up the lemonade from the bar and that he had put in our order for the appetizer. <br><br>We didn&#39;t see him for another 10 minutes, that is, he didn&#39;t come to our table to check on us. He served the table across from us the lemonade we had ordered, that they had ordered after us and he stood at the computer most of the time shaking his head and punching buttons. <br><br>Our appetizer came out before the other half of our drink order came. When we were done with our appetizer he brought the other two drinks that had been ordered. We waited another 50 minutes for our food to come. During this time our waiter visited the aforementioned computer several times and continued to punch more buttons, shake his head in frustration and talk to himself. <br><br>The one time he did come to see how we were, he brought a water pitcher to refill the waters that we had to drink because our regular drink orders were empty, but he didn&#39;t refill any of the drinks we actually wanted. It took another 20 minutes after we finished our food, and had requested boxes, for us to receive said boxes and the check. <br><br>The only way this restaurant would be worth visiting is if someone came at a time that was not the busy dinner rush. <br><br>We sat next to the kitchen and saw how small it was and that the kitchen staff was trying their hardest to pump out orders while the wait staff stood around joking with each other, dropping plates and cups (6 dropped plates/cups occurred while we were seated, God knows how many there are every other day) and scavenging off of plates of food that had been returned. <br><br>As a patron I honestly do not appreciate seeing my waiter, and the rest of the wait staff, eat off of the same plate, using their bare hands and proceeding with their duties without washing their hands at any time during the whole process. <br><br>Also, the kitchen was rather small and I am not sure if it was responsible for serving both stories of the restaurant, which would not be wise on behalf of the restaurant chain itself, which could have accounted for it taking so long with our food to arrive. <br><br>Either way, if I am in the Chicago area again I will not return to this location.

Cheesecake is definitely an indulgence that we all crave from time to time, and The Cheesecake Factory is the place you want to go if you want to give in to your urges!<br><br>Although they do cheesecake very well, their other food items are delicious as well.  From large tasty Cobb Salads, to extra large portions of pasta, you won&#39;t be disappointed with what you get!  But be warned, since their portions are so large, you&#39;ll probably end up taking some home with you, unless you share!<br><br>I went to the John Hancock location in Chicago, so it tends to be a busier place.  The lighting was very low, so it made it a bit difficult to see the menu, and it did make me a bit sleepy.  It could also have been from a food coma, or the 5 miles of walking I did.... but more lighting would still have been appreciated.  Their bathrooms are located outside the restaurant, and accessible to the general public, I&#39;m not a huge fan of that.....<br><br>When the warmer weather hits... try to get an outdoor table and enjoy the sunshine!

It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory. It is spectacular. Ginormous menu. The bread is incredible and the service is usually good. Love their fries, sandwiches, and their pasta carbonara in particular! I don&#39;t branch out much on the menu because we really just go for the cheesecake. They have this one covered in caramel right now that is to die for. Honestly (and perhaps sadly) still one of our favorite places to eat in Chicago after living here for years. <br><br>Unfortunately, there is just about always a huge wait (45-hour) but it&#39;s a huge chain and its in the heart of Michigan ave. so it&#39;s honestly to be expected. Go kill some time upstairs in Best Buy drooling over TVs you&#39;ll never be able to afford!

Oddest looking Cheesecake Factory I have ever seen. Nonetheless, does not disappoint.. Busy but was sat within minutes. Extremely nice staff, great food. Drinks came very fast.<br><br>Little chaotic, and food came a little slow, but would definitely recommend after having drinks at the signature lounge on the 96th floor.

While staying in Chicago, my friends and I decided to stop by The Cheesecake Factory underneath the John Hancock for dinner. I ordered a flatbread, and it was delicious. And obviously, their cheesecake is unreal. Although the location is great and the atmosphere is good, I think that you are paying for the name over the quality of the food. The menu seems pretty expensive for what you get, but it&#39;s a fun place to say that you&#39;ve been to. I would definitely go back for cheesecake!

This place! Lord Jesus!!!!!!! We went here this past Monday the 21st for my niece&#39;s birthday. My family drove in from Michigan and I drove in from St Louis for the day. My niece LOVES Cheesecake factory and we were uber excited about ending our day of family fun there! (especially after our HORRIFIC experience at the Cheesecake Factory in St. Louis back in April) Well, let me tell you.  This location came in for runner up of the worst Cheesecake Factory that I have ever been to! <br>I&#39;m sure by now you want details. Well, I am about to fill you in. <br>To begin. Me, My Aunt, and 3 nieces sat for about 10 minutes without being offered water or ANYTHING. Finally, the waiter offers us beverages. When he returns he manages to spill my niece&#39;s lemonade all over the table. Yes, accidents happen BUT this man did not apologize and he also DID NOT LIFT A FINGER TO CLEAN UP THE MESS! Yes, you heard that HE DID NOT LIFT A FINGER TO CLEAN UP THE ENTIRE MUG OF SPILLED LEMONADE. My aunt and niece cleans up this mess and he returns close to 5 minutes later with a new lemonade. He had the audacity to look irritated when I asked for a wet cloth so that we can clean the table and it not be sticky. After receiving the wet cloth HE WATCHED MY AUNT WIPE THE TABLE DOWN. I thought the situation was comical and said to him, &#39; I cant believe you&#39;re just going to watch her clean the table.&#34; After my joking statement he still DID NOT HELP MY AUNT CLEAN THE TABLE. He grabbed a busser as she passed and said, &#34;Can you wipe this down THEY SPILLED A DRINK.&#34; (DID YOU CATCH THAT? NHE BLAMED IT ON US) <br>Everyone at our table was freezing and we asked to move tables due to the draft of cold air. Guess what. We were just blatantly told NO! ARE YOUU SERIOUS!<br><br>So, after that we much needed an adult beverage! I ordered a Whiskey Smash and my aunt ordered a Bellini of some sort. We ordered our food and was never offered another drink EVER!  After a great deal of time our food arrived and mine was cold and my Southern Fried Catfish was undercooked.  This was the visit from hell!  <br><br>Jesus! We waited another 35 minutes for them to remake my food! <br>ALSO TO TOP OFF THIS VISIT........ WE WERE NEVER OFFERED CHEESECAKE! <br>This experience totally ruined the finale of my niece&#39;s birthday!

Simply amazing. It is my first TCF experience and i loved it. We had to wait 15-20mins on Saturday night for a table, but the we didn&#39;t mind as I have always wanted to try it. We ordered the avocado rolls and lasagna. The avocado rolls were simply amazing, they tasted fresh and light. I ordered a mojito and even though it was a little too sweet for my taste, it packed quite a punch. The food portions a huge so i would suggest to plan accordingly.

Have to update this to a 1 star now as we had a second manager come by and in our opinion made it worse. She comped our appetizers however those were fine. What they should have comped were our two meals. They obviously did that because the appetizers were half the price. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory is off our list when visiting Chicago.

Always a long wait with a beeping machine. Too over-rated by tourists and media. <br>To me it&#39;s not that different from olive garden or applebees. but for two people it usually costs us about $70 dollars.<br>Cheesecake is not that impressive either.

I know how busy this location can get during lunch time so I placed an online order at 12:44pm for JUST two slices of cheesecake. Email said it was estimated to be ready at 1:04pm. I arrived at 1:10pm, there was no one behind the counter and only 2 customers ahead of me. After seeing that no one was being attended to I asked the hostess twice if they can get someone to assist. After 15 minutes of waiting for someone to assist us there were already 11 customers waiting. Finally a few staff showed up and instead of asking who is next to be helped they started just calling out names for pickups disregarding the first two customers that were there first. I asked the hostess for a refund and she went to get the manager, that took even longer. The manager just asked for my name and receipt, no apologies or asking how to help or make things right. Then he had to figure out how to refund my card with my online order. As he was doing that I asked him &#34;to be clear my order is still not ready?&#34; and he said &#34;oh yeah, it&#39;s ready.&#34; Then handed me a receipt showing $0.00 and said I will get my refund in 2-3 business days and sent me on my way. This was the weirdest and unpleasant experience for me. I am very upset that I wasted all that time and energy here!!!! 100% I WILL NOT BE BACK!!!!!

I must admit as a newbie in Chicago, I had to try the cheesecake factory. Well I like the food, the food is tasty, I have been there more than 3 times and I have not been disappointed. Very touristy but u know what, I love trying different types of restaurants. The cheesecake is amazing I often go there to crab a slice or two, that&#39;s the main reason why I go there lol. The waiters and the waitresses try really hard to make customers happy, despite the place being busy most of the time. This is my take away spot lol

Positives<br><br>5 Stars for the variety of cheesecakes (favorites include: Ultimate Red Velvet Cake Cheesecake, Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake and Vanilla Bean Cheesecake)<br><br>4 Stars for the employees working there. On each visit to this location I have had excellent service from the greeter telling me how ridiculous long I&#39;ll have to wait to eat at a chain restaurant, to the host/hostess who have seated me and didn&#39;t mind finding me another table when I saw that they were trying to place me next to a family with a bunch of kids, to the friendly wait staff.<br><br>3 Stars for the take out menu. The fact that you place your order and pick it up so you don&#39;t have to wait 2 hours just to sit and eat food that is OK, but not AMAZING.<br><br>3 Stars for the SkinnyLicious Menu were all the items are under 590 calories; thus allowing you to not feel so guilty when you order two slices of cheesecake for yourself (one to eat there and one to go).<br><br>Negatives<br><br>1 Star for the boat load of tourist who visit this place as if it has 3 Michelin Stars. If there isn&#39;t a Cheesecake Factory in your country I can SORTA understand why you would come here, but if there&#39;s one in your city you have no excuse for visiting this place when you&#39;re on vacation.<br><br>2 Stars for the food which is nothing special. It&#39;s OK, but you&#39;ll never hear me calling home to tell the family about the awesome 1500 calorie pasta dish I just had.

We stopped in before a show at the Broadway Playhouse. We sat at the bar to enjoy their happy hour. The happy hour menu is excellent. Good choices at reasonable prices. The potstickers were one of the best we&#39;ve had. Our bartender, Jonathan, was outstanding, very attentive. And makes an awesome cosmo!

It&#39;s a huge place!!! You need to wait before you&#39;ll sit, but it&#39;s very quick procedure . I came to try the famous cheesecake , I don&#39;t remember the name , as usual , lol, I prefer to ask the staff about their specials and bests. The cheesecake was just amazing !!!!! The best in my life and a big slice, good to share for two people .

We had a great server which made the experience enjoyable. <br><br>It was quite loud, but the venue was able to seat is quite quickly.  The Mac and cheese balls and the nachos with chicken were great. I didn&#39;t mind the house wine. <br><br>Definitely recommend this place, but know that it can be quite loud.  However, the service was fast!
Never disappoints me, I always get the same Lettuce Chicken Wraps Asian style that I love so much!!  my friends tried diferent things and they were all happy with their choices.

Great food, nice romantic setting and a very customer service oriented staff. Everyone in our party gave high mark&#39;s to the unique selection ordered. From fish and chips or Ruben to various breakfast selections.  Excellent!

Great night with good friends! We had about 35 people in our group and they accommodated us with our own room! For dinner I ordered the chicken Madeira and steak Diane combo and it was cooked perfectly and it came out nice and hot. Our server Ro did an excellent job keeping track of where all of our orders were even though we happened to move around from seat to seat. Great service and excellent response time!

We went here because it was the only place open late that had desert and my friend was wanting chocolate cake and carrot cake. My experiences at the cheesecake factories has not been good overall, but I was hoping since they specializes in cheesecake, this would be different. It was not! First of all, customer service here is not very good and it may be due to all the tourism. For example, the register guy was on the phone for some time taking an order while we waited to make an order in person. Shouldn&#39;t someone else do that? Shouldn&#39;t you take care of the customer in front of you first. We were not the only one&#39;s with this complaint. They did serve us some huge portions as you can see from the picture. However, the cakes tasted like batter and were super sugary. So bad, we threw most of it away. I felt guilty at first, but honestly it was not made for human consumption.

I ordered a pasta and oven roasted brocolli at 9:24 pm and it&#39;s 10:19 pm and I still haven&#39;t received my order. Friday night but still doesn&#39;t make sense for a restaurant to take a whole hour to make a plate of pasta and brocolli.

So I came here to eat and when we sat down, the waiter was so rude. She gave us attitude when asking us what we wanted to drink. When she came back with water she just threw it down the table towards my friends and didn&#39;t even give me water. After taking our order, she put in the wrong order and when the food came out we told them we didn&#39;t order it and they agreed to change it. She came back and said &#34;I repeated it twice so why didn&#39;t you tell me.&#34; She came to yell at us and put the blame on us but we apologized and said we didn&#39;t hear. We did not get any refills for our water and at this point I am positive that they aren&#39;t going to give me any water anymore but since I ordered a drink I didn&#39;t mind much.As we were eating, the waiter just handed us boxes even though we didn&#39;t ask for it and trying to kick us out WHILE WE WERE STILL EATING!!! That is so rude and she didn&#39;t treat any other table like this. I feel so insulted and disrespected since it wasn&#39;t even that busy when we came in so why were we being ignored and harrassed. We didn&#39;t make a big deal and the waiter was so petty and had so much attitude I won&#39;t even come here anymore if this is what they keep doing to their customers.

After walking for hours through Michigan avenue, we decided to reward ourselves with some cheese cake.  They actually have a lot of different dinner entrees but we just wanted the dessert. We tried both the tiramisu and caramel fudge turtle cheese cake. Both were very good but I liked the turtle more<br><br>Pic: <a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=HsZqwxCmPl4HIy8c1mvtDw&amp;userid=hJmKuvDPt6zaqVsEw6EzGw">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a><br>Pic: <a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=m2py2laXUVto2sIWZ-6KGQ&amp;userid=hJmKuvDPt6zaqVsEw6EzGw">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a>

I live in Chicago with so many great restaurants so I feel like it might be sinful to eat here on the regular but every time I come downtown I want to   <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory has everything you could possibly want in a menu. There is a taste for any palate, including a skinny menu with meals under 600 calories. Just be sure to be mentally prepared to have enough food for an army! Hello to go boxes! The cheesecake is also delicious as well obviously!<br><br>We always have a great service and food.

Very tasty and one thing I like is there is small plate menu with calories stated.<br>All of their portion is gigantic, if you order salad, you&#39;ll see the heap of leaves!! It&#39;s very good but I have to say it&#39;s to share, not to eat all alone.<br>I couldn&#39;t finish it up and not managed to get to cheesecake in this cheesecake factory. <br>Besides, the looks of the restaurant is pretty, resembles to the feeling of being in Disneyland!

We stopped in for lunch after a morning of shopping on Michigan Ave. With all of the entrances, it was a little confusing finding the host stand. We were a party of 5, and we waited about 15-20 minutes for a table during their lunch rush. Our server was great! I can&#39;t remember his name, but he was very helpful, knowledgable, and quick. I ordered the Spicy Crispy Chicken Sandwich (crispy chicken breast and your choice of spicy buffalo sauce or chipotle mayo with cheese, served on a brioche bun and your choice of side). My sandwich was delicious! Since we were celebrating my kid&#39;s birthday, we also decided to order a piece of cheesecake to share. She picked the Ultimate Red Velvet Cake Cheesecake (moist layers of Red Velvet Cake and their Original Cheesecake covered with their special Cheesecake Factory cream cheese frosting). AMAZING! They wrote Happy Birthday on the dessert plate, and a few servers came over to sing to her. So sweet.

Yes, the decor is fabulous, but the food was nowhere near as good as the interior design. I ordered some fettuccine and it felt hard and not cooked well. We all ordered some cheesecake though and for the most part, it was really good. My red velvet cheesecake wasn&#39;t as good as the normal cheesecake that one of my peers had.

We frequent Cheesecake Factory about once a year, usually on special occasions or girls night out.  My husband and I were staying at the Warwick Allerton Hotel downtown, and after a few hours on Navy Pier, were famished.  Hubby ordered pizza from Gino&#39;s East, which was meh...luckily, I didn&#39;t settle on plain old pizza.  I called and ordered carryout from Cheesecake Factory and it hit the spot!  Ordered the bistro shrimp pasta (I know it has over 2,000 calories in it, but they took off the shrimp po boy from the menu, which I was originally going to order, so I had to settle on this bad boy).  Let me tell you...It was ON POINT!!  Much better than the ones I&#39;ve been served previously at other locations.  The pasta was perfectly cooked with that yummy lemon cream sauce and the breaded shrimp was just amazing.  I also ordered kids&#39; mac n&#39; cheese for the kiddos, with a side order of large French fries, all for $34 carryout.  Our order was ready in 30 mins and hubby walked the 0.2 miles to pick it up.  He also picked up a slice of Godiva cheesecake, which is our all time fav, and it did not disappoint.  I&#39;m so happy we chose to do carryout and eat from the comfort of our hotel bed, rather than spend $70+ to sit in the restaurant, wait an hour to be seated, and receive subpar service (which has been our experience in the past at other locations).  We also skipped eating the bread, which would have added another couple hundred calories to an already high caloric meal...and, although I am up at 5:30 am trying to work off the pasta, fries, and cheesecake in the hotel gym, it was definitely worth every delicious calorie.  Will definitely order from this location on subsequent downtown visits.

The Cheesecake Factory has always been a favorite restaurant of mine, but after last night my opinion has changed. Both me and my friend ordered a Georgia peach cocktail, and ate the strawberries in it. We both stayed up all night last night projectile vomiting and has had d*arrhea. I am convinced there were salmonella traces on the fruit because we are incredibly sick. I am never coming back and I hope to report this location to the Illinois Health Depart and Control for food bourne illnesses. Disgusting.
Service was incredibly slow. Soda and waters were never refilled. Sandwich served without fries. Pasta was undercooked and flavorless. Disappointed to say the least.

Came here with a little less than an hour until close, around 10:40 PM. The food and service were incredible.<br><br>1. Freshly baked bread and butter<br><br>2. The most delicious angel hair pasta I&#39;ve ever had at any Cheesecake location with the most flavor, tomatoes, and sauce- this was the best version I&#39;ve had and I&#39;ve been ordering this menu item for over a decade<br><br>3. This main dish came out in under 10 minutes, and as mentioned previously, it was better than any other previous order of it throughout my entire lifetime<br><br>4. Ordered 3 slices of cheesecake- Oreo, Snickers, and Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter (these are the best flavors they have IMO) and was in complete ecstasy<br><br>5. Server was super friendly, fast, and filled our water throughout the dining experience very frequently

Long wait, defiantly recommend calling ahead with a reservation (waited 1 1/2 hrs) - service was so so .. Took about 15-20 minutes before someone came Over with water.. Bread basket didn&#39;t arrive for another 15-20 min or so.. Food was decent, meal portion sizes are enormous..enough to share!

I am in love with Cheesecake Factory! Their food is always amazing. I love their variety of cheesecake and dessert. Their food and cheesecake is a little pricey. It is also very high in calories. They do have a menu with lower calorie options. I had the basil, tomato, and cheese flatbread and it was amazing!

Generally good food with decent portions. I had their lunch Renee special, which is half a sandwich, the soup of the day, and a green salad, for around $12. It was pretty good. The soup was their French onion and it was rich and tasty. <br><br>Service was excellent. Our server Gyro was attentive but not intrusive. <br><br>This is a good value if you want to get something for lunch that is not just a sandwich, but not necessarily looking for gourmet cooking.

I really don&#39;t want to say bad thing about this place. They seem like want to do a good job. However they left me no choice, CHAOS is the only word I can find to describe what we saw tonight, and I cannot even imagine what&#39;s happening back in the kitchen. I&#39;d been waiting for my salad with ingredients they promised on the menu for over 90 minuets. I gave one extra stars for the manager&#39;s sort of sincere apology.

Had just done the hop on hop off tour and this was close to where we got off.  First of all we sat almost in the dark we had to request another table why do they have such dark lighting you need to use a flashlight! We were sat near the window the food is always the same in Cheesecake Factory so you know what to expect ! We had quesadillas and pot stickers to start - delicious- I ordered lunch size pasta carbonara but was still a big portion shared strawberry cheesecake for dessert really good.

Originally I would have given a much better review, unfortunately Cheesecake does not have a consistency of providing guests with great service not meals. When they are busy the quality decreases and unfortunately that is a deal breaker for any restaurant that operates in that manner! I feel that management needs to get their priorities straight and implement a plan to provide consistent high quality service as well as food on the menu!

Was very busy, but used to that with the Cheese Cake Factory.  Facility was clean and has a great look and feel.  <br><br>A bunch of the guys were able to sit at the bar and order without a wait.  Make it very easy for us to get in and watch the game at the bar.<br><br>One thing that we wish was upgraded...  The TV screens at the bar were WAY to small.  Must have been smaller than 32&#34; witch is almost a wast for having a tv screen up showing a sporting event.  So...  It&#39;s not a sports bar.  If your going to try and watch a game and eat...  Go somewhere else.

Thought it&#39;d be funny to try one out while at this Chicago conference (nothing &#34;wrong&#34; with the brand, per se, but not my thing (you know?))-- joke was on me.<br><br>It was 62 degrees in there. I had to blow in my hands the entire meal, and spent most of my time looking around at others and commiserating with them while they complained to their &#39;other/s&#39; about how cold it was. A single tear streaks down my cheek, as I&#39;ve only got Yelp at this meal.<br><br>In fact, I need to take a break from typing this to sit on my hands because I&#39;m losing feeling in them.<br><br>Okay, I&#39;m back-- so what else about this joint?  Highlight comes via the hostess station: these girls is a bunch of sour pusses, for real.  The only time they smile is when they swing through a server station to flirt with a guy or talk trash about the one coworker also seating (possibly manager) who is obviously not like the others. I&#39;ll just leave it at that.<br><br>They clearly lack knowledge about the concept of situational awareness, too. I&#39;ve seen them give the gasface to at least a dozen families/groups because, I imagine, they&#39;re &#34;not sitting down fast enoughjustsitdown,God!&#34;<br><br>If you work here a few times a week, and stand at a crappy little podium with a map of the joint, you&#39;ll likely be more comfy there. Customers, on the other hand, particularly ones that don&#39;t frequent the place, want to gauge the light, or whether or not they&#39;re sitting under the full blast AC, or are identifying exits, or who knows what but why is your sour little gas face in such a hurry to get back to the podium?  You ain&#39;t smilin&#39; or greetin&#39;.<br><br>You just gasfacin&#39;.<br><br>And you get paid by the hour, not by the guest (or gasface).<br><br>Look, the food&#39;s good, right?  But I can&#39;t imagine ever coming back to this atmosphere.<br><br>Above comments are completely exclusive of my server, Lauren, who was rad. Although she kept calling me &#39;sir&#39; when I&#39;m obviously not that kind of customer, made it known, and she must&#39;ve known anyhow because it was weird EVERY single time. I think this place breeds that sort of weirdness, though, and I encourage her to at the very least be aware it, best case scenario get outta there.

Never again. Wanted to give the Cheese Ckae factory another try after having had an illegal charge at the restaurant in Pittsburgh which we had to contest through our bank and fortunately had overturned. Came in for brunch and was told they were not serving it after waiting 15 minutes for someone to show up . Two couples came and went after we eat and we did not get out food.  Spoke to manager and asked to wait longer. Decided to leave and as I said, never again.
Located in Mag Mile right beside Hancock Center.<br>Good environment, delicious food and friendly stuff.<br>Nice experience with friends!

Don&#39;t come here when it&#39;s busy, you&#39;ll wait and keep waiting for your food. We were there a few weeks ago with 9 people. Food took forever to bring. Worst of all, everybody finally got their food except my 8 year old&#39;s grilled cheese sandwich. It came as were getting ready to leave. Pathetic! Please do something
The food is good, okay great! . Only reason for the 3 stars is the service sucks. Slow, and not attentive in the least bit.  We only saw the server to order.
DO NOT ORDER TO GO, waited an entire hour for my food after calling in ahead of time.

Traveling thru again and had to try this place....sad. Usually CCF is pretty good in San Diego, but this place...nope. Food is just not up to par and service was pretty damn slow. Never coming here again as I regularly visit Chicago. Well now I know!

My 12 year old daughter and I came here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. It was busy because the Lighting Tree and parade was going on but worth the wait. Very good food and great staff. Will come again.
They have my favorite the chicken Bellagio or the chicken Madeira are good I love the mashed potatoes I hate not having room for dessert but i will share a strawberry shortcake

Bad service day. Food was delicious but server wasn&#39;t available when i needed her. Still waiting for my reorder... been here nearly an hour and just got my food. Unhappy since I made a special trip here for the pancakes. BTW, they are the lighrest, fluffiest most delicious pancakes I&#39;ve ever had. Wish the were available other than ust on Sundays.

Love the cheesecake factory but was terribly disappointed with this one. Stopped in for lunch. Wasn&#39;t busy when we arrived. Our server, Alberto, had the energy of a small gerbil but I quickly realized that,  because we were not in business suits,  nor were we a couple of skinny blonde coeds, he wouldn&#39;t pay much attention to us. Getting his attention was akin to pulling teeth. Orders received were wrong and it took 45 min to get food. Manager attempted to placate us with a free slice of cheesecake and a less than heartfelt apology from, Alberto. We balked at that, paid our bill and walked out. <br><br>Not coming back to this location.

After visiting this location a few times I finally picked my birthday to express my sheer disappointment with this location. <br><br>In short, a friend and I just wanted cheesecake. We specified this to the host and she gave us a pager w/ my name and told us it would be 20 minutes. <br><br>30 minutes go by, and after lingering around the bar and stepping outside for a cigarette I decided to go check on the time at the host stand. Apparently my name and pager wasn&#39;t on the list. They had done a shift change so the hostess was not the one I was dealing with before. She explained to me that our name wasn&#39;t on the list anymore. I requested a manager. I knew it wasn&#39;t her fault. <br><br>So Julie, the manager, comes and speaks with me and I explain the situation. She checks the host stand with the hostess and the previous hostess had noted that &#34;we walked away&#34;. What? Like, you think I want to take this pager to-go with me? No, I was walking around the bar and hanging by the front of the restaurant. I am aware and I made it clear that I knew it wasn&#39;t the current hostess&#39;s fault. I work in the industry so these things happen and it just sucks. Fortunately Julie was able to seat us immediately. <br><br>Unfortunately, the waitress we had must have caught wind of the situation and wasn&#39;t very pleasant. We were very nice to her so it was a shame she didn&#39;t greet us and introduce herself like she did to the other tables around us. My friend even told the hostess and manager that it was my birthday, but I didn&#39;t get a candle or any kind of &#34;happy birthday&#34; from anyone. <br><br>I&#39;ve had issues with this place before in getting seated and not stellar service. But I guess that&#39;s what you get with corporate chain restaurants. I&#39;m finally closing my chapter with the cheesecake factory. The two stars I&#39;m leaving is for Julie and the newest hostess because they were the only help to this situation.

I have NEVER written to a restaurant before, but if I was management I would want to know.<br>We dined at Chicago downtown last night. Normal wait of 1 hr for a table was expected. However once seated we waited over 30 minutes for water and another few for bread after a reminder to our waitress. I asked for hot tea and got the hot water but had to ask 2 more times for the tea and when it came another 30+ minutes later the water was barely warm. Our appetizer came out before i eleven had my water or tea. We waited 70 min for our meal after ordering! Seriously??? She didn&#39;t admit she forgot to place the order or anything. My daughters pasta had a film on top from being under the warmer. My fish tacos were so cold I sent them back, she blamed the kitchen staff....<br>We ordered cheesecake to go and she immediately brought the bill before we even had boxes for our food or the cheesecake. That was the only prompt  service. Well, except the staff clearing out table as we got up to put our coats on. <br>She was a very nice young lady which makes me feel pity posting this however.....<br>I am so upset by the lack of responsibility your staff showed. We had two families come AND go right next to us during our seat time.<br>How could so many mistakes be made with ONE table..... I have a feeling this happens more than it should.

I understand that the cheesecake is great, but we didn&#39;t have any. The service was painfully slow, I had an omelet, that was quite mediocre. I asked to have salmon mixed with the omelet. It came on the side. Took forever to get the food and the check. Not a good experience. May just have been our waiter who was inexperienced or mediocre or just didn&#39;t give a s#€!. Other guests with a different waiter seems to have better service and experience. <br><br>Have been here once before for my son&#39;s birthday after a ball game, 3 years ago. Packed, loud, but the good and service were great.
I found a black hair in my salad! It was disgusting! When I told the clerk she just apologized! and I could no longer continue to eat after seeing that hair in my food! disappointed!

Had one of the worst service ever at this location . We live in neighborhood and this is the 2nd time we have had terrible service in the bar area . Our waiter was absolutely horrible. It wasn&#39;t even packed in the bar area and he didnt come by to check in us once then all of a sudden went in break . Didn&#39;t ask us if we wanted dessert or anything else. Absolutely awful!!!!!

I really do hate writing bad reviews, but this experience irritated me. <br>My family and I are on vacation and this is our first time in Chicago. <br><br>When we arrived our waiter did get our drinks rapidly, after that it was horrible service. It took about 15-20 minutes to get our order, he brought to the table 8 pieces of bread to a table of 6 people, and our order took more than half an hour. May I add we never received one refill throughout our whole dining experience and this was a early lunch on a Thursday, it was hardly busy. <br>I am a foodie and the food was wonderful, but as far as the service I would be very skeptical to come back.

This is my first time in the Cheesecake Factory and to be more honest the half of the experience there was awful. We&#39;ve been there on Saturday and we have to wait no so much for available table and where sit but we have to wait like more 20-40 min for waiter and then when we ordered (order only cheesecake not a food to prepared) wait like almost a hour to get this cheesecake. When we got a cheesecake they are amazing and very tasty . But only to wait are hour just for cheesecake which have to nicely cut with a knife I think it&#39;s to much .

Host was really nice. Got sat within 5 minutes on a Wednesday evening. Started going downhill after we got sat and were sitting for 20 minutes without a greet or update on what the hold up was. Finally waitress came by took our drink orders and that was another 20 minutes to bring out a few waters and a bottle of wine. Order entrees and I kid you not, we were sitting there for a good hour before our food finally arrived. Friend ordered undercooked pasta and told the waitress, no apologies given. She even said it wouldn&#39;t be the &#34;best option to reorder a new one because it would take long&#34;... okay? Will not be returning and neither will my friends
Every time I&#39;ve come here and every friend I&#39;ve got with me has fallen in love with this place. Impeccable food and service.

I am so sad that I am JUST now getting around to reviewing this location.  I would not A) typically review a Cheesecake Factory, or B) rate one 5 stars!  However, this location definitely deserves it!  I had an OUTSTANDING experience here in July 2012!<br><br>The wait was estimated over an hour, but they said if we could find a spot at the bar, we could seat immediately.  Instead we found two seats at the Barista instead.  The server was the cutest, most honest, and just awesome server ever!  I really wish I could remember her name (although its been three months short of a year!) <br><br>She was so attentive and just overall friendly.  She was patient and used tact when customers would come up and complain about the wait (as if it was her fault the restaurant was slow.... she works the coffee!)  She kept my water full too!<br><br>Expect a long wait, OR sneak into the Barista&#39;s bar!

I usually like coming to this place. But it&#39;s 9 o&#39;clock at night and I have been sitting here for a literally 30 minutes waiting for a sandwich and a salad.. it is a little busy but not enough to make it a 30 minute wait. I do hope my Chicken salad sandwich comes out fresh because they just killed the chicken, and that is what took so long.. Ugh Stick to Cheese cake, at least that looks ready to go..

Very Iconic in the city of Chicago, This particular location that is (located in the Hancock Building) Has a very cool atmosphere and a full bar and also a huge display of, you guessed it, CHEESECAKE! The food and service are both also very good. They offer a huge array of dishes varying in cuisine from Asian to Italian to Classic American they have a good variety of food, if anything i would suggest shortening their menu, it&#39;s a good read.. :-) <br>Overall Very good 4 Star!

Great place for kids and adults as well! The salads are to die for AND the dessert! Our waiter, Chris, is the most patient dealing our table of Girl Scouts! And it&#39;s convenient...right in the Hancock!!<br>Go there!0

Holy sh*t, the hostess working last night had the WORST attitude that I have ever come across in my life. Just a suggestion to her, if you hate your job that much...then quit! So rude, not helpful, and rolled her eyes several times when customers were putting in reservations. <br><br>On the plus side, our waitress was amazing. She really made up for the witch working at the hostess stand.

Very good I have been here many times and all were good. It&#39;s very fancy and there chess cake is amazing! They get people in and out in a timely manner. I would suggest going here if you want something delicious!!

Living nearby we have gone to this location often and recently we have increasingly been displeased. Last night 6/28 we came in and were sat right away. We watched as a blonde female server walked past our table at least 8 times serving the tables next us and never acknowledging us. We were sat at table 70 something.  Then we watched as two other tables were sat nearby and greeted quickly. We came hungry and left hungry and without service 15 min later.  We let the hostess know and all she had to say was &#34;That&#39;s weird.&#34; Very disappointed. <br><br>I understand mistakes happen but each of the past few time we&#39;ve been there we have seen fellow diners walk out without service. <br><br>We come for the food but we won&#39;t be back because the service is subpar. <br><br>Also they should invest in a person to polish the  silverware. This time I actually had chunks of food stuck to my cutlery. If someone would have come by our table I would have asked for a replacement.

This place gets slammed by tourists, but is huge so the wait isn&#39;t long for a table. That said, service is awful and the place is not clean. Waited for 15 minutes before being acknowledged by a server and had long lag times waiting for drinks and food. When my crusted chicken romano came out, part of the crust on the chicken was missing, which made it look like someone had eaten part of my food. I also found one of my forks was filthy on the back of the handle - had a bunch of food residue stuck to it. Super gross. Bathrooms also need to be cleaned more. Maybe it&#39;s better when it&#39;s not a busy time, but this was pretty bad and I won&#39;t try to find out.

We have been waiting over an hour for our (1) burger. The waiter was so confused, had to ask him to take our menus and clear the bread. We are wondering if he ever put our order in. People around us have big meals, drinks and all have been served. We talked with Manager and he said he would check on order. I asked Manager to bring it in a to go box. The Manager came out with the burger on the plate without the fries we ordered. We left the establishment.

It was ok, but I don&#39;t think the cheesecake was worth $8. I&#39;ve had better for less.   The service was very slow (take out slices of cheesecake shouldn&#39;t take that long!) and the staff was borderline rude and definitely unprofessional - the one taking our order was talking about beating someone&#39;s a$$.  There are better places to go in the city.

Amazing place. Nice place to come for lunch or dinner. They have an extensive menu so there&#39;s something for everyone. Great food and drink specials with exceptional service every time. Great place to bring the family as well. Besides being delicious the portions are large so make sure you save room for their award winning cheesecake!
Excellent juicy ribeye nice portions plenty of deserte options good bang for your buck. Our waiter wasn&#39;t the friendliest but the environment was clean and pleasant.

The meatball spaghetti was soggy and we have waited 20 minutes longer because the woman on counter took someone else instead lol She never apologized and five teams who came later than us went ahead. Also, the carbonara was served in dirty dish, the sauce was spilled all over the plate. They didn&#39;t attempt to wipe it before it&#39;s served.

Love the food here, and the cheesecake. I&#39;ve never had anything I don&#39;t like. The strawberry lemonade is great as are the fried macaroni and cheese balls. The wait can be very long, and it&#39;s very noisy in there. It&#39;s also pretty pricey, they could lower some prices on certain items.

Location: Great<br>Atmosphere: Good<br>Food: Decent<br>Service: Poor<br><br>Went on a busy memorial day (evening), yesterday, and was met with slow service, food items that they ran out of, and a waiter that kept telling his customers that they were very busy every time he made an error or had a problem with service/food, etc.  I noticed other customers were getting the same type of poor service as me.  To end the evening on a better note we decided to pay our check and grab a cheesecake on the way out.  We paid our bill and went up to the counter to order cheesecake but were rejected by the staff saying we had to order through our server.  Our server was barely serving us while we were seated, and I was not about to go find him to help me order cheesecake now.  They lost my cheesecake business that night, and all future business at this restaurant chain.<br><br>Goodbye and good luck Cheesecake Factory!

Great place! I live in Colorado but I&#39;ll deffinetly be back here again! The cook eddy you could tell was very hard working and very dedicated! One of the best cheesecake factory&#39;s I&#39;ve ever been to! Definitely better than colorados!

The place was full of energy and decorated in fun decor. Unfortunately my meal turned out to be a big disappointment. I ordered the Black bean burger which had absolutely no flavor - worst I have ever had. The side salad was ok but nothing to write home about. My friend enjoyed her salmon. I might go again to try something different.

Everything was tasty here and the service was great. I had the fish tacos with the fish deep fried along with beans and rice. Everything tasted great, I really liked it. The cheesecake was AMAZING! I had the tuxedo cheesecake it was a definite winner for me. I want to go back and try more. Please open a cheesecake factory in Vancouver B.C Canada please! lol

The place is huge. Food is good, portions are huge. Avoid ordering too many dishes at once. Service is good and quick too. Pricing is also reasonable.<br><br>Rating out of 5:<br>Food - 4<br>Service -4.0 (self-service)<br>Ambiance - 3.5<br>Pricing - 4<br><br>Would I visit again?<br>Definitely!

As a teen, you go to your local Barnes and Noble to enjoy your slice of Cheesecake from The Cheesecake Factory, it wasn&#39;t until I moved to Chicago that I decided to come here with a couple of my friends for a couple of cocktails! Besides their many varieties of Cheesecake you will find a vast amount of fantastic things to eat! My friends and I had a cheese flatbread that was like a grilled cheese sandwich that came with a sweet marinara! It was phenomenal, and midway through-- my friend suggested another sauce that she had tried last time! They were both fantastic, our lovely handsome British bartender who assisted us until close last night was  attentive and too kind! Thank you for help making our night!

This was the WORST dining experience I&#39;ve ever had!!! We waited 30min to be seated which was not a problem at all. It took them another 30min for a server to come by after we were seated! The server then proceeded to ask us what we are drinking and offered no apology for the wait! He brings us our drinks and no bread! Meanwhile we watched everyone around us who sat down after us get their drinks and bread. Finally he brings the bread. We finally got our food 40 min later!!! So we waited an hour and ten min before we saw our food!!!The food was good but I was too mad to eat much. The server came back to check on us once for drinks! Next time we see him he takes my wife and sons plate. The messed up thing is my son was not done eating!!! This was the worst hour and 45min of my life!!! We will definitely never go back!!!

I have heard of this restaurant and never been before tonight, I was very impressed with the quality of the food and drinks. First we ordered tuna tartare which one had before at two other restaurants and have to say cheesecake factory&#39;s blew them out of the water!! My lemon drop martini was exceptional and while my filet mignon did come out overcooked, they compensated with a brand new steak and a slice of cheese cake for free :)

2 stars only because Cheesecake Factory food and the drinks are always good - I got the Louisiana Chicken Pasta and a Strawberry Martini. I&#39;d recommend you visit one of their locations that isn&#39;t a zoo. <br><br>The service at this place is atrocious. I&#39;ve been here three times (it&#39;s just such a convenient location!), and it&#39;s probably the most *consistently bad* service I&#39;ve seen at a place.<br><br>They cram too many people into the limited space. We had people within arm&#39;s reach on both sides, so that it felt like we were in an awkward triple-date with strangers. No dinner conversations here are private. <br><br>The waiter will visit your table a couple times an hour, when they get around to it. Our entrées this time took around 45 minutes. The manager came by but offered no explanation or recompense. <br><br>The cherry on top was when, on finally seeing our waiter again after dinner, we asked to see the dessert menu. He informed us that it was just too busy by the kitchen and it was hard for him to put in orders. Yup, that&#39;s right, we went to the Cheesecake Factory and were told by our waiter that it would be too burdensome if we were to actually order some cheesecake.

Loved the entire atmosphere and experience. Had to wait for 5-10 min. Was seated in a not-too-loud area, which we enjoyed. Very busy, but still got excellent attention from our waiter.<br>I ordered a burger first, but was told that they were out of that particular kind. Totally fine with me and got an excellent portion of orange chicken. I&#39;m intrigued to see what the big sized portion is since I ordered off the lunch menu. <br>Ordered cheesecake at the end and we got silverwear in the bag also, which was nice cause were staying in a hotel. <br>I&#39;d definitely return our next time in Chicago!

I&#39;ve been to this location in the past and have had better experiences. My boyfriend and I waited way too long for our food. Multiple tables that ordered after us got their food before we did. My boyfriend even had to put more money in the parking meter. Someone did come and apologize about the wait, but when our food arrived, the portion size was tiny, and the side of my plate was greasy. I finished the spaghetti that came with my shrimp scampi in 3 bites. The food presentation was also poor as well, kinda looked like it was being rushed out of the kitchen with no care. I&#39;m not sure if they were running out of food or just extremely busy, but that&#39;s still no excuse. I will definitely not be coming back here again. The one star is for the bartender, who was extremely nice and accommodating while we were waiting for our table.

I travel all over the country and I am always happy if there is a Cheesecake Factory nearby.  I am a Gumbo lover and theirs is always delicious...with the exception of the Chicago Cheesecake Factory.  It was the worst Gumbo I have experienced just about anywhere...  not to mention that I ordered takeout ahead of time and was told 20-25 minutes.  No problem...but when I got there, they could not find my order in the computer, then completely lied to my face and said they found it but they were running behind and it would take another 20-25 minutes.  My ordered showed up 3 minutes later.  TERRIBLE SERVICE...TERRIBLE FOOD!

It took over 40 minutes to get our food after ordering. Then the manager couldn&#39;t validate our parking so we were charged $35 to park. We tried three times to validate the ticket and we ended up at the parking garage office. Quite a disaster.
I came with my son here and had to wait for long hour... Then waitress bring me very dirty tea cup , I had to ask for new one . The food and quality is not bad ..
My favorite thing to order is the Grilled Chicken and Avocado Club.<br><br>My brother gets the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta and it&#39;s got a kick to it.<br><br>The tiramisu is very good!
Nice place. Bacon~bacon cheeseburger. I&#39;ve been there couple times with my girlfriend. It gives me surprise every time

Mmm cheesecake. You really can&#39;t go wrong with the cheesecakes here, they&#39;re pretty awesome. The White Chocolate Rasberry Truffle cheesecake, for example, is as good as it sounds! <br><br>The problem is when you venture for anything beyond cheesecake that you should prepare for disappointment. The food is average. I think any place with a gigantic menu will always end up being just ok - jack of all trades and master of none as they say. I do like the avocado eggrolls though.<br><br>Also this location is always super busy, it&#39;s tourist central, so be prepared to wait.

Incredible Cheesecake Factory. I really like the layout and design. They did a wonderful job with such a small and tight area. You do have to wait for a table on the weekend, but that&#39;s what happens when eating at the Cheesecake Factory.

This is my least favorite Cheesecake Factory location. I called in a pick up order and was told that my food would be ready in 20 minutes. I get to the restaurant about 25-30 minutes after I called just to have to wait ANOTHER 20+ minutes! I honestly think they forgot to put my order in. The cashier said something about needing a manager to put my order in so that&#39;s what gave it away that my order hadn&#39;t been put in. Usually when I order from other locations they have my order in the system and I can just pay when I arrive, get my food, and leave. If I ever order from this location again I&#39;ll definitely put my order in 45 minutes or more in advance smh. They could&#39;ve at least offered me water or something since I had to wait so long, but nope. Nothing. I get home to find my strips not cooked well done/crispy like I asked, they weren&#39;t coated fully in buffalo sauce and I hardly got any fries.

4 stars for the food. This place has tables in every corner crowding the place but can&#39;t complain cause the place is so crowded! Since we wer just a party of two we got a sorta shitty place. So life hack : go with at least 3 people. You&#39;re welcome!

Corporate event last night at this location. Always a tough task for staff to host a large group, but I&#39;m always left unimpressed with their efforts. I feel that they were understaffed and weren&#39;t able to compensate accordingly. Waiters took awhile to take our orders, and we waited over an hour to get our food. By then, my food was cold. Chill, Cheesecake... Chill.

Sadly, my unpleasant experience at The Cheesecake Factory was at their Orland Park location this past weekend (Sunday I believe).  Again - I ordered my favorite: the Herb Crusted Salmon.... After a substantial wait, the salmon was under cooked, the waitress immediately realized and took the plates away saying she would show it to the manager.  The manager made his way to our table, apologized and offered &#39;fresh&#39; entrees.  Again, the salmon was under cook (and the potatoes tasted as if they had just been reheated- not fresh).  Once again, the waitress took our plates away.  The manager approached our table once again and offered us our choice of meal and informed us our entrees were &#39;on the house&#39;.  I told him I specifically come for the salmon and would love to enjoy it so we tried again.  Strike 3..... Salmon was cooked but mine had bones in it!!!!  Same problem I had at the Michigan Ave. location.  And my potatoes had large dark chunks of what I would imagine are those &#39;eyes&#39; or &#39;knots&#39; in potatoes.  I had finished more than 1/2 of it and told the manager I just wanted the bill and to leave.  While I appreciate the effort to make amends (we were not charged for out (Lunch portion) entrees or our to go cheesecake, we did however pay for our calamari appetizer), it pains me to see how the quality of The Cheesecake Factory become what it has.  I will definitely think twice before recommending it to anyone in the future.

Aweful! First time experience with The Cheesecake Factory. Last time. If the poor service and over priced, over salted cheaply made food is the general quality for this chain, well, no thank you. All of the effort put into designing this location goes to the dogs because the food is just not good enough for what they charge. Recommended by a friend. Will have to have a talk with him. Yuck!!!

Only bc I can not give a zero!!! I have been to many Cheesecake Factories around the United States and they&#39;re always very busy. This one on a Saturday morning around quarter to 11 was not.  We just wanted 2 pieces of cheesecake and were able to order right away.  The girl was very pleasant so I tipped her.  Well she said thank you and I&#39;ll get that right out.  15 minutes later after watching her do everything BESIDES get our cheesecake, I finally started asking questions.  The 2 guys standing and waiting b4 us had been there for 40/30 minutes each.  So I went up to her as she was eating some thing and NOT GETTING OUR cheesecake and said &#34;is our cheesecake going to be ready soon?&#34;. She said Oh Yea, I can get that right now.  In the meantime the guy who has been waiting for 40 minutes is talking to the manager in the background.  We get our cheesecake and leave, opening the bag later to find the wrong cheesecakes in there.  She was doing nothing and still got it wrong.  So I called and asked to speak to the manager and was put o. Hold for 18 minutes.  I finally hung up and called back.  In all the years we&#39;ve gone there before never had this happen and it&#39;s always busy they do a great job but this place sucked!!!

Disappointed. I use to love this place but it&#39;s changed. We&#39;ve been coming here once a year for years and last few years it&#39;s gotten worse. We get the same each time and the recipes have changed. Even the White Chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake isn&#39;t as good as it use to be!

Came here with a group of co-workers on Saturday night. My first ever Cheesecake Factory Experience, and only because someone else picked it. Honestly, after reading the &#34;Eat This Not Thant&#34; horror stories, I wanted to run screaming from this place. They have arguably the &#34;Worst Dish In America&#34; with their Bistro Shrimp pasta, clocking in at over 2200 calories per serving. That&#39;s more than a days worth of calories in one gloppy plate of pasta! Que horreur! But, it was either beg off dinner or join the group. So I joined the group.<br><br>Kudo&#39;s on the Skinnylicious Menu. They have a number of selections advertised as less than 590 calories, so I guess that is acceptable. Mostly these selections are salads or fish (or a combination of both). <br><br>I had the chopped salad, which contained chicken, apple, corn and avocado and it was pretty good. I didn&#39;t trust the calorie count so I didn&#39;t finish it.<br><br>My seatmate to the right had the grilled ahi tuna salad, which he was very pleased with. He literally ate every last morsel of salad on the plate. I personally don&#39;t like raw tuna, but he really found the meal excellent. His wife ordered the spaghetti and meatballs, and again, she said she really enjoyed it. I was told that she never likes anything she gets at a restaurant, so this was really a victory for The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>One of my table mates had the appetizer chicken Caesar salad, and it was enormous. We all said, &#34;This is the appetizer size???&#34; Honestly, it was entree sized. But good, reportedly. <br><br>There were other, acceptable dishes on the table, none so good that they warrant inclusion in this review. The only other thing to note was the size of the desserts. Again, one slice of cheesecake was as big as the entree. Ginormous. And the very slender woman who ordered it dispatched it down her alimentary canal with alacrity. I don&#39;t know how a very slender woman can eat 3000 calories worth of food and stay slender.<br><br>So all in all, I would have to say that the Cheesecake Factory wasn&#39;t bad. Service was decent. I don&#39;;t think I would drive downtown for a chain restaurant, but if in a similar situation, I would have a lot less trepidation about the menu.

Really disappointed with my experience today (2/25) at the Cheesecake Factory in the Hancock building. I&#39;m a big fan of the Cheesecake Factory in general, but ther service I received today with my boyfriend was well under par. <br>We came in around 12:30 and were seated within five minutes of arriving. When we sat it was clear we walked into an unfortunate situation. The people around us seemed quite upset and anxious, like they had been waiting for a while. We came to find out that this feeling of waiting was very true. From when we sat at 12:30 we did not see a waiter or get water for nearly 20 minutes with the server from that section taking care of the angry tables around us with no acknowledgement to us. It took the tables around us an obscenely long time to receive their check, from what I could hear around me, and they were equally disappointed in the service they received. I work in the service industry so I understand that these things happen but this was ridiculous, I have never seen this type of service at my restaurant or anywhere else for that matter. <br>When he finally came over we put in our whole order so that we wouldn&#39;t need to flag him down again at any other point during our visit. I ordered the Fettucine Alfredo with Chicken while my boyfriend got the Fried Chicken and Waffles Benedict from their brunch menu. It took us another 10 minutes to receive our drinks and complimentary basket of bread.<br>Our food arrived and we continued to be disappointed. My boyfriend&#39;s poached eggs, which are mean to be runny, were completely solid as if they had been hard-boiled. The chicken in my pasta was a little dry but overall I enjoyed my meal. My boyfriend brought up the egg issue to the server and they were gracious enough to take the meal off of the bill. We definitely appreciated that.<br>Overall, I enjoy Cheesecake Factory and am usually never disappointed when I go to any location but today was a bad luck of the draw. Will continue to go but may just avoid this location for habitual dining.

It may be touristy, and yes, the last time I was here was about 3 years ago, but it&#39;s still Cheesecake Factory and thus DELISH!! I always get the Pasta da Vinci and then choose a cheesecake slice from their ginormous cheesecake menu. <br><br>Last time I was here we only had a short wait, I believe, and we had a big party, about 6-8 people. We were in Chicago for a few days for fun (I live in the Detroit area) after graduating college. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory has a HUGE menu and they have something for everyone, I&#39;m sure! My favorite is that pasta dish but they have interesting appetizers too - I&#39;ve had their SW egg rolls before as well as their samosas, at a different CF location.

We love Cheesecake factory.  We when we eat there its always good.  But I do not recommend ordering from Grub Hub or Door Dash etc.  The food is always cold, they don&#39;t pack the food very well and really should not being doing food orders unless it is cheesecake.  We order from Cheesecake on Door Dash and it took forever probably because of the location.  We called and a manager could not get to the phone?!  So we had to reheat all our food because it was ice cold.   I would venture to say because there is no place for Grubhub or Doordash to park so no one wants to go down there to pick up food which I can understand but we had over $100++ in food got no credit or anything so we will never do this again!

I don&#39;t think I have ever given a 1 Star before! There is not enough room on this post to write the terrible experience we had here. We had 11 girls in Chicago for a Bach party. Came here and was told 45min wait* we expected a long wait at 5:45pm for 11 people. However we did not get a seat for 1.5hours! They then put 3 servers on our table. *nice guys but they had no idea what they were doing. After getting our apps before we even got our drinks, we ordered main meals to. Everyone&#39;s came out scattered and mine NEVER showed. Manager came out and said it&#39;s on &#34;the fly&#34; 40 more min later no food.. I ended up eating scraps of everyone else&#39;s at this point and told them to cancel mine. They then offered cheese cake. Myself and a few others decided to try it and we ordered 4. 30more min later they bring 3/4!! 30min prior to this we also asked for our tabs! I asked for the manager again and a new manager came over and said the other went home.... shocker.. he apologized and I said at this point we just want our tabs and to go. He handed them to me and said &#34;make sure these are correct&#34; NOT ONE was correct! There was things on the tabs we didn&#39;t even order.. like seriously there were 3 servers! He asked me to come to the computer with him. I previously worked as a server for 8 years and knew the system they were using. I manually put everyone&#39;s food together myself! Like seriously!?? I shoulda got paid to do that. He ended up comping about $100 worth. After 3.5hrs there the whole thing should have been taken care of in my opinion. But o well. I&#39;ve seriously never have had such a bad experience In my life! I basically cashed our whole group out myself and we FINALLY left! Please do not go here if you have a party over 2 people you will be dissatisfied! I/we will not be back. So poorly handled.

Seems like the quality has gone downhill in recent years with service and food quality. That&#39;s not saying the food is bad but I remember it being better. Chaotic and all over the place is how I would describe my recent  visit. Server seem confused and kitchen was backed up.  If I had to choose over, definitely would have gone someplace different.

Stopped by here for a quick lunch with a friend today. Atmosphere is very inviting, cosy with dim lights. We walked ourselves to the bar area, where we quickly was greeted by Gerard. Our server. He was very friendly, attentive, without being overbearing. Got a couple of apps and a sandwich. Food was delicious and portions were big. Big enough to share. Loved our drinks, which happened to be on happy hour. Had a margarita and my friend got a mojito. We will definitely be coming back.
If the Cheesecake Factory menu is rly so freakin big then how come I can&#39;t suck my servers toes?

Well, it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory. If you were looking for a very unique dining experience, this isn&#39;t it (although I&#39;ve yet to receive a definitive answer on the vaguely anthropomorphic decor. Is it mushroom-inspired? Turkish? Honestly so many of the big wall coverings look like giant tongues and elbows and whatnot). The steak is always good. The cheesecake, without debate, is excellent too. This place tends to be super crowded, though, so be ready to wait at the nearby mall.

I love Cheesecake Factory, not necessarily for their food though. Don&#39;t get me wrong, the food is acceptably good but often lacks flavor in my opinion and honestly tastes a little too greasy at times. On the other hand, the drinks at this location(white sangria) was awesome! The service was ok, the waitress seemed a little spaced out, the host who sat is grumbled a few words and the time to get our food was a little long. Overall, it was a decent happy hour experience that I would do again.

Fun date place with literally every kind of food option possible from burritos to burgers to pasta to steak, so it&#39;s great for when everyone is craving something different and neither of you want to compromise. <br><br>The service is ok but nothing special, I usually find that the waiters are doing a lot more running around than actually waiting on people and tend to slack on the extra stuff you might request, like more water, extra dressing or more bread. I&#39;ve also found that if you&#39;re having a more &#34;basic&#34; dinner (meaning no appetizers or fancy drinks) that they tend to really leave you alone and often leave you with empty water glasses. On the flip side, if you both order a drink when you first meet the waiter, they&#39;re never going to stop hounding you. <br><br>I do think the food is pretty good and overall love going, just would like to see the service stepped up a little bit. Big tourist place it seems so expect lots of families with younger kids but overall a win.

We arrived at 10 asking to be seated for coffee and we were told it would be 25 minute wait. Host had said it would be quicker to wait in line for Togo to get coffee. Waited over 25 minutes for a rude guy to tell us &#34;it&#39;s going to be at least 10 minutes for coffee, there are other people in line ordering food that I need to take care of.&#34; I explained we had waited a long time in line and we are rightfully next, and he says &#34;ya okay boss&#34; .. obviously not going to risk spit in my coffee from a jerk so we left. Thanks for wasting about an hour of my night cheesecake! Also, maybe try to hire some professional staff next time!
Yall celling look weird like fat thighs. And it so dim. I need to see what in eating. Also The bread is really hard. That can be a problem for people with denters. But the butter was good tho.

Meh. This makes me realize why I don&#39;t really like going to chain restaurants. I ordered the Bistro Shrimp Pasta. So I like the sauce but the shrimp tasted from a frozen bag and not fresh. I did not like how the shrimp is also small and to make it appear bigger they just coated it with batter. Service is fine. <br><br>The location of this place is great though in attracting customers.

I came in with my friend and only ordered drinks. My friend and I sat in the bar area at a booth. It was during that awkward transition between lunch and dinner, so they were slow. Our server&#39;s name was Ren, I believe. I only remember because he was really awesome! My friend and I are servers, so we tend to connect with servers. Ren was really cool and made our experience a great one!<br>We shared the Georgia Peach. That drink tasted like straight up sorbet. No hint of alcohol. Those drinks are DANGEROUS - in other words, you better order that next time!!! I also got a SkinnyLicious Long Island Iced Tea - it&#39;s SkinnyLicious because the splash is of coke zero instead of coke. Pretty straight forward. Tasted good. I would order both again. <br>My friend got the BBQ salad, which was HUGE, like all of the food portions at Cheesecake Factory. The chicken looked freshly grilled and vegetables looked fresh. I took a bite and would order it if I went again. We also shared a slice of cheesecake - Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple. Cheesecake with caramel, PB, butterfingers, Reese&#39;s, and an Oreo crust? Get. It. Actually, get everything that we got. <br>Did I forget to mention the bread that they bring out first? Cause, yeah. That&#39;s REALLY good, too. Sourdough and a slightly sweet honey oat wheat something bread. Always a great way to kick off the meal!

I ordered take out for lunch and was a bit disappointed. I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory&#39;s plenty of different times just different locations and never really had an issue. I ordered the lunch size mango chicken salad and to my surprise there was one small piece of chicken cut into four slices. The overall salad was a good size but it didn&#39;t feel like a chicken salad. The chicken was also very dry and overcooked. Not something I would expect for a $14 salad.

&#34;Atmosphere&#34; is different here than other Factory restaurants as the decor is like being inside a fluffy cheesecake!  Food is complimentary to the other restaurants though. It is always busy...we&#39;ve dined here quite a bit and never been quoted less than an hour wait time. Chicken and biscuits and original cheesecake with strawberries to finish is highly recommended!

The food is good, but I went there today and had bad service. It took 10 minutes for someone to bring water, and 15 for a server to come take a drink order. When we were paying it took 20 minutes for everyone to get all of their cards back. There was no explanation or apology offered so we&#39;re not sure what caused all the delays because it wasn&#39;t particularly busy. The food is good but not worth the long wait times/prices/poor service.

Wow, where to start. We waited an hour, granted it was a Saturday night, so I don&#39;t mind waiting, but we were put at a tiny table where I could easily have bumped elbows with the parties on either side. This should have been a red flag, but we were hungry so we gave it a shot.<br><br>We saw how busy it was so after waiting to be helped (for the first time) for another 10 minutes, we ordered our drinks, and an appetizer. Our waiter returned with our drinks 5 minutes later, but forgot to get my wife her water. I asked him kindly to bring the water as soon as he could, and we also ordered our food. The water never came, and neither did the appetizer, our food was out 20 minutes later. It was primarily cold. We left never having received the appetizer or water, but you better believe they left the appetizer on the bill. Don&#39;t worry, I had it removed before paying.<br><br>Maybe we had a bad experience because went at the wrong time, but there are too many good restaurants in Chicago to waste money and time at a place like this. Truly disappointing. Just go somewhere else.

Food was amazing and so was our waiter so I&#39;m going to give more than a single star. I&#39;ve never countered such a rude HOST! He seemed fine and dandy seating us but it wasn&#39;t until we realized he was bothered that we used a chair for our purses. We sat outside because it was finally beautiful out, we asked the person who was sitting alone if it was okay since there was no where to place it and we all know it&#39;s bad luck to place it on the floor PLUS my purse was way to expensive to have sitting on the ground. The gentleman was fine with it so we thought it was okay. Once the host sat a new person down at that table he felt the need to yell to us &#34;I could have needed that chair ladies!&#34; With this awful attitude. For a second we thought he was joking but I asked him if he needed it and he said back &#34;nope not anymore&#34; and rolled his eyes. I don&#39;t understand why someone would feel the need to get our attention to yell to us that he might have needed something he didn&#39;t actually need. I&#39;m going to assume his boyfriend dumped him in the timeframe from sitting us down to ordering our food because his Maria Carey persona came out of no where. He continued to stare at us and give dirty looks until we left. His face/personality put a bad taste in our mouth.

Love their outdoor seating option.  Their menu is extensive as a small book so finding something for everyone shouldn&#39;t be a problem. <br><br>Definitely call ahead add the wait can be up to 1 hour.
The cheesecake, like always, was to die for and our waitress was the sweetest! Always a good time at this Cheesecake Factory

I have always enjoyed the food at the Cheesecake Factory - most recently the Greek salad has become a favorite with the Teriyaki Chicken and the Pepperoni Pizza. Of course I love the desserts! <br><br>This Cheesecake is fun to eat at because it is located below street level in the Hancock building. It can be very crowded and is a smaller location. Unfortunately, one of their wait staff spilled food all over by suit and shoes when I was there on business and when I attempted to send the manager the cleaning bill, they never responded. <br><br>Besides this, the reason this establishment gets 1 star is the absurd corporate policy of sending out kids menu food on plates to hot to the touch. Why they cannot simply plate on regular plates is beyond me. Every time we are there with our kids, we have to send their orders back to be re-plated. As long as this continues to be corporate policy at the Cheesecake Factory, I will give everyone I eat at 1 star reviews despite the level of the service.

My first time at any cheesecake factory restaurant. The restaurant is lavishly decorated. Very busy, you might need reservations. My chicken teryaki was fantastic.
