The portions were very large.My husband and son were very happy with their dinners as well. And of course the cheesecake was to die for. The 3 of us shared red velvet cheese cake. Delicious. There is a cheesecake factory in Buffalo, n.y. i will have to try that restaurant out myself to see if it is as good as the Chicago one?

Not the very best food I&#39;ve eaten but,  was the closest thing to our hotel as we were booked at the Westin. Went for NYE and ordered the parmesan crusted chicken with mashed potatoes and green beans. The 12 green beans they gave me were good, had a splash of lemon. However, the chicken tasted like a very basic home economics class recipe from a beginner. The mashed potatoes were very chunky and not creamy at all and a little salty. I also ordered chicken nachos that my bf liked but, I wasn&#39;t overly impressed with those either. The guacamole was bland, just tasted like mashed avocados. My bf ordered the fish and chips but, didn&#39;t like it because the batter was too airy and the fish was extremely soft and had no texture. For dessert he ordered the caramel cheesecake to go. He said it was ok, just a tad too sweet. Sadly, we won&#39;t be returning due to bad service and lousy food.

Review by Becky:<br><br>Decided to try the Cheesecake Factory out with my boyfriend because I had a $25 gift card. This is not a place we would usually get lunch or dinner at.<br><br>What a horrible mistake! The worst burger experience of my life. Also the decor is hideous! <br><br>We came in around 1:45pm and had to wait almost 45 minutes to be seated.  After being seated we placed our order.  We had a lot of time to look over the menu when we were waiting 10 years for a table.<br><br>We both ordered the Factory burger - I requested my burger well done with double tomato and no onions.  My boyfriend requested his burger medium rare and with only cheese.<br><br>About 30 minutes later our server comes back with our food and plops it down and runs off.  <br><br>Just by looking at my burger I could tell it was the wrong order.  Instead of the Factory burger I received the Smokehouse BBQ Burger (WTF I HATE BBQ SAUCE! HATE IT! The smell makes me sick)  My boyfriend&#39;s burger was fine and started to eat.  <br><br>I tried to flag down a waiter or a staff member and there were none to be seen.  Finally 15 minutes later I was able to grab a bus boy and get him to grab our server.  After waiting another 10 minutes our server finally shows back up and I explain to him that I have the wrong burger and he admits he wrote the wrong thing down on our ticket. Wtf?  How do you mix up a factory burger and a BBQ burger?  He offered to bring me another burger and I refused because I wasn&#39;t going to wait another 30 minutes to get a burger when my boyfriend had been done eating for 20 minutes!  <br><br>The server barely apologized.  I asked for the burger to be taken off our bill as I couldn&#39;t eat it.  He said he couldn&#39;t do that but could give me a piece of cheesecake for free.  Ummm wtf?  Are you serious?  You messed up my order, delivered a burger I couldn&#39;t eat but you are still going to charge me full price for it?  Hello! I&#39;m starving!!!!!!!! The server brought us a tiny piece of cheesecake after we paid.  <br><br>Thank god we didn&#39;t have to pay anything out of pocket for the crap the Cheesecake Factory serves.<br><br>Service was horrible and non existent.  I didn&#39;t get to eat anything for lunch. <br><br>Also I tried the cheesecake when we got home and spit it right out.  It was the most disgusting cheesecake I have ever had in my entire life.

I&#39;m going to keep this review short as most people have visited cheesecake factory before. I usually do not have complaints with the cheesecake factory but this occasion was the exception. We ordered to corn tamales as usually because they are so good it has to be a sin. I regret not ordering the red velvet cheesecake because I I did nto like my past at all. The sauce was water and thin and did not coat the past so I felt like I was eating dry season pasta. I would never order that meal again. We asked for extra sauce but that dish is just not a winner. We sat in these booths in the back and my friends seat was wobbly if that makes any sense. So anytime the person in the booth behind her would move or get up she would feel it. Our waiter was ridiculously slow and we had to remind him about everything (even utensils). All I can say is the corn tamales never disappoint.

I love the Thai chicken lettuce meal . ! but I don&#39;t really like coming here because the food (pasta) makes me feel terrible after... Like I need a nap right away! And because the food is so heavy I don&#39;t ever get any cheese cake

Chicken piccata barely edible.  Pasta very salty, didn&#39;t like the sauce.  Meatloaf was dry.  Was seated at a table about a foot from a servers&#39; work area even though there were plenty of empty tables in the restaurant in more pleasant and relaxing areas.  Felt like we were a party of 3 instead of 2 as servers came to the computer to enter orders, etc. while we were waiting for/eating our meal.  Sat down only to find a dirty salad plate.  Had to ask for bread and butter.  Even the lemonade was bad -- way too tart.  Eventually moved to a different table but it was too late at that point to enjoy our afternoon lunch.  Will absolutely not return.
Best place for dinner/lunch! Skinnylicious menu is very helpful for people who don&#39;t want to consume the meals with huge amounts of calories! Lemon shrimp garlic pasta is

If you have an hour to wait for your food this is the place.  No real excuse as to why it was taking so long.  The server asked for the manager to stop by our table.  She apologized, but did not offer to make it right.  I had to ask!  Really?  At first she offered to provide us more bread and butter!  (I think she thought she was being funny.)  She offered to compensate us for dessert.  But, when the bill came, first it was the wrong bill, but when the bill finally came, the dessert was included.  When I mentioned it to the server, she said, Oh, is that what the manager offered?  Very Poor

Have you ever gone into &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34; and ordered a small plate just to make sure you have room for cheesecake at the end? I had PRETZEL-COVERED CHICKEN STICKS (yay!) so I could save room for the CHRIS&#39; OUTRAGEOUS CHEESECAKE (it&#39;s the German Chocolate Cake of cheesecakes). If there&#39;s anything truly outrageous it&#39;s the super-large space and super-packed patronage, I don&#39;t know how the staff handles it. I was served the small plate before I got bread. The waiter came over and apologized. As I sat there past 2:30 on a leisure afternoon when I needed to kill time, the &#34;Factory&#34; died down with less and less customers. I talked to the waiter for like 8-minutes, gabbing on this and that. We traded dessert secrets. #goodtimes

The wait was about 40 minutes, which is fine I understand it was a busy night. But then the heat was blasting way too high and I was sweating in the restaurant. Also the waiter gave me the wrong dish, even though I pointed out the one I wanted on the menu to him which was disappointing. Also my key lime cheesecake was frozen when it got to my table as if they pulled it out of the back of the freezer :-( I came to the cheesecake factory for the cheesecake and it wasn&#39;t good at all. Not Okay.

My poor review is all based on the manager&#39;s ability to solve an issue it was today. Lack of respect completely for your customers. We were given a table for 4 people after waiting for a 5 people table for 45 minutes we were not rushing and waited patiently.At the moment we got our 5 plates plates couldn&#39;t even fit the table we removed our drinks to barely make it. one person sat in the aisle was asked to stand up and allow the dirty dishes cart to pass at least twice as well as a wheel chair.  He never came back we need it to go and find him to complain about his lack of attention. There were enough tables to move us to an appropriate table. He offered a desert which of course we were not even interested in getting. So sad because the food as always was really good.  By the way more than 3 tables were waiting for him to stop an fix something.

I am surprised to see that this place only has a 3-star ranking. I have been to the Cheesecake Factory a few times and was not once disappointed by either the food or the service. The restaurant has a huge menu - it literally covers everything from salad to pasta to taco. It also offers lunch specials that are smaller-sized. The taste is good, and sometimes surprising, but depending on what you order, some dishes can be bland. I would ask a server regarding those taste differences before placing an order.

This was a very unpleasant experience, not only was there trash on the floor, and my table was disgusting. But my meal was cold and I was unable to eat with my family because they screwed up my order. We had to constantly ask for refills.... It also seemed as though the quality has changed for the worst.
Dear Cheesecake Factory, your hostess needs some uppers tonight. Consistently decent products, customer service beyond my server was pathetic.
I love all cheesecake factory&#39;s but this location was FANTASTIC. In such a prime location, packed with people the service and food were perfect.

I ENJOYED my meal Southern Fried Catfish Meal... it was delicious! We walked in and got a table immediately (1pm on a Thursday) The catfish was meaty and very well compensated. The corn was sweet and buttery. The mashed potatoes chunky and moist. I enjoyed every bite. The margarita was weak but thats ok. Our server Dana was wonderful!! Request her... and shes cute!! Lol...
Cody the waiter is the man. He&#39;s a real server that&#39;s on point and detailed. Great comfort food.

This is a tasty restaurant.  I enjoy eating the chicken marsela with mushrooms and bow tie pasta. It is a very tasty dish seasoned in wine sauce. I also like the complimentary wheat bread they give you. It is very busy on the weekends. Worth the wait, but sometimes I go elsewhere
I went this place with my boy friend, and then I fall in love with him and the cake. <br><br>This was the first cheesecake factory i ever been in chicago. very good memory. and recommend.

The food is great but the service is horrible! I placed an order online for pickup. When I arrived, it took over 15 minutes just to get up to the counter to tell them I was picking up an order. The space was tight and beyond packed. Way too many people for the small space. Once I got to the counter, and told them I was picking up an order, they looked at me like they didn&#39;t know what I was talking about. It took them over 20 minutes just to find my take out order, and when I got it...my order was wrong! The girl at the counter quickly fixed the problem... which was nice... I just felt bad for her because all of the waiters and waitress was yelling at her because they needed stuff too and the were tired of waiting. Overall, I definitely will not be back to this location.

My daughter was in town a little bit ago and though she does stuff on a whim, I do not... But, I did, this time, because my littlest baby girl said, &#34;... come on mom let&#39;s go...&#34; <br><br>To the Cheesecake Factory &#34;downtown&#34;...A definite magical atmosphere, however, the service leaves me a little disappointed for the &#34;downtown&#34; location. They were busy, but the wait wasn&#39;t too long - about 20 minutes. Our table was so close to the other table, that when the other party exited they could sit and nearly did on our table. I guess it&#39;s all about packing them in like sardines. Truly, this detracts from the dining experience, (and it should be an experience when it&#39;s &#34;downtown&#34; - maybe I just don&#39;t get out much and this is how it is &#34;downtown&#34;), but it&#39;s so loud! There was all that dining space upstairs - empty...  Our waiter didn&#39;t pull the chair for me, which I thought was what was supposed to happen in an upscale &#34;downtown&#34; restaurant, especially, when the older person is closest to you. And speaking of age... although, not major, my daughter who does have a young face, wasn&#39;t carded! Her pride was offended - but not their fault - she&#39;s getting older and looks 21+. The silverware wasn&#39;t clean as was the menu. The food was their regular, (like the Oakbrook location) - so I&#39;m of the mind they can do this with their eyes closed. It was tasty, once home the avocado rolls didn&#39;t re-heat too well - again this is not their fault, however, since I had eaten lite I was looking forward to a dessert, so I was shocked when the waiter assumed we were not having a dessert and came with the check. No dessert menu. I didn&#39;t request the check. I got the feeling he thought it was time to turn the table over for his next tip - I don&#39;t know what he thought but I did want my dessert - really it&#39;s my main treat for going out - especially to the CHEESECAKE FACTORY! I asked for the dessert menu and ordered my dessert, paid, left a decent tip, even with poor service. The end.<br><br>I&#39;ll return to the Oakbrook location, even though it&#39;s a trek now that I&#39;m a Chicagoan again, but the service is better and that is huge on my list - next to quality.

This place is always packed and you need to wait in line . But it&#39;s worth it. My favorite dish there is 4 cheese pasta and for dessert are tiramisu and red velvet cheesecake and also they don&#39;t have a good signal there and no wifi so we all talk and enjoy it

I always enjoy the high quality foods of this friendly restaurant! The consumers are very kind and friendly. I love the warm and yummy breads of this restaurant especially the brawn ones! The burgers are delicious as well as the cheesecakes! Recommended!

Prior to going here I read yelp reviews &amp; thought decor was a weird thing to be mentioned but then I ate here &amp; see that yes, decor is odd. Especially the bathroom, not really sure what&#39;s going on there. <br><br>Anyway, it was busy when I arrived but I was able to sit in the bar &amp; service was on par with a popular, busy restaurant. I was actually impressed that my sever was able to juggle so much, I would have been a hot mess. The guacamole salad was delicious, and of course the cheesecake was great.
The Cajun chipotle chicken was delicious. The asparagus was so fresh! The lunch portion was huge and filling! #thanksCF

I&#39;ve been here maybe a dozen times now, and It&#39;s steadily become one of my favorite places to go for a casual lunch/dinner! :3<br><br>The first couple times were huge misses for me, the pastas have always been really under-cooked and I hate complaining about food to the waiter, but my noodles were so hard I couldn&#39;t swallow them! :( And a couple of their other dishes have been really disappointing to me<br><br>But I&#39;d still find myself going back, either because my friends wanted to go, or it was the closest restaurant nearby. And I feel like since i&#39;ve been giving it chances upon chances, and ordering different things every time, i&#39;ve finally found the dishes that I like! :D I highly recommend the Steak Diane, and the Chicken Madiera, they are really really tasty and delicious :3 <br><br>The smoothies are also to die for, and they are really cute with their tea and offer you many different choices! Although the strawberry shortcake is highly disappointing, the shortcake was really hard for some reason, but they do give you a very large portion! <br><br>Now that I&#39;ve found my go-to dishes, my new goal is to tackle the cheesecake list..hehe
Came in tonight and sat on the patio. Our server was good and so was the food. Overall 5 stars.

This was my go to place for Strawberry Cheesecake  every Saturday afternoon whenever I was in the downtown Chicago area. <br><br>I&#39;ve only dined here once with my parents one Saturday afternoon and we had a good experience. The only disappointment was they didn&#39;t have my mom&#39;s sugar free cheesecake! :(<br><br>I would definitely return the next time I&#39;m in the area.

I love Cheesecake Factory Restaurants and this location unique charm in downtown Chicago.  This is my second lunch (out of towner) at this location.  The host gave my requested seat with a view, and waitress was great.  How can you not love the HUGE menu at these places?!  Tex mex egg rolls, Cuban rolls, miso salmon, BBQ salad are all my favorites.
lol so many people waiting for seats. I just bought a cheesecake. Looks so good. And the service is fast. Dulce Caremel flavour.

The food was amazing! The thing is, I never actually got the food I ordered. Granted, I was in a group of 30 people. So I understand that things get mixed up. But I was told 3 separate times after everyone  else ate that my food was on it&#39;s way. They eventually brought up a food that wasn&#39;t meant to be made, so I ate it. What they brought me was incredible! I recommend this place, just didn&#39;t have the best personal experience.

Terrible service. Called in a vegan Cobb salad for pickup. Yada yada extra charge for more beets and garbanzo. $16. So I was quoted 20 min. I walk in 30 min later expecting the food to be ready. I pay and was told the food would be up shortly.  10 min later food is still not ready. So I ask someone what&#39;s up? And he tells me right after counting cash that he&#39;s putting the finishing touches on it. So now we&#39;re at 40 min after I first called. A couple min later they tell me I&#39;m gonna have to wait another 10 min for the bread I ordered. So I just ask for a refund at that point. It takes another 6-7 min for the manager to come and void the order. And at the end I don&#39;t even get a receipt for the void. So now I have to monitor the bank to make sure the money goes back on the card. What a nightmare experience. Will not be back.

Second time, after the SF location we were at CF. The place is huge and the menu is even bigger. We had an lunch meal which was really great portionwise nothing too much so we had room for an cheesecake. For me it was white chocolate raspberry truffle and although I only had a small meal it still was way too much. So great but so heavy.... It was Just delicious. We Will Be back here and then only the cheesecake. On the downside was the caramel machiatto, that was barely warm enough and I have had much better.

Incredibly disappointed. I was craving cheesecake so I decided to get delivery, I also got a milkshake and appetizer. The order was supposed to arrive in 30 min but ended up taking an hour. When the food showed up the appetizer was cold and the milkshake was melted, but the worst part is that the cheesecake, the whole reason I placed the order in the first place- was missing. So I spent $45 on a soupy milkshake and ice cold artichoke dip. Yay.
This is a terrible location. Slow moving, forget it if you want to order carry out. <br>Chili and steak medallions took over 50 minutes.<br>How do they sustain a business taking this long?

Our server, Bianca, was GREAT and the food was GREAT as well!!!<br>Thai Lettuce Wraps...ALWAYS excellent, even though chicken pieces were much smaller here than Skokie location.<br>Buffalo Blasts...better here than Skokie location.<br>Jamaican jerk chicken and shrimp with plantains, rice &amp; black beans was SCRUMPTIOUS even though it wasn&#39;t really hot.<br>Chile Relleno Cheeesburger with fries was outstanding!<br>After a few glasses of Prosecco...can you <br>say itis??!!!

Mom came to visited, with a limited diet, perfect go to place because good and a chain. Literally everytime I go there, I&#39;m immediately seated because I go straight to the large bar area. I&#39;ve never had bad service or food, and cheesecake is always like it&#39;s supposed to be... Not super expensive,  but definitely not cheap.  Still good and I usually have left overs. Glad I no longer working at Water Tower cause that cheesecake was way too accessible. LoL

With so many other choices to go to in this area, I do not understand why people decide to come here. There are Cheesecake Factories all over the country, and if you&#39;re going to be downtown Chicago, why not eat a  restaurant unique to the area? <br><br>The last time I went here was with some family from out of town, and they really wanted to eat here for some reason .... Anyways, went here around lunch time and the tables smelled really weird, the smell of old dishrag water. It was pretty gross. The prices of the food are pretty pricy for the quality. Maybe I&#39;m just biased, but the Cheesecake Factory is nothing special. <br><br>But if anything, I do enjoy their cheesecakes. That&#39;s about it.

This place is in the bottom of the Hancock building. It seems to always be very crowded. Being that I always ate at the bar,  I didn&#39;t have to be concerned with the lines. I ate at the bar and always had prompt and great service. <br><br>My expectations have always been met here.

Decent corporate food.  Terrible service.  Sitting at bar and the plates from customers who left before I arrived are still sitting next to me after I&#39;m done eating.   Bar completely understaffed.  Bartender nice enough when he gets a chance to look up.
Got the specialty shrimp pasta. Ugh service is slow but large portions. Pretty much what you expect from this place. Only come here if you have to.

You better come hungry!  I&#39;m only slightly ashamed to say I eat at Cheesecake Factory a few times a year.  I love the service, the food and of course, the cheesecake!!!!<br>I&#39;ve gotten smarter over the years and finally just ordered an appetizer.  This was much better on the wallet and I was still stuffed to the gills.  I was so full, I left again without getting my beloved cheesecake :-( <br>Sometimes I just have to get dessert.<br>One thing I occasionally do is take the leftovers and give them to someone on the street who is hungry- they seem appreciative.  <br>This time I ordered the Tex Mex Egg Rolls  and they were fabulous!

Just had lunch here. Appetizer kale and quinoa salad was huge. Lunch pizza and salad combination was also too much. Both were worth the price. Johnard was our server and was such a delight. Very friendly and outgoing. Another fantastic face for a company. As far as a go to place in my book, this is a destination spot when in Chicago.
Everything here is absolutely delicious! Our server Omar was very tentative and prompt.
Slowest service ever. Had to wait forever to place order and to receive the food. They took forever to thin the check and take it back. This is not the first time this happened. Never coming back.

I love a good cheesecake factory but this isn&#39;t one. I had to queue for 10 minutes to order for take out, and saw a couple ahead of me wait 20 minutes for two slices of cheesecake. It took 15 minutes and a manager to get my hot drink. It has been 35 minutes so far and there&#39;s no sign of my food... oh, and a homeless man solicited me for change in the restaurant while I was waiting. This location needs an urgent change of management.

Attentive service, clean restaurant, yummy food and good-sized portions.  I&#39;ve never had more than a couple minute wait since I typically come either right before or right after the lunch rush. I&#39;ve come here a couple of times and always ordered the miso salmon lunch special, which I really enjoy.  My four year old typically orders the chicken strips kids meal and those are pretty tasty... real breast meat pieces (not the overly processed strips).  They have a hugely extensive menu so there&#39;s sure to be something for everyone.  It&#39;s a chain and it&#39;s right smack in tourist-central but the quality of the food has been solid.  And the cheesecakes we&#39;ve had have all been supreme!!

This was amazing I came here for me and my husbands 6 year anniversary 3 months ago. And I loved it so much !!!!! I had a burger a shake and ofcourse chocolate cheese cake I recommend ! So fancy and nice staff
Waited 30 minutes, the restaurant is full of people, waiter can be cery busy. But The cheesecakes are great. Love godiva!

I was taken here yesterday for a post-birthday dinner by my best friend.  We got there pretty early so we were seated promptly. We really only had to wait about 2 minutes for a booth, and we got a window seat so that we could people watch.  I ordered the Filet Large but subbed  in mashed potatoes and added a side of tempura asparagus, I had coffee, and tiramisu cheesecake.  My friend had the Herb-Crusted Salmon with mashed potatoes and asparagus and the peanut butter chocolate cheesecake. <br><br>We were stuffed!  Everything was really delicious, the gravy on my mashed potatoes had mushrooms in it so I think it was the madeira mushroom sauce that normally comes with the Steak Diane (which I would have ordered - maybe next time).  My only beef (pun intended) is that there was gristle on my tenderloin, which I just can&#39;t forgive for a 29.95 price tag.  And what was supposed to be medium rare was medium, boo.  But it&#39;s a chain, and I refused to bitch about anything.  I was just happy to be eating because I saved up all day and was very hungry.  So that&#39;s where that point went.<br><br>AAAAAAAND anyway, it was all great.  I love the posh nouveau decor.  So so much.  What a cool looking place.  I would definitely go back. Service was great, too.  She was very cheerful and kind.  <br><br>Plus I had excellent company!  :)

Bad service. I asked for milk for my coffee, the guy said: use your relative&#39;s coffee. I said they need it.  It took him 5 minutes to get me the milk. After returning home I had the stomach runs if you know what I mean. ....I&#39;m disappointed

I go to this place for one thing...CHEESECAKE. it&#39;s what qualifies them for 2 stars! They should get 4 stars of that&#39;s all they did. <br><br>Their menu for food is super big and the quality is hit or miss. Drinks are consistently weak. I don&#39;t enjoy the hefty prices and sub par food. <br><br>I do however love the cheesecake! <br>Godiva chocolate <br>Adam&#39;s Peanut butter cheesecake

For years, we have celebrated most birthdays or milestones at a Cheescake Factory and this time was no exception.<br><br>Celebrating my 50th birthday and wondering where to celebrate, I was lucky I spotted this location, which also happened to be close to the hotel we were staying at. <br><br>The first thing that really struck me was that we were able to get a table right away and this being a Friday night! <br><br>The waitress seemed to either be new or totally overwhelmed because she kept forgetting things and had to keep calling her back over and over.<br><br>Food was typical Chessecake Factory fare, so no real surprises here. <br><br>While having dinner, an employee carrying a container with ice dropped it close to our table making a whole mess...<br><br>When it came time for dessert, my wife asked for a slice of cheesecake and she expected to have it with a birthday candle like the so many other times in other locations but to her surprise, they were out of candles. Very weird and disappointing.<br><br>We paid too much for a bad experience. And it was so disappointing it was on such a big occasion.

Avoid this restaurant. There&#39;s so much more good food in Chicago! We had a quick lunch when we arrived in town because we were starving and hadn&#39;t gotten our bearings yet. It was fine, but super slow. I assumed it was a fluke. Tonight we went in just for dessert... You know, because that&#39;s what they&#39;re named for. It took over 20 minutes for someone to speak to us, then they said they&#39;d rush the kitchen for us since we&#39;d been waiting. They brought out a brownie sundae with almost frozen brownies that were stale tasting. It was horrible. We sent it back and said we&#39;d just take the hot fudge sundae. By the time we got it we&#39;d been in the restaurant an hour! And it was utterly mediocre. How do you screw up a $9 ($12 with tax and tip) hot fudge sundae? Well, start with a tiny, tiny amount of hot fudge smeared on the glass to make it look like a lot. Pour in a couple of tiny, tiny scoops of ice cream and a ton of camouflage whipped cream.
Best cheesecake I ever had the servers are friendly and polite, the only thing I hate is this place is super crowed with tourist.

I visited this place today and I was not impressed with my food selection (fried catfish,mash potatoes, green beans, and corn. The catfish was over cooked and tasted like it was kept over from the following evening dinner. The Nash potatoes looked dark (or was it from the lightening in the room?). The only good thing was the turtle cheesecake which I deeply enjoy. I doubt very seriously if I would ever return nor recommend this place for a dinning experience.

Had such amazing service at this location I couldn&#39;t believe it. It was a last minute decision on a busy Saturday night to come here for a drink and appetizer. We had 5 people and the host was just about to write our name down for a 1.5 hour wait when the most wonderful little waitress came over and said &#34;hi I have immediate seating for 5 in the cafe&#34;. We&#39;ll take it! She was fantastic! Then our waitress for the evening was also just wonderful. She gave us recommendations, never rushed us, and when a bigger table opened up after 10 minutes she moved us quickly over to it. What service! The cafe part has a more limited menu than the restaurant. We had the lettuce wraps and I had the sangria. Yum yum! Everything was delicious. Bravo to the staff at the Cheesecake Factory in Chicago!

Bartenders are not able to talk about or describe their menu. Asked about a beer and was completely different! Not attentive during busy hours and can be hard to get a bar seat because of the number of people they let take it up waiting for a table. Food was relatively quickly prepared. Fries cold, boo!! No one checks in. Better restaurant options close by!

Met some friends here for dinner on New Years Eve and got seated right away around 5:30. I ordered the filet and my husband ordered the chicken parm sandwich. I didn&#39;t share any of my meal! The portion size was great, the food was hot, and we all cleaned our plates. Drinks were always refilled and our waitress was attentive. Ordered the tiramisu cheesecake for desert to share with my husband but I wish I would&#39;ve ordered my own! It was really good! We always come to the Cheesecake Factory when we are in Chicago and we always have excellent food and service. I just thought I would write a review because this resturant is always so consistent with their food and service. We will be back next time we visit Chicago!
No Michelin stared place or anything, but great drunk food and cake. It knows what it is.
Very expensive and just okay food. My chicken had 2 bones I found in it, and my pasta was not cooked enough and very hard. They do get the food out in a timely manner though.

So going into The Cheesecake Factory you kinda know what to expect. The place was very very crowded and busy, but thats to be expected on a Saturday night in downtown Chicago. During our wait I went to the bar and tried the &#34;whiskey smash&#34; cocktail. The service was fast and friendly at the bar and the drink was so delicious that I had to have a second one with my meal! As my girlfriend and I had ate not that long ago. We decided to eat small and go big on the cheesecake for desert. The service at our table was exceptionally fast and friendly. I ordered the buffalo blasts, basically it&#39;s buffalo chicken dip in a friend shell served with ranch/blue cheese. My girlfriend ordered the house salad as a meal. My girlfriend and I were pretty blown away by the buffalo blasts. What a simple idea yet astonishing results. My girlfriend hates &#34;purple lettuce&#34; as she calls it. So I kinda disqualified her opinion on that. She does claim the dressing was very sweet but good. For desert we decided to order two cheesecakes. I ordered the Hershey&#39;s chocolate and she ordered the strawberry cheesecake. Both of them were out of this world good. The entire experience was very nice and friendly. My only issue is that the lighting in the bar/main dining area was very very dim. It almost felt basement dim. But great food! And phenomenal desserts!

Last night was my first time ever dining at The Cheesecake Factory. I had read a few Yelp reviews prior to and the mixed feedback had me skeptical. But my boyfriend had received a CF giftcard from his job, so we decided to have a date night here.<br><br>I knew the restaurant would be packed because several Yelpers coined this place as a &#34;tourist trap&#34;, so I decided to call ahead to get an estimate of the wait time. The lady said it was a half hour wait and kindly informed me that I could not put my name on the list over the phone when I tried to. My boyfriend ended up arriving before me, so our table was ready by the time I got there. I asked him how long he had been there and he said it had only been a 15 minute wait. <br><br>We were escorted to our table and given menus. I have seen some pretty large &#39;multi-paged&#39; menus in my lifetime, but never had I seen a menu with ads! I chuckled to myself as it became clear why this place was labeled a tourist trap. As we were perusing, a female server named Liz came over and introduced herself. She asked if she could start us off with drinks and I asked her for two ice waters and two cups of hot water. [The hot water was for the silverware, which several Yelpers had pointed out would be filthy and to my suprise, were correct.] A few minutes after she left, a male server named Ryan came over and introduced himself. He then proceeded to ask if he could get us any drinks. Suprised, I told him we had been greeted already. He then explained that the previous server had been confused about whether or not we were her table, and apologized for the confusion.<br><br>After recieving our drinks, being served warm bread and Ryan patiently answering all of my boyfriend&#39;s redundant questions about salads, we ordered our entrees. I ordered the Chicken Bellagio while my boyfriend ended up going with the Ceasar. Our food arrived in a timely manner, long enough for me to discover that each bathroom stall has its own personal sink and us to eat all of our bread, and looked absolutely delicious. Once we began to dig in, we both were pleasantly suprised. His Ceasar was generously portioned and well-dressed, while my pasta had my tastebuds rejoicing. I begged him to taste my dish and he, being born in Italy and a Italian food connoisseur, was also impressed.<br><br>The overall evening was better than I expected, and my complaints were few and far apart. Sadly, it was my night to pick up the bill and last night&#39;s budget did not allow for me to try an cheesecake. Lol. In conclusion, I realize that The Cheesecake Factory is not a five-star restaurant, as should anyone else considering eating here. The food was tasty and that is all that matters.<br><br>P.S. I took off a star because of the silverware. I&#39;m a slight germaphobe, and icky silverware makes me feel uncomfortable. The managers of this restaurant really need to pay more attention to this issue, because I&#39;m sure that is some sort of health code violation! :c

I have been known to fantasize about this place. So much so that we make sure to stop in whenever we&#39;re in Chicago. Part of the reason could be because of the fun, Alice in Wonderland-esque atmosphere, complete with a lovely waterfall outside. Add a gigantic menu and friendly service and I&#39;m a happy girl.<br><br>I have been with groups of 10+ people, all sharing dishes, and have yet to try something I didn&#39;t enjoy. The portions are large enough that you&#39;ll be stuffed, yet will still have plenty of leftovers. Their Crispy Artichoke Hearts are a personal favorite (the lemon-garlic dip is addictive) and you can&#39;t go wrong with finishing your meal (assuming you have any room left) with a slice of the ridiculously delicious and decadent Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake. The downside is that this location can get pretty packed, so you may want to plan your visit. The lines get quite long, although I haven&#39;t had much trouble when dining close to opening time.

When we come to Chicago we always have to dessert at the Cheesecake Factory.  Only dessert, though.  There are much better places for dinner first.  The cheesecake is fantastic.  The wait however is not.  The fact that you can&#39;t make reservations is a bit of a frustration.  Next time we&#39;ll get it as take-out.

I came here for brunch with a friend. Service was rather slow. Despite having a plethora of tables, we had to wait for the waitress to clock in before we could be seated. Sure... okay. We were seated in a booth, and I instantly noticed that our lamp was amazingly dusty. Like, I was scared if someone ran past our table, dust would fall into our food.<br><br>I ordered a red sangria, because I love sangria and I want to try it everywhere. Their sangria was OVERLY sweet. I know it&#39;s the cheesecake factory, but there&#39;s no reason my sangria should taste like a cherry jolly rancher. My friend got the chicken caesar salad. It was a generous portion, and we ended up sharing. I got the skinny chicken pasta, which was pretty good.

This was the worst Cheesecake Factory restaurant experience ever! We were seated quickly and from there the rest was a disaster. It took 15 minutes to get drinks, which we ordered water and Sprite. When tasting the Sprite the cup was filled with water. Had to flag server down to replace. Finally ordered our meal about 20 mins after being seated. Simple order of soup/salad and 2 orders of spaghetti and meatballs. One hour later food still had not arrived and we had to flag down server. He said they ran out of meatballs and food was coming. 5 mins later no food but manager came over to apologize and said food was no charge. We FINALLY got our food 5 mins later and it was terrible. Spaghetti was hard and undercooked and there was about 4 bites of chicken salad on the plate. Before leaving I used the rest room where it was dirty and unkept. Only one stall had toilet paper so the line was to the door. If I could give this a 0 star rating I would. Will never return to this one again. Very disappointing!!!!

They don&#39;t care because they don&#39;t have to.  Waited for a table at 3:30 in the afternoon for 45 minutes.  Finally escorted through a giant restaurant that had dozens of empty tables.  They don&#39;t staff the restaurant.  Even with throngs of people waiting.  Service was terrible and slow.  The food was garbage.  At 5:30, two of us were served cold food.  The other two waited for theirs to come, 10 minutes later which was hot.  This restaurant is an embarrassment to Chicago.

I wish I could give zero stars. Our server, Ashley B, didn&#39;t greet our table for over 10 minutes. She then took our drinks, then proceeded to disappear for another 10-15 minutes. She never came to check on us, a different server gave me a refill and served our food, which was cold. I told Ashley and she didn&#39;t even apologize for it. Her response was &#34;oh okay&#34; and made me pay for the entire meal. Ordered Godiva cheesecake to go, which should come with a square of Godiva chocolate, nowhere to be found. Awful service, I&#39;m highly disappointed. If you ever go to this location and get sat with Ashley B, just get up and leave.

I&#39;ve lived in Chicago for six years and have never once had the desire to endure all that is the Cheesecake Factory. But, my partner having received a gift cert for the chain, and us already being downtown on Saturday evening, we ventured in with patience. <br><br>It&#39;s not that the Factory has bad food or bad drinks or bad service or bad anything, really (it&#39;s actually all mediocre). It&#39;s just that it is exactly what its title says - a factory. You wait 45 minutes with 1,000 tourists to grab a seat in a restaurant that easily serves hundreds. Your waiter or waitress will immediately saunter up and say they&#39;re really busy (because, well, they are) while you pour over a 10-plus-page menu of everything from tacos to pastas to pizzas to sandwiches. <br><br>When you finally decide on an over-priced dish, your waiter will ask if you need anything. You&#39;ll suggest water and it&#39;ll take 10 minutes to come. Servers, hostesses, bussers and other members of this food manufacturing facility will sashay by - busy as bees. Your food will arrive semi-quickly, a portion so huge it might as well be stamped with &#34;America!&#34; on it. If the factory cut their portion sizes in half, they could also cut their prices in half, which for the actual food itself, would make sense, because it&#39;s nothing we haven&#39;t had before. <br><br>My chicken and biscuits were indeed chicken and biscuity, just as they should be, but my partner&#39;s salmon packed much more flavor (I wanted comfort food, though, and it did meet that expectation).<br><br>Service? Meh. Our guy was nice enough - when he was around. We ended up with a hybrid approach to being waited on - a woman who filled in when our guy kept forgetting things (water, an explanation of the menu, etc.) <br><br>The factory is exactly as I expected it to be, nothing more and nothing less. They should consider slowing down a little - I suspect that 45-minute wait is standard busy or not - and cutting portions (nearly every table I spied had take-away bags) and besides, shouldn&#39;t we all just be here for the cheesecake, anyway?

Yes, in a city full of amazing dive bars, amazing local eats and world famous restaurants I chose Cheesecake Factory on the busiest Chicago street with more tourists than anyone can count...And I&#39;m proud of it. I love Cheesecake Factory, of any place I&#39;ve ever been in Chicago, their lettuce wraps are hands down my favorite. After letting out my inner child at Navy Pier all day, I wanted lettuce wraps and I was up for the long jaunt down Michigan Ave on a Sunday.<br><br>Upon getting there, as always it was packed, but only a 20 minute wait. This location under the Hancock building is pretty large and they get people in and out in a timely manner. I am a fan of their wheat bread, I can&#39;t get enough of that stuff! The staff is super friendly and chipper, which I think is even more impressive when you work somewhere that is always so populated. The staff is really always up on their A-Game.<br><br>My Thai lettuce wraps were amazing, and huge! It&#39;s been probably 8 or 9 months since I&#39;ve had them and they were delicious! I strongly recommend these! However, I honestly have never had anything on the menu I don&#39;t like. I was close to getting a new chipolte pasta, but I thought my body would be happier with the lettuce wraps. <br><br>I opted out from getting dessert this time, but I&#39;ve also never had a piece of cheesecake there that wasn&#39;t phenomenal!

NEVER EVER GET TAKE OUT FROM HERE!!!!!!!<br><br>Ordered by phone and was told order would be ready by 7:05.  Arrived at 7:10.  Can you believe they made us wait in a long line of people ordering cheesecake slices and coffees?<br><br>When we finally got to the front of the line, they &#34;could not find&#34; our order, and told us the manager &#34;was searching for it.&#34;  When the manager finally came out, he was completely unaware of our order, and certainly had not been searching for it.  Turns out they hadn&#39;t started on our order.  <br><br>Eventually they made our order.  No apologies or discounts.  <br><br>This is just simply not a place that does takeout well.
Fettuccine Alfredo was disappointing, lacking flavor and noodles over cooked and mushy. My wife&#39;s burger was excellent and Cheesecake is Awesome!
Delicious skinnylicious hamburger. The architecture style is special. My friends ordered steak, and tasted great. There were a lot of people, we waited 50 minutes. The cheesecake looks great!!!

There was quite a wait when we got to the restaurant, but after that the service was good. Great staff, the menu was amazing and the dessert menu was even better. The drinks are really expensive but delicious. Our food came quickly after we ordered and our waiter came back to check on us and ensure everything was good and to see if we needed anything else. I was there for a birthday lunch and had ordered cheesecake for dessert - the wait staff sang and happy birthday to you was written in chocolate sauce around the plate with a candle in the cheesecake. Not sure what all the negative reviews are about, but we had an incredible experience. It&#39;s super convenient if you&#39;re visiting 360 or shopping on Mag Mile as well.

Restaurant review<br>If you like cheesecake, american food, and a busy restaurant then this is the place to visit. Located in the John Hancock building, this place is always super busy with a long wait. The food itself is good, but it is after all a chain restaurant. I can honestly say that I always leave filling full and happy. The prices are slightly above average, but cheaper then a fine dining restaurant. The cheesecake selection is always amazing, but you definitely over pay compared to buying a eli cheesecake from elsewhere. If you come be prepared to wait!<br><br>Pro: large cheesecake selection, classic american entrees<br><br>Cons: very long wait time<br><br>Hidden gem: None
I love their burgers and of course their cheesecake is the best! Sometimes you can be waiting long which sucks. but the food is delicious!
Good bar service with friendly bartenders who are very attentive and pleasant. For all Dave Matthews fans, they stock Dreaming Tree Wine.

What can I say? It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>New menu seems to be the same as the old one to me. Cheesecake Factory really isn&#39;t anything special, but I like the vibe here and the service is always good. It&#39;s an easy go-to for lunch when you want something &#39;safe&#39;. <br><br>Snag a seat outside, if you can, when the weather is nice

Ok. I&#39;ve been here (and the Oak Brook location) at LEAST 35 times, as it is the go-to restaurant for my large family&#39;s occasion dinners. The food is pretty consistently fresh and of good quality, and there is enough variety for everyone to find something that they like.<br>When I&#39;ve gone alone, with a date, or friends, it has been 90% satisfactory, as well. (I miss you, Avery!)<br>With all of that being said, I went again tonight. I told myself that it was for the Pre-National Cheesecake Day deal (1/2 off dessert slices), but I digress. I am taking the time to be the bazillionth reviewer of The Cheesecake Factory because of water! Yes, you read me correctly. Water is the the reason for this review. I just couldn&#39;t take it anymore! The food, the ambience, and the service are all laudable, but the water SUCKS DIRT! I don&#39;t understand how a fine dining establishment such as TCF can serve its guests such AWFUL water! I had to squeeze almost an entire lime into my glass in order to make it palatable! About 3 visits prior, I went with a very outspoken friend, who, upon being asked by our server if he needed anything else, said,&#34;Yes. Get rid of this nasty a** water, and bring me some GOOD water! I was a mortified, but the server returned shortly with a glass of perfectly delicious, and, apparently, purified water! He mentioned that he&#39;d gotten it from another part of the restaurant. Hunh?!?<br>You KNOW what I asked for on my next visit, right? Unfortunately, this server must not have known about the secret source, because he brought me a bottle of Fiji and a glass, and tacked on a hefty $5 for the pleasure. It&#39;s needless to say that I didn&#39;t try that one again, as I don&#39;t particularly care to pay so dearly for a glass of water worth drinking.<br><br>My dearest Cheesecake Factory, can you PLEASE remedy this one major flaw? I would greatly appreciate it, but I won&#39;t bother to make empty threats, because I&#39;ll be back tomorrow to celebrate National Cheesecake Day properly!
Staff is insanely rude and the food is mediocre and overpriced. Save your money and try out the many other options of restaurants near by which are worth the wait

Definitely an easy place to meet people for drinks if everyone works in the city. I typically meet friends for drinks here because its such a convenient location. <br><br>The only thing I have trouble with is deciding what to eat each time I go.

Has always been the best.. The food definetely depends on the choice of ur order... Careful wat u order as their menu is majestic ... The veggie toast with feta cheese was yummmm.. And the cheesecakes are divine...

Total CheeseCRAP factory! Went on a Tuesday so the place wasn&#39;t insanely crowded or anything so we were seated pretty quickly but only after snob city president (the hostess) took our party info. Oh and when you first walk in, despite employees running around like ants, no one tells you where the hell to check in at. The setup is a little funky. After being seated and waiting for an eternity we finally get to meet our waiter who is a first class AHOLE!Just an angry young man with a negative, snippy vibe. We were out and in a good mood and this guy just murdered that. Our drinks took, you guessed it, forever, to get there and they were obviously rushed. After having placed our order the manager, I think, comes over and tells us 2 out of the 4 items we ordered aren&#39;t available per the chef- so we just say thanks but we&#39;re leaving and he seems to have trouble processing this because his eyes roll and he repeats &#39;so you&#39;re leaving &#39;like 2-3 times . He doesn&#39;t ask why or for feedback. Oh, and we never got our bread. The Chicago chain should be ashamed of themselves. In the heart of the city with options all around and they aren&#39;t on their A game?! Y&#39;all are gonna end up like Applebee&#39;s if you&#39;re not careful. Bottom line is that, again, with all the options so near by this can&#39;t be your go-to for a meal out in the city. Totally bummed I wasted my hard earned money on parking when we didn&#39;t even stay. Oh and it&#39;s super dark inside- like a little too dark. Almost need your cell phone flashlight to read the menu dark. What are they hiding in that low light? I was honestly a little worried about the cleanliness especially with all those intricate wall and ceiling folds all over. Just sayin&#39;

The only reason why there&#39;s one star rating is because I can&#39;t post it otherwise. You should have a negative rating because my experience is worth a -100. Went back after over two years of not visiting this specific location. HORRIBLE. Customer service here is still a huge joke. Our pickup order was supposed to be ready at 7:07. We got to the restaurant at 7:10,  paid at 7:20, and literally stood there until after 8:00 until the food was in our hands. You would think that since it took that long that maybe they were still preparing and cooking it? Hahahahha, another joke. Everything was cold. One of the burgers, supposed to be cooked medium well, was completely black and charred on the outside and was raw in the middle. The kids pizza looked like it had been sitting out for hours. The milkshake was straight up just milk. Even the soda tasted like a poor imitation of sparkling water. The avocado rolls were all dark brown. What kills me is the cashier took our money and let us just stand there for over 40 minutes waiting for food that if I had known the quality, wouldn&#39;t even deserve $10. Even getting to talk to someone is a waste. I called shortly after arriving back home to speak with a manager about the predicament. I was put on hold for over twenty minutes before I just hung up. New management, new employees, new plan altogether needs to be initiated immediately. This location is particularly lucky that most of the customers are tourists visiting the city of Chicago because of would be surprised to find out that this location has loyal customers. Horrible way to treat customers who pay a lot of money to eat here. Disappointing and now I know I would NEVER go to this restaurant again.

My cheesecake factory dine in experience was okay at best. I order carryout all the time and my food is always excellent. The chefs here really know how to cook. The food is consistently good. However, the dine in experience was one I could have done without. To wait an hour for a salad is a bit much. I get my carryout in half the time, and it&#39;s stuff like pork chops or burgers or something they really have to cook. Also to watch people who were seated much after you receive their meals before you. I mean seated after the waiter has already taken and supposedly put in your order. The redemption for this visit is the food. As I said, the food is always consistent. Everyone at my table thought their meals were very delicious. My salad, even after waiting an hour was perfect. It will probably be a while before I ever dine in at cheesecake factory again. I will be back for a carryout meal soon though.

After eating out for a week in Chitown a group of six of us can agree that T.C.F. was one of the best. Was pleased with the Chicken Biscuit, it had like a open pot pie over sliced chicken on one end and mashed potatoes on the other. The biscuits weren&#39;t all that fresh but the whole wheat bread with oats made up for it (YUM) Others had the Parmesan Chicken sandwich and raved about how good it was! Didn&#39;t try any cheesecake myself but the display case had numerous variety&#39;s.

I saw a restaurant front that looked so wacky when I was walking down the street. Looked inside but did not see anybody, last second I saw a sign that said to continue down stairs for the host. <br><br>Once downstairs it was a fairly large and busy place. Being from out os country, I did not even realize it was a chain at first. It defiantly has a unique design. <br><br>Once we got our menus, we were surprised with the amount of selections, their menu is a booklet! <br><br>We ordered some appetizers and martinis and they were great. Our main dish were also great! We were very happy with the experience and the prices were quite cheap. Later I learned it was a chain, which kind of took away from uniqueness....

I ve always stop by at this restaurant for its location and the service but today my experience was terrible. We have arrived at the bar area where you&#39;ll be seated and requested to dine outside. The waiter came and asked us what we would like to drink and i ve told him water only. His facial expressions changed and it took him 20 minutes to bring our drinks. There were other tables whom order there food way after us they have ate and left ,still our food hasn&#39;t arrived.Finally waiter showed up and brought our drinks and i asked him about the bread and butter whick every table gets. He told me that i had to let him know if i want it or not. I&#39;ve been coming to this place for a while and never experienced this unprofessionalism but still no food. Its been 35 minutes. Waiter was hitting on every lady siting outside and taking care of there orders. I was so upset and i find the manager to complain. He said he is going to talk to him but I doubt it. Anyway i will not be coming back here.
Possible the worst service I&#39;ve experienced. The waitress forgot our order and we had to leave without eating after waiting for more than an hour.

Considering the location(close proximity to Michigan ave and John Hancock), it is always buzzing with people.Specially on weekends there are always huge wait list.Reserving a table before arriving makes sense.<br><br>They have a long menu list. Our waiter did not arrive even after we were seated for 20 minutes.Tried the Chicken pizza, which wasn&#39;t great.The banana cream cheesecake was nice.
the service is so bad. The waiter brought me the wrong dish, I was about to begin, the waiter took it back without saying a word. <br><br>So angry. Won&#39;t come back and dine in again.

I&#39;m writing this review to let people know about my experience and to advise them to choose the Cheesecake Factory for a nice time. As a usual consumer, I am interested in well-cooked dishes, high quality of food, unusual atmosphere and relatively acceptable prices. I would recommend you the Cheesecake factory, as it includes all of those options.<br><br>To begin with, I want to highlight a wide range of dishes and their unusual big portions. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory has his own extraordinary atmosphere. It creates a special mood among guests. I was really impressed by a unique décor, which makes you feel like you are in a fairytale: the nicely subdued light, pleasant music playing on the background, white-dressed waiters. <br>It is very clear from these observations that the Cheesecake Factory has all options to serve guests best and exceed their expectations. If you are interested in high service, appetizing food, unusual and out-of-the way atmosphere, so the Cheesecake Factory is a great alternative for you.<br><br>When I came to the Cheesecake Factory, I liked immediately the service of this place. The stuff find to you a table and they present a menu. Before to take the order, they bring to you a glass of water and than I ordered pasta. A big plate of pasta Fettuccine Alfredo, that could be divided among 3 persons, surprised me. It is a common fact that the bigger the size of portions the bigger the price. The Cheesecake Factory is an exception to this rule. In addition, the dishes are not just large they are extremely tasty. It is an indisputable advantage that makes consumers happy. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory has the most various and delicious range of cheesecake flavors such as: Oreo, Pumpkin, Red Velvet Cake and so on. I ordered the Strawberry cheesecake, which was so delicious and looked really beautiful. Deserts make people happy and the Cheesecake Factory knows how to do it best.<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is considered as the most popular place to have good time with family and friends, celebrate birthdays, family events.

Last night we visited for dinner at 9:30pm,service was terrible. After being sat and quickly greeted by our waiter it was all down hill from there. Order appetizers that took a extremely longer that usual time for and arrived luke warm, waiter was attentive to the large group across from us while our drinks sat empty. Filet was over cooked requested a medium well, received a crisp over cooked well done burnt steak. Waiter did not check on our order until we were half way through our dinner as he was more concerned with the large group next to us, cracking jokes and splitting checks for a group of at least 20. Also found it odd that the restaurant chose to pull their wait staff off the floor to loudly sing happy birthday in the kitchen for another staff member in the middle of service. Chose to order cheesecake from the counter since our waiter was no where to be found, counter employee was rude as well. When exiting and passing the host stand witnessed a male employee massaging a Female employee at the host stand.

My boyfriend and I were leaving close by bar and were very hungry. I had been to this particular Cheesecake Factory before with positive results so I convinced him to go. Side Note: If you&#39;re shopping on Michigan Ave, this is a great place to wrap up your day. <br><br>When we checked in the hostess said their would be a 30 minute wait, so we tried the bar area and found a table top right away. <br><br>Service - Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. While we waited for food, a manager came over to apologize for the wait and I&#39;m pretty sure was about to offer us a free appetizer, but we declined and just asked for more bread. What&#39;s funny about this is we didn&#39;t think at all the food was delayed. About 1/2 minutes later our food came out piping hot. <br><br>Food - The last few times I came here I order a delicious salmon dish (so good I figured out how to make it at home), bi this day I opted for the chicken enchiladas. Good Choice. It was a different taste than I was expecting from other times I&#39;ve had enchiladas, but it was a good different. Very earthy and savory flavor. I finished every morsel. We also order cheesecake to go - and of course that was wonderful as well.<br><br>Atmosphere - Set up like most Cheescake factories. A little dark here though, but once your eyes adjust, it&#39;s okay. It was a bit noisy in the bar area, so steer clear of there is you want quiet time. <br>So...the bathroom. Pretty clean, but it has complete stalls (toilet and sink) all together behind a door you can lock. So I and others had to wait a long time for a stall. It almost looked like a mini Flash Mob doing the bathroom dance. Hahaha. Just don&#39;t wait until the last minute to go to the <br>bathroom. You might be uncomfortable with the wait.
Fresh and tasty!! Got our food on time and Got amazing service from Alexi :) highly recommend !
Tried again for my boyfriend&#39;s birthday in June. Once again the cake was not ready and they were out of toppings. Maybe I&#39;ll just order online or give up next year.

Service was average to poor.  We waited to be seated.  No one ever came so we as to inquire.  The manager came but her response was less than good.  She said she would follow up.  <br><br>The food was ample in quantity and good.  <br><br>The server was okay.<br><br>We had a gift card otherwise I wouldn&#39;t dine here.
Terrible server, I told him I was in a hurry and if he could bring the food out, and he had an absolute emotional breakdown. Never asked if everything was fine, and never offered me water.

They have earned one more star from me because yesterday, my girl&#39;s parents came into town and one of the things on their agenda was the Cheesecake Factory. We got there around 5PM and for the second time out of all the times I have been there, there was hardly anyone there (I know to just show up during the week instead of the weekend). <br><br>We all got cheesecake and my choice was my all time favorite, The Key Lime Cheesecake and it was great as usual!  We all had martinis. The three of them got Cosmos and even though it wasn&#39;t on the menu, I got a French Martini (love those). One of the best French Martinis I have ever tasted in my life (true story!). My girl and her parents have never tasted a french martini, so I let them taste mine and the next round were all french (They are hooked now!)<br><br>Service was awesome and for the first time ever I used the bathroom in this place and it was really nice actually. Good times, good company, good drinks and good cheesecake! Well deserved extra star Cheesecake Factory!

My table was dirty and it smelled, so I was moved to the table next to mine, which also smelled.<br><br>I had a great waiter and the food was good. However, I watched the busboy wipe the table next to mine after the patrons left, and then understood why the tables stink. The busboy uses the same towel to wipe the tables, and then puts the towel in his apron pocket. He then puts down napkins and silverware on the table. That was gross, and for sure, unsanitary.<br><br>Watching this caused me to stop eating and I would not order dessert. <br><br>I did not like the setting in the first place, and having to smell an unclean table while I ate, did not go over well with me. I do not plan to go back.

I came to hopefully enjoy a delicious sandwich instead I was greeted with rudeness and indifference<br>I simply asked where&#39;s the bathroom?<br>Seems like some of the employees here too busy to be nice<br>It will be a while before I come back.
My husband and I used to love their salads, but now - not so much!  They&#39;re all lettuce.  Southwest salad should have beans, corn, chicken - it was 95% lettuce.

The only thing I ever order here is the gigantic Cobb Salad, which I lived large on today and dropped $15 for lunch. It&#39;s like crack though, so delicious. Ordered take-out, too much of a zoo to put up with eating in. The outdoor dining area can be pleasant, and at the foot of the Hancock, has some glamour to it.<br><br>Jordan Mozer&#39;s cartoon interior isn&#39;t holding up so well with time, starting to show a bit of age and wear. I had such a crush on Chicago&#39;s Bad Boy of Architecture in the 80s. His interiors are really imaginative, but apparently don&#39;t age well.<br><br>The bar can be fun, to snicker at the tourists. I only like this place in the winter, &#39;cos it seems closed in to me, and not a lot of windows, which I don&#39;t like. Good place to bring picky eaters, the food is reliably good, but nothing special.<br><br>My love of giant salads continues unabated, but wow - the service at this place is pretty bad. Don&#39;t wait on someone else before you&#39;re finished with my transaction, woman!

To start off it was busy, but only had to wait 15 minutes with just my brother and I. We definitely got called before that time limit so the wait for a table wasn&#39;t bad. <br><br>Very impressed and happily stuffed from all the food. I really liked how there was a small menu for little meals, salads, drinks, etc. that said under a certain caloric number. I got the spinach artichoke dip to start and wasn&#39;t the best I&#39;ve ever had, but was very delicious. I then got the americana cheeseburger which was very meaty and hit the spot for my craving. And..to Top it all off I got their notoriously delicious red velvet cake cheesecake. Was planning on taking a picture, but was too busy admiring and devouring the taste of the rich and sweet bites!

Poor service. Ordered two slices of cheese cake to go. I was handed a bag with whipped cream smeared all over one side of the bag. When I asked for another bag, the person acted as though it was an inconvenience. When I took out the boxes to transfer bags, the boxes had whipped cream all over the top and bottom of them. To pay almost $18 for two slices of cheesecake, this kind of service is ridiculous.

I often go in there to get cheesecake after work &#34;to go&#34;. It&#39;s annoying that no matter what it always is a 10 minute wait... For some reason they never give you your slice of cheesecake after you pay... I&#39;ve been there numerous amounts of time that there has been no one there, the cashier takes the cash and then someone else has to get it... It doesn&#39;t make sense. So I decided to call and place an order this way I didn&#39;t have to wait ... An associate by the name of Sam kept me on hold for 20 minutes!!! Good is good ... Service sucks

This is the most mammoth Cheesecake Factory location I have seen. Whoa...<br><br>I don&#39;t care if it&#39;s a chain, I LOVE eating here.  The servers were very nice <br>at this location &amp; the food amazing as usual. Free refills on the lemonade, yeah :)<br><br>Oh yeah, you bet your bottom dollar I&#39;ll be back.

I love cheesecake! One of my simple and yummy pleasures. I have never been disappointed in my cheesecake on all the years I&#39;ve been going there. I may not always dine in but I will stop by solely for the cheesecake. With that being said...I understand the popularity of the restaurant. But, I&#39;m so put off by the constant crowding and the apparent disorganization at times. Granted, if it&#39;s not enough staff...they aren&#39;t at fault. But, many of times I turn away due to the wait time.

I had to drop the stars down this one time. Our waiter, Nathan, last night was not friendly and it was not received well since we were a large crowd who waited 2 hours and change to be seated and had 3 birthdays. It took forever to get seated which is understandable since we had a large crowd. However when we got called we had to wait another 20-30 minutes for them to get our table ready. Followed by three meals that were incorrect / under cooked. The waiter dropped bread on our table and expected us to still eat it . I ordered the kale salad and the Diane steak which was delicious ( Thank God ). But I just feel like the service could have been much better than it was.

Terrible wait time. Was told it would be 45 minutes and hour and a half hostess told us 10 more minutes and then sat a table of 5 who just came in. When I questioned it she said they were sitting outside. I would have taken first available. Hostess had no clue!
Poor service, overrated food, very cold - too much aircondition. But the cheesecake was alright.
Food is okay but slow slow slow service.  Here on a Thursday night, half empty place,  still waited a hour and half... this is the 3rd bad experience we have had here. 3 strikes you&#39;re out! :-/

This is the place to go if you&#39;re from the burbs or a tourist and don&#39;t know any better. Oops that&#39;s the food snob in me coming out! Ok, Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t bad....but there are so many great places to eat in this city!<br><br>That being said, my boyfriend&#39;s cheesecake craving was out of control so we had to stop in for a slice to go. There were so many delicious looking cakes at the counter and we had  hard time choosing! We went with mango key lime. <br><br>The place was busy so I expected to wait a few minutes...but not over 15! The cakes were pre-sliced and ready to go....it wasn&#39;t as though ours had to be made! During that time, I noticed two employees standing around, waiting for orders. Yet for some reason, it took them over 15 minutes to get someone to grab a slice and put it in a box. The people in front of us got theirs way before ours. <br><br>The cheesecake was awesome, but I wouldn&#39;t wait that long or pay almost $8 for a slice again.

Cheesecake Factory has always been my favorite restaurant but this particular location has disappointed me. I came here for lunch on Mother&#39;s Day and we waited an hour for a table ,which it wasn&#39;t a big deal ,I understand we&#39;re in Chicago and it&#39;s Mother&#39;s Day. What let me down was my main course, I had the salmon with angel hair and the salmon was cold and the pasta was cold and hard, I totally lost my appetite and I didn&#39;t bother to ask them for another one because I know they&#39;re busy. I really hope this was just an one time only incident.

The menu is enormous.  You&#39;re sure to find something you&#39;ll like.  I had the Teriyaki Chicken, and it was good.<br><br>The restaurant is a little cheesy, but that can be forgiven as long as you&#39;re not one of those people who is all about &#34;authentic&#34; little bistros in plywood shacks somewhere.<br><br>I don&#39;t have anything particularly negative to say about the Cheesecake Factory, but there was a bit of a sticker shock when we got our bill.  Were those martinis really worth $10 a pop?  Um, no.<br><br>For  two entrees, two drinks, two slices of cheesecake and a tip, I walked out $80 lighter.  That seems disproportionate.  If the prices were more reasonable, I could notch this baby to 4 stars, easy.<br><br>I consider this a nice place to take your out-of-town visitors or a worthy stop just for the desserts.

Mmmmmm Dulce de Leche cheesecake.  You are my weakness.<br><br>I like the Cheesecake Factory.  Yeah, I know, it&#39;s a chain restaurant.  Chain restaurants can be good, too.  I have no problem with the fact that it&#39;s a chain.  If anything, the only problem I have is that it&#39;s busy so often that it&#39;s almost impossible to eat there without waiting at least 40 minutes for a table.  <br><br>The restaurant itself is a very nice place.  Classy, kind of dark - a nice place for a date or a fun group outing.  They have a nice bar in the back with first come, first serve tables and a nice place to hang out while you&#39;re waiting for a table.  <br><br>The food is great!  I&#39;ve never had a problem with anything I&#39;ve ordered.  I really like their veggie burger, regular burger and all of their appetizers.  I am confident that anything I order will be good because the quality is good and the quantity is unbelievable.  This is definitely a place that provides a ton of leftovers after the meal.  <br><br>And the cheesecake!!  They have anything and everything possible for every taste.  You can get a slice or an entire cake, whichever you choose.  I&#39;ve been at parties that have Cheesecake Factory desserts - yum!!  Cheesecake happens to be my favorite dessert, so perhaps I&#39;m biased, but it&#39;s fiercely delicious.

Man, this location is so much better than the ones in Houston! The staff here are always really nice and attentive. <br><br>This place can get packed since it&#39;s right on the Magnificent Mile, so be prepared to wait a while to get seated. But both times I&#39;ve been here, &#34;a while&#34; was like 10 minutes, so it&#39;s probably hit or miss with wait time. <br><br>I didn&#39;t order a mojito, but my friend did and it was really good. And I am not a mojito person. <br><br>Sometimes the menu itself is overwhelming, but I usually like whatever I order. Clam chowder is always good. And the pastas are always good, too.<br><br>And according to my friend, the red velvet cheesecake was awesome.
This is definitely the best cheesecake factory I have ever been to. Take a ride up to the top of the Hancock building while you&#39;re there...

I was here last night Feb 15, and I was very pleased!<br><br>Nick started with us, very informative, great smile, pleasant attitude, and was very composed in the middle of a huge dinner rush. He definitely possesses a very valuable professional work ethic where I can see him in management. He also informed us later that Tinos would take over, where as before he had his hands full. That shows great communication amongst the co workers and I applaud that! Tinos also was wonderful, very warm welcoming attitude, great smile. Even the bussers wished us to enjoy our meals which was refreshing. <br><br>The food was fantastic, two thumbs up. I had the Sun-dried tomato pasta with a red and white sauce mix (with chicken). Perfect combination of sweet and savory. My husband had the jambalaya pasta which he loved. He said &#34;This is the first time I am eating from someone else&#39;s opinion and it was very good! He was on point with this!&#34; I don&#39;t have to say much about the cheesecake, we all know it&#39;s good!<br><br>Only thing negative is I do not recommend sitting by the window, there was a strong cold draft I had to wear my winter coat and scarf the entire time with my husbands jacket on my legs. Since everything was so great, it still made a pleasant evening for my husband and I which is why I think this review makes an honorable 5-star rating.

We were sat by the kitchen, the staff was incredibly loud and distracting.  The waiter was not friendly and there was hair in our food. I felt it was completely over rated and over priced. There are hundreds of better options in Chicago.

Came here for my birthday in NOVEMBER with my girlfriend The atmosphere is relaxed and they sing happy birthday to you when requested.<br><br>Well i seen a couple people have the birthday song sang to them. Awhile later 4 or 5 workers came out of nowhere to sing happy birthday to me. LOL And other patrons in the restaurant sang along too...
Super Super busy location, and huge.  Great outdoor patio area to sit, so much hussle and bussle.  They did a great job and the wait was only about 30 mins.

Surprised at the poor service and the lack of presentation! The food was thrown together, the waiter was severely inattentive, and the wait was long. Usually love this chain, but no cigar with this location. Save your money, go somewhere local.

Dinner started out fine. The the crab artichoke appetizer was delicious. However, after a 35 minute wait for your entree and then finding a grill pick mixed in your pasta was not very appetizing. The server never apologized, just got a manger who did not do much. Decided to order dessert, which took another 25 minutes to get. A waste of 2.5 hours and my money.

This is only a review for this particular location, not Cheesecake Factory in general. We went for an early dinner Saturday evening &amp; literally had the worst service I&#39;ve ever had. I&#39;ll break it down -<br><br>Drinks - 1st round took forever. Ordered 2nd round &amp; they never came. <br><br>Bread - Were asked if we wanted some &amp; which kind. We said yes &amp; one of each. It never came. We requested it again when our food arrived &amp; they only brought 1 kind. When we asked for more, we were told they were out but would bring us some when a new batch was finished. It never came.<br><br>Entrees - the Pasta di Vinci was tasteless &amp; my steak medallions were served with a butter knife. Nice.<br><br>We left without getting our 2nd round of drinks &amp; noticed that the people next to us left before their cheesecake arrived. They abandoned cheesecake - that is how bad the service was. I definitely will not go back to this location.  I&#39;m totally bummed I wasted my gift card on this location :(

I&#39;ll start by saying nothing was terrible with my meal. The food was good, our waitress was friendly and nice, service was a little slow, but they were pretty busy, and the meal as a whole was nice.<br>The slider appetizer was surprisingly fresh and delicious. My popcorn shrimp appetizer (I got for a meal) was not your run of the mill frozen shrimp and had some better breading than most. It also came with cocktail sauce and aioli. <br>Honestly, the $11.50  top-shelf Long Island Iced Tea, that didn&#39;t get me drunk enough is probably what&#39;s keeping me from forking over 4 stars.
This location by far is the best.. Food was excellent, The server, Derek was excellent.. I loved the way they cooked my Broccoli, yum......
I came here craving something dessert  -- absolutely the worst cheesecake I&#39;ve ever had. It was completely covered with whipped cream and sickeningly sweet.

It&#39;s touristy but still a nice place to eat.  I really like the atmosphere and the restrooms especially.  It wasn&#39;t a long wait at all to get a table.  The server brought us some delicious bread that I kept ordering.  I would&#39;ve just been satisfied w/ that.  I thought that the server was one of my favorites in a long time.  I tried remembering his name but unfortunately I couldn&#39;t think of it. <br><br>I had the &#34;little&#34; chicken tenders w/ a side of mashed and I substituted the corn for mac n cheese.  I got back this huge portion which I&#39;m glad that I have leftovers for today.  I really wanted to make room for the cheesecake but I couldn&#39;t seem to stop eating my entree.  I love it that I can enjoy food and a good conversation and of course a funny waiter.
Moderately priced with huge portions. Tons and tons of choices. Food was really great! Beer menu is slightly limited :/  desserts are also great!
Went to cheesecake factory downtown last night. Food was horrible, waitress was great, manager was worse than the food!

I went here on a very busy Friday afternoon. I think this location is always very busy and touristy. We were told about a long wait, but gladly we were seated pretty quickly. There was no option of sitting on the patio area, cuz they were not serving out there. It would have been nice to sit outside in the nice weather. I ordered the Little House salad, which is not a regular house salad at all. The vinagarette dressing is supposed to be tossed with this salad but I did not taste the dressing at all.
