I felt extremely bad for the employees who stayed in the back and rolled silverware all day without being offered drinks or food. I remember working 14 hours, and ONLY having a 30 minute break. <br><br>May I add that the pay is not good, I did expect more of Cheesecake Factory to pay their workers more money than a &#34;slow commercial restaurant&#34; As fast-paced and POPULAR this place is, PENNIES are giving to their employees for all the hard work they do on a daily basis.<br><br>I&#39;m sorry but the owner&#39;s of Cheesecake Factory seem to be very selfish and find it RIDICULOUS to not pay employees for holidays. You expect ME TO WORK ON CHRISTMAS DAY WITHOUT getting paid more? HA! You must be joking! This place is not worth applying nor working for. If you enjoy being a &#34;ROBOT&#34; go ahead and work here.<br><br>This place was by far the worst place I ever worked for, my voice has to be heard as I don&#39;t allow big companies not appreciating their employees for all the work they are doing to keep it running. REMEMBER, if it wasn&#39;t for the worker&#39;s there, there won&#39;t be no successful business as the worker&#39;s are the one&#39;s that bust their behinds for the pennies that they get because the Owner&#39;s of the company are very selfish individuals that don&#39;t care about no one else but themselves. <br><br>And some advice, DON&#39;T come bring your family when it&#39;s very busy  here as if the food falls onto the floor they will pick it up and put it right on your plate. They simply have no time to make a brand new order. <br><br>This is simply my opinion, and freedom of speech.

The Cheesecake Factory did not disappoint!  My family loved the food and our service was great. We started with the fried Macaroni and Cheese balls... They might have led to the biggest smiles my kids made all weekend!  Alex did a great job. Definitely will be back.
The food was good there, it&#39;s a very nice looking place just took a long while for me to get my change back took longer honestly then my food to come

It was in Chicago we were introduced to the Cheesecake Factory. Oh my goodness! I can&#39;t rave enough. In many desert places, the main meals are somewhat average. Not so at the Cheesecake Factory. The burgers, the fries, the salads.... all delicious. And then the Cheesecake....! The first time we went, we had a cheesecake each. Whoops. No one told us we weren&#39;t supposed to! We walked out feeling satisfied but stuffed full of richness. We went to the Cheesecake factory 3 more times while we were in America. Never again did we get an individual cheesecake but each time we shared one, it was still just as delicious as the first time.
Satisfied every time I go to the cheesecake factory, the waiters/waitresses know the menu and explain it to you very well in case your in the mood to try something new from the menu.

Sunday brunch was a great experience, not a long wait for us, we sat at the bar. The food was beyond delicious. We ordered the French Toast Napoleon and Monte Cristo....nom nom nom AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS!!!! The service was also great, very friendly staff and the food recommendations was spot on fantastic!

The Cheesecake Factory Experience<br>Every time I go past The Cheesecake Factory I just to have to go in and I have never been disappointed. Like the Monopoly Game &#34;DO Not Pass Go, Do Not Collect $100&#34;. It is just that good. I had a friend meet me whom actually mention that he has never been there. He did not know what he had coming to him. When we walked in, the Hostess smiled and told us that it was going to be a 45-60 minute wait. She told us we can go over to the bar area and wait. I told my friend it was worth the wait and in the meantime were going to have a drink to kill time. I ordered a Georgia Peach for him and me. It is Skyy Vodka, Peach Liqueur, peaches and raspberries blended with ice. It is so refreshing that you want more.  After 45 minutes of waiting our name was called, just like the Hostess promise. <br>Next, the waitress gave us our menus. The menu has over 200 food selections to choose from that can make the decision process a little challenging, because you are going to want everything. Like always, I chose the Barbecue Ranch Chicken Salad.  After 20 minutes of waiting my food was delivered with the best presentation. It came on a big plate with a portion size big enough for two in the shape of a pyramid. The salad is tossed in a BBQ Ranch Dressing topped with corn, tomatoes, cucumbers, black beans and fried onion strings. The salad also comes with avocado but I opted to have them keep it. The chicken is served hot and it was very delicious. This salad is awesome and is highly recommended. <br>In addition to that the atmosphere was great. The place is family friendly oriented and a good place for a date. It is nicely decorated with brown and tan paint. It also has gold trimmings around the ceilings. Also there is music playing while you are eating. However due to the capacity of the restaurant you may not hear it. The front of the restaurant is very clean and smells great. The bathroom is just as clean as the front of the house. <br>Furthermore the service is exceptional. All the way from the Hostess, the bartender, the waitress, and the bussers. They make sure that you are taking care of and you don&#39;t have to ask for more. The waitress always kept our water glasses filled and the Georgia Peach&#39;s arrive at a reasonable time. It occurred to me that she had a system to her service skills. The restaurant was very busy and she had other tables but she seemed to make us feel like we were her only customers. <br>At the end of it all the waitress asked us if we wanted desert. With that being said you cannot go to The Cheesecake Factory without taking a cheesecake home. I said &#34;yes&#34;! The waitress brought us our check and my Oreo Cheesecake to go. My tab was around $50 and I think that is pretty reasonable when you have good food and great service.  In conclusion to this review I hope that I convinced you to visit this restaurant because if you want to spend your hard earned money on a good meal &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34; is the place to be.<br><br>Rating 4 out of 5 Stars - Only because I had a wait time other than that it was great...

I probably would not come back, I guess I never realized what a tourist attraction it is here. <br>It was an hour wait to get a table and no one told us we could just walk on over to the lounge and get a seat right away?<br>Our server was quick and friendly and I was happy he get out out of there so fast but the food was not really worth the wait.

I would like to start by saying the food is pretty good and they definitely give you generous portions for reasonable prices.  The staff is attentive and friendly which is especially impressive when you consider how much of a zoo it always is.<br><br>However,  the interior is in need of a serious renovation as it looks closer to an indoor jungle gym than a restaurant.  I have seen other Cheesecake factories that have a classy and modern decor while maintaing a upscale vibe that they are going for.  The location is in the middle of Magnificent Mile and is always packed so be prepared for some serious waiting.<br><br>Pro-Tip:  Keep an eye-on the first come first serve bar seating where we have been able to snag a table within the first 15 minutes of arrival.
Amazing, to-die-for cheesecakes.  Very pricy but worth it.  Better than I can ever make at home.

I really wish the Cheesecake Factory came to Canada.  Talk about a place that wants to stuff you.  I think they should start with the dessert menu first then the main courses.  No matter what I order I get a ton of food.  I think the next time I go, I am going to share my dish with my wife... and son... that&#39;s how much food they give.  I ordered the Kobe burger and it was divine.  Such tender meat patty... I am drooling as I am typing. <br>Overall, this chain is very good.  They treat their customers well and the food is great for the price.

This place was my &#34;go to&#34; whenever I had visitors from out of town or a place to celebrate, it&#39;s going downhill.  The service was great and prompt but the entrees were so much smaller (not the lunch portion). The mixed drinks were in a tiny glass filled with ice and $11.00 each, no price listed on the menu, also after getting the bill most of the dishes we ordered were $2-3.00 more than listed on the menu. I don&#39;t mind paying for a meal out especially if it&#39;s great food and service, but don&#39;t cheat me on the bill. I won&#39;t go back to the CF again, none of them.

I didn&#39;t even want to give this place 1 star. The staff here isn&#39;t helpful in the least, and the management is even worse. My 21st birthday is on Sat the 17th and I have over 20 people coming, we planned on having it here so I called to make a reservation which I was told I couldn&#39;t so I asked what else I could do because I have over 20 people coming  to which she was silent so I asked if I could rent the banquet hall for that day and I was told I could but the number on there website didn&#39;t work, which I was told after doesn&#39;t work anymore so I asked to be transferred over and I was transferred to a &#34;manager&#34; who asked what day I wanted to book the banquet hall for and I told her, she then said I could not book that date because it is a Saturday even though I was told I could and I told her this but she refused so I asked if I could reserve a table if I put money down and she said no so I asked to talk to a manager and she told me she was the manager so I asked what she could do for me because that is over 20 people of business which I would think you wouldn&#39;t want to lose but I guess not as she told me quite rudely she couldn&#39;t do anything because it&#39;s policy and I told her they should change that policy to which she said she&#39;s sorry I feel that way and that many others have felt that way but the policy has always been that way and will stay that way but we can come and wait anywhere from 15 minutes to 2 hours to be seated if I like or I can go somewhere else. I won&#39;t come back to this location. I&#39;ve always love Cheesecake Factory and I&#39;ve never had any problems before at any of there locations but this one is just awful

Holy busy Batman!  We wanted to eat dinner here but being a group of 10 on a Saturday night with a packed house and a line out the door.....I decided to just get some cheesecake to go. Can&#39;t go wrong there!! :)<br><br>The tiramisu was splendid. Really terrific blend of tiramisu &amp; cheesecake. The white chocolate macadamia was a little too sweet for me but still good. <br><br>Saved the Red Velvet for my Mom&#39;s Christmas Birthday...it was so good and my Mom really loved it. I was thrilled to have a special cake for my special Mom for sure!
Ordered lunch speciality. Fish and chips are just ok. Fish meat barely has any flavor. Valet cheese cake is heavy, which is good, but really sweeeeeeeet. Was only able to finish half.

What happened to you, Cheesecake Factory?<br><br>The last few times I visited this location we&#39;ve had a few problems.  One, you have to wait way too long for take out.   My usual navajo has been dry and made with one small piece of chicken.  There&#39;s more shredded lettuce than chicken.  They ignore requests like &#34;no mayo&#34; even though it&#39;s on your take out receipt and they forget to give you your cheesecake.  Thank goodness we called and made them aware that we paid for the cheesecake but didn&#39;t get it.  They took it off our credit card and said if we came back they&#39;d give us a free one.  That was the best thing about the meal which shouldn&#39;t be surprising I guess since it&#39;s called the cheesecake factory.<br><br>I&#39;m disappointed though.  I don&#39;t ever suggest that one should go to the suburbs but if you want to know what a Cheesecake Factory should really be, you should head to Oak Brook.

Wow.  This place is terrible on so many levels.  I&#39;ve been to other Cheesecake Factories and have always had a positive experiences but this place is just so poorly run... if they were in any other location than Michigan Ave. they would surely be out of business.  I checked in with the hostess and was told it would be 15 minutes for outside seating.  So we waited for 15... 20... 30 minutes.  Finally I went up to the hostess stand and asked (nicely) how much longer it would be.  The hostess said &#34;Oh you&#39;re next on the list.  Should be 10 minutes.&#34;  So we waited for 10... 15... 20 minutes.  So I went up to the hostess stand and said &#34;Look, we were told 15 minutes and it&#39;s been 45 minutes.&#34;  And the hostess said, &#34;Yeah I know.&#34;  And walked away.  Here&#39;s a little tip for you sweetheart... if you&#39;re going to be a little C U Next Tuesday then you should probably work in a different industry than the HOSPITALITY industry.  <br><br>Anyway.  We finally get seated and I ask to speak to a manager.  He comes over 10 minutes later and says, &#34;I&#39;m sorry that happened!  I&#39;ll get you started off right!&#34;  Meanwhile, our waiter is nowhere to be found, we have no waters, and no bread.  Waiter finally shows up with a plate of some weird, fried greasy avocado egg rolls (which we didn&#39;t ask for and didn&#39;t want).  Not exactly a great way to get us &#34;started off right.&#34;  Food finally comes (we never got bread and had to ask 3 times for water) and it was also greasy and gross.  We ended up being comped for the nasty avocado rolls, which we never asked for and didn&#39;t want. <br><br>So gross food, bad service, incredibly rude host staff, and clueless manager.  Stay away.
I just loved the Blueberry mojito!! I haven&#39;t had a better mojito before.<br><br>Rest, the food was alright (I am vegetarian). The portions were too big for a medium sized person.

I&#39;ve been here a couple of times. The first time I ever went I had an amazing time, seating, service and food were all great!. The second time it could have been better since the seating and service were not up to par. I do love the cheesecakes!

Excellent service, tasty food.  We came here just for drinks and dessert but still got great service.  The bread was tasty as usual and the cheesecake (red velvet for me, chocolate tuxedo cream for my spouse) was incredibly moist.  The pina colada (with whipped cream, per our request) was also great.

Very disappointed in the service. We were there thanksgiving weekend . Sunday 11/29 got seated at 1 , ordered our food , my husband and daughter got their meal at 1:30. On the other hand me and my daughter are waiting for our food. The server kept saying its on its way, about 1:50 my daughter who was waiting for her salad , she asked the waiiter if she can get her food , her brought it, meanwhile I&#39;m still waiting for mine, for gods sake all I ordered was salad with salmon. He said the kitchen was busy. Still waiting for the salmon to cook. My husband and my daughter finished their food. I got my food about 2:15 at that time I lost my appetite . The salad and salmon came , the fresh vegetable salad was all lettuce very few vegetables and a very small piece of salmon. Very, very disappointed , will never eat there again. Not worth the money or the service.

Cheesecake Factory is a tourist attraction. Although they give you big servings, it&#39;s not worth the price. The food also lacks creativity and flavor.<br><br>Our waiter was horrible. He would passby and drop off our food/drinks without stopping to talk or engage.<br><br>Not a fan.

I have been to this particular location many times and have never experienced what happened today.  The hosts at the main desk said our wait for a table for 2 two would be 20 minutes at around 7:30 PM today (Thursday).  We waited and waited and killed some time in the Best Buy right above it.  An HOUR later we finally go into the restaurant and ask what is happening, they reply with oh sorry it&#39;ll be less than 10 minutes.  So we stand nearby the host desk for maybe 5 minutes or so and our buzzer goes off.  We handed in our buzzer and half a dozen others were trying to do so too by waving them in the air like a damn concert or something.  They then printed out a ton of slips with party names on them and the corresponding number of menus into piles on the desk in no particular order and random hosts start calling out parties in no particular order. We stood there staring at our ticket for probably 10 minutes...so over an hour and 15 minutes went by JUST TO GET SEATED.

One of the busiest branches ever, and thus the worst service.. A server spilled a drink all over my mother&#39;s coat and didn&#39;t even stop to clean it up, forget about getting us complimentary anything!!

V had a red velvet cheesecake as it is one of their signature cake..  The cake has more of cheese and less of velvet cake and the cake is so hard to break and too sweet. Simply put,  the worst cake of our times.  Enjoy the true factory kind of environment.

We love right across the street so have met lots of the severs here, but none was better than our service today with Darien W! He was so attentive, polite, and fast! I feel like every time my soda was half way done he was already ready with a refill. He was also very friendly!

The food is pretty good but the service seems to get worse each time I visit. Even when it&#39;s not too busy the service is still slower than expected. <br>Some of the seats are a little too close for comfort. <br>Probably better to leave this place to the tourist and just get the cheesecake to go.

Never had a bad service or a request denied (never crazy) ate at this location with my son for Easter lunch. On our way out i decided to stop at the cheesecake counter for a slice to take home. I asked for a slice to be cut in half and was told i would get a fork and knife?? I stated again would like it to be sliced she turned to a girl behind her to advise of my request. Left my son at the counter while i made a call. After our name was called i notice my slice was not cut as requested. When i mentioned this to GUADALUPE (name on receipt) she states &#34;well we cannot cut it&#34; with an &#34;oh well attitude&#34;, WTF!! GUADALUPE led me to believe SHE was. Why tell me that you can and LIE?  Im all about customer service and she totally sucked! Last time i go to this location.
The best cheesecake I ever had and I&#39;ve tasted half of their cheesecake. Strongly recommend the red velvet, Godiva and the original ones. Besides, the salmon, beef and shrimp noodle is also good.

Huge portions of mediocre food. Why does that get people all lathered up?<br><br>This place always reminds me of the line in the Woody Allen movie &#39;Annie Hall&#39;:<br><br>&#34;The food here is terrible. Yeah, and such small portions.&#34;<br><br>What you will get here are NOT small portions, but what is the appeal of a huge plate of uninspired, mass-produced food? And make no mistake. For this privilege, you will likely wait a LONG time for a table. Hell, you will likely have to wait just to put your name in for a table.<br><br>Invariably, I get roped into coming here once or twice a year by friends or relatives visiting Chicago, or coworkers who think &#34;it&#39;s such a great place for a group.&#34;<br><br>Sure, the menu is enormous, but there&#39;s still nothing I want to eat here. It takes me forever to find the least offensive thing on the menu. People I&#39;m with will say &#34;So many great things to pick from it&#39;s hard to narrow it down, huh?&#34;<br><br>Umm, no. It&#39;s hard to narrow it down because there&#39;s literally nothing out of 15 menu pages that I want to pick at, hoping it will be decent. I usually end up with a salad of some kind. Even when I get the &#34;lunch size,&#34; it&#39;s still enough to feed 3 people. And it&#39;s not like salad keeps all that well, so there&#39;s no point in taking home the leftovers.<br><br>Maybe I&#39;m being too hard on this place. But it&#39;s expensive, crowded, and even their signature cheesecakes ain&#39;t all that great.<br><br>I&#39;m done with the &#39;Factory.&#39; I&#39;ve been here at least 20 times since it opened and I&#39;ve never liked it. But I&#39;ve never gotten food poisoning from eating here either, so that&#39;s why it&#39;s getting 2 stars instead of 1.<br><br>From now on, if someone suggests going here, I&#39;ll just politely decline.<br><br>I say skip this place. Life&#39;s too short to have even one mediocre meal.

The only thing missing is the cattle prod.<br><br>Maybe I should be glad this institution is here.  Perhaps I should be grateful for the way the uninformed and main street American types flock to this watered down trough.  It is possible this keeps me from watching people drop ice cubes in their white zin at my favorite haunts.<br><br>The menu reads like a glossary from a menu text book.  Written by accountants and bean counters alike. <br><br> Something for everyone.<br><br>  Everywhere you turn the &#34;greatness&#34;  of the Cheesecake factory is shoved up your rear. If they laid claim to giant portions of mediocrity,  they would be right on.  The claims of &#34;delicious&#34;,  and &#34;mouth watering&#34;,  fall well short of their promise.<br><br>Enormous portions are what most people tell their friends about,  this should be heeded as a warning.  These are the same boasts people waddle away from Old Country Buffet muttering.  The business plan is simple,  give the customer a bunch of shiny things to distract them,  over flow the plate with fries,  lettuce and whatever the cheapest thing out there is,  and when they realize how unsatisfied they are,  stick a giant piece of sweet stuff out there,  (which was most likely the only reason you agreed to have this meal),  and guilt everyone into paying for this epic failure of gastronomy.<br><br>My daughter opted for the strawberry shortcake,  her words were,  &#34;the cake is hard and dry&#34;.  <br><br>As for the other foods,  does it really matter,  it all comes from the same feed lot.

So, when you think of cheesecake factory do you get visions of oompa loompas running around with some weird dude in a hat making all sorts of cheesecake? <br>OK, me neither. So we&#39;re on the same page. <br><br>Everyone knows what the cheesecake factory is and yet some of us still go (don&#39;t judge me). I have a friend who had never been and i&#39;m sure going was on her &#34;must do before I die list&#34; so we went. <br><br>The cheesecake is quite good and they have tons of different ones (snickers, ahem). BUT the food is absolutely terrible. The one in schaumburg had better food and that isn&#39;t saying much. I ordered pasta and it was undercooked and crunchy, the sauce was watered down and it was flavorless and gross. I immediately asked to order something else and the staff was very nice and accommodating (read: I don&#39;t think they spit in my food). <br>My new order was a turkey burger and while it wasn&#39;t gross it just wasn&#39;t much of anything: turkey and buns...no WOW unless tomato and sad looking lettuce is their idea of wow. <br><br>If you can order the cheesecake to-go then please do. The food is really not worth it and there are better places within spitting distance of this place. Seriously.

Went in late evening for carry out - a simple hamburger and fries.  After waiting 35 minutes for the order I took the 3 min walk to the hotel only to realize the food was cold. The fries weren&#39;t even worth eating - just terrible. I picked Cheesecake Factory because it&#39;s usually a safe bet. Not this time around.  Waste of $15.

I went there with the kiddos on a weekday- the wait was pretty decent, 5 minutes to a table. The food was OK, dessert was superb, what really makes me want to write a review is the smell and service. For some reason, the whole place smells like dirty rags - I can&#39;t describe it, it&#39;s like they mopped and wiped the whole place down with some dirty, old rag. And the service, I told them it was my son&#39;s birthday and they seemed less than happy to sing a &#34;happy birthday&#34; to him. Probably NOT having another dinner at this location, I much prefer the Old Orchard one or Oakbrook

Why do people wait an hour or more to eat here? That is the question.<br><br>My excuse was that I had signed up with a secret shopper organization, and was getting a $40 gift card for my trouble. I figured, I&#39;m reviewing things anyway, might as well receive some remuneration, right?<br><br>One of the rules was I had to go for dinner at a particular time, and apparently 6:00 p.m. was when everyone in the world came downtown to hit the after-Christmas sales. I was not thrilled to wait an hour for a table, but rules are rules. The nice lady at the hostess desk informed me that the buzzer would not work outside the restaurant. She did not inform me that the upstairs cafe -- with its shorter menu and shorter wait -- was an option.  I had to figure that out on my own.<br><br>The decor of this place is so bizarre -- the puffy tubelike ceiling made me think of intestines, and all the food moving through them. Ew.  Our service was delightful and the food was not half bad.  I really enjoyed my Cashew Chicken Salad, though I would venture to guess that about half the cashews were peanuts.<br><br>And the cheesecake? Meh. I prefer Eli&#39;s.  <br><br>People, don&#39;t wait an hour for this place, especially if you have hungry, cranky little kids in tow.  There are better places a stone&#39;s throw away.  Food Life at Water Tower Place, for one.  <br><br>FYI -- they take reservations for groups between 2:00 and 5:00 p.m.

I made my first visit here on a Tuesday night in the middle of a blizzard. we figured that there would not be much of a wait and not be all that busy. When we got there, we were seated right away but when we left, the place was packed. <br><br>I have never had the opportunity to visit this place before even though I have lived here my entire life. Now that I have visited it, I most likely won&#39;t make this place a destination for me but I won&#39;t boycott the place. <br><br>The decor here is some of the cheesiest that I have ever seen. (No pun intended. Cheesy is the only word that comes to mind when thinking about this place. I think we were in a bad spot because it was really dark by our table.. It was dark enough where I was having difficulty reading the menu. When I went to the restroom, I noticed that the entire place did not seem that dark. <br><br>Our waitress, Kristina, did an EXCELLENT job. She was very knowledgeable about the menu and very friendly and sociable. Everyone we came into contact with was very friendly also. <br><br>The food did not really impress me as i thought it would. we started out with the fried Mac-n-cheese. Which was good but really didn&#39;t wow me. For my main meal, I had The Romano crusted chicken with pasta. Once again, it was good but it just did not wow me. I was pleased with the portion size that I received. They did not cut corners on the portions. <br><br>Now it is time for the cheesecake. I was looking forward to the dessert because obviously, this place is known for the cheesecake. I had the key lime cheesecake and it was delicious. Overall, I would not wait in line to go here, but it was a solid experience.

Despite the waits and the occasional slow service, I can&#39;t bring myself to give this place anything less than 4 stars.  This is probably because I&#39;m not a gourmet - I&#39;m a gourmand.  We prefer our food to be served &#34;en masse&#34; and never walk away from a table feeling anything but stuffed and satisfied.  Quality is something we can accept to let slide in exchange for guaranteed quantity, and luckily Cheesecake Factory serves up enough of both to make it worthwhile.<br><br>I&#39;ve only been there twice this year - mostly because when you get the benefit of decent quality with a good amount of quantity, it comes with the challenge of being annoyingly expensive.<br><br>I don&#39;t think I&#39;ve ever been to this place and had a bill less than $50 for two people dining.<br><br>Once you&#39;ve made it past the inane waiting process with a vibrating light-up coaster that will sit blankly in your lap for at least 30-40 minutes if you&#39;ve come between the hours of 4pm and 9pm, you&#39;ll possibly make it to a table.  Of course, you could just end up at one of the annoying too-high-up tables at the bar because they&#39;re out of REAL tables and it&#39;ll pressure you into getting a drink while you wait an insane length of time for your waiter and/or food.  Don&#39;t fall for it - you can get a 750ml bottle of liquor for the price of one bar drink that contains maybe a shot or two of actual liquor in it.  And yes, some reviewers have it right that the bathrooms can get downright atrocious - though I must have visited once when it was freshly cleaned and once when it hadn&#39;t been cleaned in a while, because it runs the gamut between funky and fine.<br><br>The bread is excellent.  Makes the wait for service and ordered food not that bad.  I admit that almost every time I&#39;m here, I get the same thing.  The steak.  It&#39;s pricey, but it&#39;s one of the few things on the menu I&#39;d never be able to find in a store and cook to the level of deliciousness that they manage to do.  The fries are okay, but the fried onions are delectable and pair so nicely with a good steak.<br><br>And the cheesecake!  The Oreo is one of the ones I&#39;ve had the pleasure of trying, but I have to personally give a shout-out to their 6-carb cheesecake, which was the perfect gift for my Atkins-dieting girlfriend&#39;s birthday surprise.  They even spelled Happy Birthday and her name in sugar-free chocolate.<br><br>My girl returned the favor for the waitress&#39;s bonus decorations by letting her know that she felt sorry for the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s coffee machine, and that it sounded like they had a clog in the milk steamer or something, causing it to squeal annoyingly.  She thanked us for the tip and made sure to tell the staffer at the coffee machine.<br><br>This place could make it to five stars if they lowered some of the prices, or reduced the menu enough so they could begin to truly excel at cooking a smaller array of dishes rather than churn out less-quality results from the nightmarishly-long menu.  I can&#39;t fault them for the long waits or the stressed-out servers, though.  If you go, and you&#39;re not a tourist, just punch any tourists you see in the stomach until word spreads that they&#39;re not tourist-friendly and then we Chicagoans can take back this awesome restaurant and get to enjoy the food without a 40-minute wait.

Have been here multiple times. Love their cheesecakes! Don&#39;t like the service, especially the hostesses. They&#39;re rude and unprofessional. The food is okay, big portions but no substance. The past few times I would just get the cheesecakes from the carry out area. That&#39;s all I want from them.

I didn&#39;t find the prices abominable, &#39;specially for the mag mile, but the Cheesecake Factory is definitely one of those places you take your friend from outta town who doesn&#39;t eat anything outside of burgers and spaghetti to.  Big menu, but the food is standard fare, not ridiculously tasty or anything, but it works.  <br><br>Service is just as bland as some of the entrees, but the cheesecake is always a winner, although I personally think I make a better cheese cake (I can rock a killer chocolate swirl turtle cheesecake.  booyah.)

It&#39;s really hard to feign excitement over the cheesecake factory.  It&#39;s consistent if nothing else - so that&#39;s a plus.<br><br>I went here with some family friends from southern Indiana.  I shared the Luau salad with my mom (really -  it&#39;s one of the best things on the menu).  And I had a pleasant Cheesecake factory meal...nothing bad...but not really anything to &#34;yelp&#34; about either.<br><br>The bathroom, however, ick.  I don&#39;t know whose idea the little self-contained rooms were, but they STANK.  It felt like the closest I ever want to get to a prison toilet.  And it creates a long line when all you really want to do is wash your hands.

Went there Saturday afternoon around 12:30 or so with my cousin as we got massages to relax and hang out for the day - absolutely horrible waitress/service! unfortunately i didnt get her name as i was so mad after waiting about 20 minutes for our drinks and we could barely hear her as it was so loud in there, she wouldn&#39;t even try to hear us or speak louder. Since we wanted to try a little bit of everything we ordered 4 apps and she literally scoffed at us and said, &#34;woah!&#34;...as if to food shame us for ordering 2 too many apps for just us two ppl! SO MAD! she never once asked if we needed anything in the meantime, she then took the order of the table next to us and the faces/looks she was giving this mother/daughter was horrible! she took her time in talking and getting food for the other tables in her section but not us. our food came in 2 cycles which was fine however, she never once came to check on us and then when she noticed we weren&#39;t eating anymore, she just took our dishes away and we had to flag her down to give us the bill. Worst $55 spent ever; will never come back to this location or any other - food/service has really gone down over the years!
Eh...it was fine.  I would eat here again out of convenience but I wouldn&#39;t make a special trip.
Tonight&#39;s dinner was perfect! Ahi Tartare small plate and Skinnylicious Steak Medallions with reduction (no wine sauce for me). Best part - Julie who took care of me and rocked it out!

I was thinking of mojitos and oddly enough it made me think of Cheescake Factory.  Lets just say its hard for me not to want to come over here and drink my lunch sometimes.  They are refreshing and pack some serious punch.  Anyway... This location looks as if you&#39;re inside some sort of fungus or maybe a blob of lard or something from all the weird blobby decor.  It&#39;s kind of strange.  I&#39;ve had so many things here from the giant salads to the factory burger to the popcorn shrimp which are just a little spicy.  Right now I could go for the lemon roasted chicken which comes with some great potatoes.  I&#39;ve been happy with everything I&#39;ve gotten here.  And of course the desserts are to die for.  This location gets 3 stars because the service is kind of crap.

I was surprised on a busy Saturday night (and New Year&#39;s Eve no less) the wait for a table was only 45 minutes. My friend and I decided that Cheesecake Factory would be a perfect base for our night of drinking ahead. That&#39;s where the pluses end.<br><br>We must&#39;ve had the biggest space cadet for a waitress. First it took a long time for her to come over and take our drink/dinner order. But she was forgiven for that since it was so busy. We then get our drinks and a promise that the bread would be right out. Normally I&#39;m not into bread but since both of us were hungry, we were kinda looking forward to it. So here starts the crisis: the waitress comes by three more times to say the bread will &#34;be right out if the oven.&#34; She then goes on to say how the whole wheat bread is delicious and it&#39;s so good but she&#39;s still waiting for it to come out. Seriously what the fuck? You don&#39;t tell a table of hungry people that the bread is delicious but sorry you don&#39;t have any yet. I could really give two rat asses about the bread but it was built up so much, I wanted some.<br><br>So we were figuring the entrees would arrive before the bread, which they did. And the fresh baked bread? Cold. But wait, I thought it was right out of the oven? My entrees wasn&#39;t any better. When I go to CF I usually get the Baja chicken tacos because they&#39;re consistently yummy. These tacos were so bland, it wasn&#39;t funny. The portions were huge but had no flavor. Such a disappointment because the entree is really delicious when made right. The beans and rice were the highlight of the dish and that was sad.<br><br>All in all, the service sucked, the place was about 500 degrees and the tables were so close together. Nothing like putting my ass in someone&#39;s face when I needed to get out to use the restroom.  <br><br>The only plus is there&#39;s a bevy of hot guys. My friend got a good look at one of the blondes. I unfortunately got a bad look of a guy who shouldn&#39;t even be allowed to wear white pants. Boo!
Slow slow service never waited this long for food! Then I&#39;m paying for parking, don&#39;t think I will be back ! And the manager only offered us soup and my food was cold!

Ate at this location only once,  while waiting to visit a friend undergoing emergency surgery at NMH.  (I usually get talked in to going to the one at Old Orchard.) <br><br>I admire Sarah L. for being so observant* re: the bathroom STALL doors  (though her rational for the doors almost caused me to knock off a star from a restaurant chain that deserve high marks in the &#34;quality control&#34; department. )<br><br>Am I the only one who appreciates &#34;prompt service&#34; - but feels a tinge of disappointment/suspicion when the food arrives a little TOO fast?<br><br>&#34;Inside of a gigantic cheesecake?&#34;  &#34;Soft and weird.&#34; Yes, that&#39;s how I felt as I waddled back to the OR waiting room.

&#34;Get it while you can&#34; <br><br>I helped my friend move this weekend and to thank me he graciously gave me a $50 to this atrocity. <br><br>We drove down and parked at the Hancock Tower, big mistake. I could have gotten front row tickets to Wicked with the amount it costs to park here.  These acts keep reminding me why no big decisions are ever made by me.  <br><br>This place,  I keep forgetting is always packed, and you usually have to wait for 30 minutes for a table or be prepared to fight off a throng of Asian tourists who are taking pictures in front of the giant mushroom. <br><br>Food is huge, not good, huge.  You will say to yourself &#34;Wow this taste um, this tastes, this tastes.... wow there is so much food.&#34;  <br><br>We had some glasses of wine,  or should I say, we had two glasses of cork-scented dishwater with a touch of oak. 1900 - 2008 must have been tough years for this one. <br><br>I think this place is packed because people are so full that they just don&#39;t leave.  <br><br>Thanks for the gift card Trey, it was a romantic evening at the CF and my girlfriend and I are happy that we will be part of many a tourist photo album.  MEMORIES

How&#39;d I possibly end up here?!  Sigh.<br><br>Oh yeah.  Out of town friends who reaaaallly wanted to go.  I would have thought that at 9pm on a Saturday night the wait would be shorter but I was wrong.  75-90 minutes - yikes.  <br><br>The food was mediocre and the service was sloooooow.  No water or drink refills either.  I ordered a pizza that was supposed to come with artichokes, spinach, basil &amp; tomato.  I searched and searched and all I could find were a few stray artichoke leaves scattered on my pizza.  Not chunks, not pieces of artichoke... I&#39;m talking just a few, random, thin, little leaves.  I never found the basil.  Sadness!!   The crust was hard and coated in oil, not impressive.  They had no kids menu but they agreed to a &#34;kids size&#34; portion of pasta &amp; sauce for $8.  It was a small bowl of bowtie pasta and a small (separate) bowl of marinara that looked like ragu.  Presentation: 0 points.<br><br>I also have one beef with the bathrooms:  There are only sinks in each stall!  So if you need to just wash your hands, well, you&#39;re waiting in line with everyone else.<br><br>BOTTOM LINE:  Not going back, unless there is some serious arm twisting.  You can do better, even on the Magnificent Mile... just venture out a block or two.

I guess when my dad thinks of downtown, the first thing that comes into mind is Cheesecake Factory. That being the case, me and a cousin went out to meet him but I was running late due to the latest series of CTA cutbacks. Being late, I hurried to the Cheesecake Factory and entered through the upstairs entrance. The entire upstairs was abandoned, nary a sole and the lights were off with about a dozen or more tables and room to sit but no one manning the door.<br><br>Getting the hint, I walked downstairs and saw empty rows of seating everywhere for noontime. I knew tourist season was over, but how could Cheesecake Factory be THIS empty!! After walking down through more of the restaurant I found someone who asked if I needed help, I kept on going and found my fam waving at me but was confused as no direct path was available and had to navigate through more zig zags and around the corners.<br><br>When I sat down, the other table started waving trying to flag down their waiter and made fun that they had finally got his attention. I quickly ordered some  Tropical Iced Tea and we waited for our bread. Eventually the waiter came back and we ordered two platters of fried shrimp and a crab cake appetizer. The food came out relatively quickly and our drinks were refilled but the lunch entrees came before the bread did doh!<br><br>The food was standard bar food and wasn&#39;t anything special in my opinion. It is typical American dining out fare, you will find much of the same at Red Lobster, Appleby&#39;s, TGIFriday&#39;s, Ruby Tuesday, etc. I kind of lump them all in the same category, nothing especially unique, but still good atmosphere and tasty unhealthy food when you feel like it. Better than Long John&#39;s Silver haha!!

How often can I say, Tourist Trap?  Not enough, when it comes to Cheesecake Factory.  Service is nothing special and I always feel rushed by the servers.  Food is also nothing special; it holds mass appeal and comes in massive quantities and is always massively disappointing.  The interior is dark, and the only mood this lighting puts me in is mildly depressed.<br>The redeeming quality: the cheesecake.  Under the mounds of whip cream and other toppings, they actually serve a sumptuous cheesecake--I recommend the take out counter.

We actually come here pretty often due to its great location spack dab in the center of all of the Michigan Ave shopping. <br><br>I&#39;ve always loved the atmosphere of this place--unique (hard to describe)...<br><br>Even when we come here at the prime lunch/dinner hour and it is packed, we never have to wait too long for a table despite our being a party of five.<br><br>The service is always great.<br><br>The complimentary bread is really yummy, especially the darker, oat-wheat loaf.<br><br>It always takes forever to figure out what you want to order here because their menu is seriously a book. It is sooooo long; they have way too many items.<br><br>Everything I&#39;ve ordered on their menu tends to be good although the huge portions make it feel so heavy to me and consequently I feel guilty for eating it even if I only finish half of my plate (which is still a LOT of food). <br><br>All of their cheesecakes are WONDERFUL. <br>I have never had a bad experience there. <br>Like the size of their meals, their cheesecake slices are huge, rich, and DELICIOUS!<br>After such a huge meal, we&#39;re always too stuffed for dessert. <br>But occasionally we&#39;ll order some cheesecake to go--yum :)

Caveat: This review goes for all Cheesecake locations, and I&#39;m writing it because my friends and family are done listening to my rants on the subject. If you have a strong loyalty to the Cheesecake Factory, perhaps you should go read something else. Just a thought. <br><br>I remember the first time I went to a Cheesecake Factory -- it was in Jersey, in a mall. Even as a surly 13 year old with the palate sophistication of an alley cat, I was entirely underwhelmed. There was no sense of being momentarily welcomed into a respite from the world, like you experience at truly good restaurants at any price range. There was a weird taste coating my mouth when we finished. <br><br>This uneasy feeling -- as if I&#39;m dining on a movie set and everything looks real, but isn&#39;t -- has only grown with the numerous work-sponsored &#34;team bonding&#34; lunches at CF&#39;s I&#39;ve had to endure over the years. The conclusion I&#39;ve come to is that, like so many other restaurants, CF is pure mediocrity and it simply exhausts me. <br><br>CF should accept the fact that it is on par with an Applebee&#39;s or Friendly&#39;s. At least those places don&#39;t attempt to be anything they&#39;re not! The food is no better and neither is the service. And at CF, you have to try to stomach that Wal-Martized version of fine dining decor. <br><br>Larger portions do not = better quality. Really. The price might be right, but those massive piles of cardboard doused in fat and sugar are all that is wrong with America. <br><br>Why on EARTH would you want to eat somewhere called a &#34;factory&#34;? Go out and pick up Pollan&#39;s &#34;Omnivore&#39;s Dilemma.&#34; Try and tell me, after reading it, that you want to put something that ADMITS to being straight from a factory in your mouth! (Even if you&#39;re not going to tell me anything of the sort, read the book anyway.)<br><br>As I write this, I realize that many will wonder why I care. &#34;If you don&#39;t like it, don&#39;t go there!&#34; (You were thinking that. I know.) And you have a point. However, I think what I&#39;m really railing against here is the sense that people don&#39;t demand better food, atmosphere, service. No one thinks twice about spending their money on something perhaps temporarily tasty but ultimately insubstantial, and that&#39;s why these places exist. These mediocre restaurants keep popping up like mushrooms, and eventually people start to think its the norm. <br><br>For the price of a CF meal, you can easily feast somewhere more genuine, if you&#39;re willing to look. So, no, I won&#39;t go to CF anymore. I&#39;ll skip the office birthday and &#34;so sorry you&#39;re leaving us&#34; celebrations. I&#39;ll just hope that people start putting their feet down before all the real places are stamped out by these alien, heartless, species. Trust me, if you stop to think about it, you can tell the difference.<br><br>That is all.

After running around Chicago, we were very hungry. Choose this place and did not regret it one bit.  Even though it was super busy and wait was a little longer than I liked, the food and the service was worth it.  Had an excellent burger, and that made up for the wait.

Ah yes, Cheesecake Factory...I would come here more often except for my love affair with its sister restaurant Grand Lux.  (Sorry CF, I still love you...)<br><br>I remember my first time going to Cheesecake Factory and seeing Jerry Springer with all his crazy groupies...that was quite interesting...especially since, for a couple minutes I couldn&#39;t put my finger on why &#34;that guy&#34; looked so familiar (Please don&#39;t look at me in disbelief...I didn&#39;t watch the show).<br><br>Anyways, I instantly fell in love with the avocado eggrolls...delicious!  And to this day, I always make sure to order it when I frequent CF.  Another default of mine would be their chicken and shrimp jambalaya pasta (FYI, Grand Lux has this too but with rice instead).  For dessert, I love their chocolate tuxedo cheesecake...it is absolutely scrumptious.  <br><br>People think that Grand Lux is a tourist trap but I don&#39;t know, Cheesecake scares me more in terms of that.  I think it has to do with the fact that it&#39;s in the Hancock building.

I hate this place.<br><br>I hate this place.<br><br>I hate this place.<br><br>Its loud, full of tourist, the silverware was filthy and the food not that good.  <br><br>Who the hell cares if you get enough to take home if it tastes like crap.  Twice as much crap is just more crap.<br><br>I&#39;d rather put some hot sauce on some toilet paper and eat it.

Having grown up with the SoCal locales and now the NorCal locales, I&#39;m always surprised how consistent the food is here. This is evidence that Cheesecake Factory employs mad culinary scientists. How else could you explain travelling 1500+ miles and the food tasting like you had it back home with a menu this huge-mungous? An extra star for the cool locale in the Hancock tower. The SF local is at the top floor of the Macy&#39;s building and it&#39;s too bad the restaurant here wasn&#39;t at the top too :)

I love the Cheesecake Factory. The orange chicken, the chicken madeira, the honey wheat bread...it&#39;s jt all so tasty. The Michigan Ave location is almost always crowded on weekend evenings so your best bet is to put your name on the list, but camp out near the bar and sit down when you see people leave. Sometimes you should even think about sitting before they&#39;ve bussed the table...just to make sure you own that spot. Oh yea, the cheesecake is pretty good too.

Terrible service - not worth the food. Pretty hard to screw up the &#34;take-out&#34; process. Waited on hold for over 15mins. Called back to speak with a manager - waited for another 10mins and never got through. Totally unacceptable. Then, For a salad and fries waited over the time they quoted. James offered me &#34;free cheesecake&#34; when I arrived to express concern with the lost service standards. Terrible service met with a terrible solution. Sad to see such bad habits touted as acceptable in a Mag Mile operation.

Yes, all Cheesecake Factories are the same....delicious!  <br><br>Reasonably priced food, huge portions and a great variety on the menu?  Plus they have amazing cheesecake?<br><br>Come on, you have to like this place.  My recommendation - get something that you can eat the next day, and take half of it home.  That way you&#39;ll have room for dessert - which really, is the whole point of the restaurant!

This is my second time to Cheesecake Factory, but last time was in San Francisco. It was good because we ordered a lot of food, and of course it cost me lot of $$.<br>This time, my friends and I all had cheesecake and ice cream, but in different flavors. I had the caramel one. It was good but very sweet. I think it goes better with a coffee or tea. <br>Besides, so many people there during weekends. I think it is better to go there during weekdays to avoid crowds and tourists.

As everyone else said, expect the wait to be long, but well worth it. We were able to find a table near the bar, so we didn&#39;t have to wait too long. <br><br>I have to say that we had a good meal and great cheesecake! We all loved the corn tamales appetizer, my dad loved his cheesesteak sandwich, and my salmon was great. My mom and sister really liked their steak, but wished it had been a little bit more tender. <br><br>Huge portions! After from stuffing all that food in my face, we took our cheesecake to go.<br><br>Every cheesecake I&#39;ve had from there is great, but my favorite is the original with strawberries on top. If you can&#39;t deal with the noise and the wait in the restaurant...at least grab some cheesecake for the road!

I&#39;ve never written any sort of customer review or feedback, but today I had my worst dining experience. I entered the Chicago store at 6:27pm. The front desk person took down my name and gave me a buzzer, said the wait would be about 15 min. After 25 min, I went to the front desk again and asked about my status in line. She said I would be called soon in 5-10 min. I waited another 20 min and checked again with the front desk, she told me I&#39;m the next in line. I felt there should be something wrong, either with the buzzer or the system. I went to the back register/desk, and said I waited for almost an hour now, what&#39;s going on. The manager said, I was called 45 min ago. The buzzer never buzzed, I said. He the said yes the buzzers sometimes do not work, that&#39;s why he had someone call our names. I never heard anyone call my name, neither did my friend. We were waiting right at the cheesecake to-go place, which is less then 10 feet from where the manager is. There is no way we both missed the call! Plus, I asked the front desk two times and the girl told me to wait! She never told me I was called!! The manager&#39;s attitude is the worst I&#39;ve ever seen in my entire life!! He said &#34; we&#39;ve been doing the same business for year&#34;. (Meaning that they couldn&#39;t possibly be wrong??!!) I told him that I&#39;ve checked with the front desk, he didn&#39;t listen and insisted that its the same system and its not possible!!!! So again, it couldn&#39;t be their problem then??! It&#39;s my problem??? Never going to Cheesecake Factory any more!

I think the only restaurant open in hell is the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>My mom and her husband got a certificate and invited me and my husband to join them. So, it was free, and I still don&#39;t have any good things to say about this place.<br><br>Why anyone in the Chicagoland area would go to the Cheesecake factory when you have your pick of world class restaurants at every price level is just beyond me. <br><br>The restaurant is a giant, loud, overpriced, disorganized mess...just like their entrees. <br><br>Never again.

Now generally i am apposed to places like cheesecake and CPK and such. <br><br>However...<br><br>Going to the original cheesecake in Chicago was an amazing experience. I would definitely recommend it for an out-of-towner or a hungry NorthWestern student needing a large/tasty meal for incredibly reasonable prices.

Review based solely on the turkey burger: worst turkey burger I&#39;ve ever had. Mushy and horrible taste. Only thing good was the bun. They also put grilled onions on it which made it even worse. Looking back, I wish I would have had them take it back. Service fine.

My girlfriend and I both chose two different slices when we stopped in.  Both were dense and both were delicious.  The service was friendly and quick. Took us about 10 minutes to get our order and then a cozy place outside.

My family is visiting Chicago for the first time ever- and I&#39;ve lived here for 3 years.  I had so many ideas of where to take them, but you know how it goes with visitors.  After a few sites, we found ourselves at the bottom of the John Hancock, and they wanted Cheesecake Factory next.  <br>Ummm...<br><br>We had a 3 and a 4 year old with us, and waited forever to be seated.  With all the tourists there with young children, I was surprised to find out that there is no section for kids foods in the novelesque menu.  Do they think they are really that fancy that they can&#39;t bother to have a kid&#39;s menu section?  Pssh.  <br><br>We all know the portions are grotesquely huge, and tonight was no different.  But size isn&#39;t the only thing that matters, I guess.  I&#39;m a fan of comfort food (lord help me) and I found the mashed potatoes and popcorn shrimp to be really good- not together though, ha.  Everything else (sandwiches, pastas, pizzas, corn mystery side dish) was flavorless.  Mac n Cheese balls- narsty!  Salad- brown lettuce?!?<br><br>And I really don&#39;t like how all the servers wear tight, white, and most times a bit see-thru pants.<br><br>ps- I don&#39;t like cheescake, but I heard that they do it well.

Reasonable prices for what you get - good portions, quality food and good location (minus the parking) and it&#39;s almost always busy :)<br><br>Favorites are: Angel Hair pasta with Shrimp and Kobe Beef burger (hits the spot)<br><br>Tips: Can be a little loud. Visit the John Hancock Signature room on the 96th floor for drinks and an amazing view afterwards!

Do I even need to review this place?  It&#39;s been consistent no matter what city I&#39;ve been to.  Some highlights:  Avocado eggroll appetizers, tons of fun burger, thai noodle salad, navajo sandwich, everything.<br><br>Here&#39;s a tip at this location though.  It never fails us.  Go in at anytime and bypass the line.  Go to the bar area and find an open seat.  Sit down and enjoy.  <br><br>If someone does smoke, you can barely smell it since it&#39;s pretty airy.  <br><br>If you are in a big group, sorry, you have to wait.<br><br>But for all you couples standing there and waiting with your buzz lightyear device in your back pocket, sit your butt down and order already.

Daniel our Lunchtime waiter was Awesome!!<br>our lunch was Great, this restr is in the basement of the John Hancock Building, we literally went from top to bottom,<br>the food is Always Excellent, the wait from frantic guests wasn&#39;t too bad, ~30 minutes downtown Chicago during lunch rush hour &amp; holiday shoppers

The interior design of this place is interesting. I&#39;m never sure exactly what in. It looks like the inside of a pie to me. Anyways I&#39;m giving this place 4 stars for super customer service, cheesecake and the size of the dishes!!!! <br><br>The last two times that I&#39;ve been here were got the same waitress and she was awesome! I asked questions and was modifying my drinks and she never had an issue with it. She was just super friendly. You rock MISSY!!!<br><br>Normally I just come for cheesecake and drinks. The first time I came I checked out the Caesar salad.  I only ordered half and when it got to the table I almost flipped out. It was huge!! It looked like a full salad to me but it wasn&#39;t. Great! The taste was OK. Needed more croutons. The dressing was a little on the light side.<br><br>Now to the cheesecake...ITS SO YUMMY!! I&#39;m committing a sin just thinking about enjoying a slice of Oreo cheesecake with a side of vanilla ice cream...mmmm. The cheesecake is always good here and I&#39;ve never been disappointed. I always have to get vanilla ice cream on the side because the cheesecake a just a little to rich for me to handle without some cool and creamy.<br><br>Great place for dessert!! Awesome service and everyone who checks this place out needs to try the Oreo cheesecake!!!! YUM!!!

Made impromptu trip into the city from Indiana with my son to experience  Tilt at the John Hancock bldg &amp; then to dinner.  I see other reviewers complain about long waits, loud restaurant etc.. Well duh!  It&#39;s a huge city. The entire city is loud &amp; busy. Anyway, yes, it took some time to get a table but our waiter had a great personality, he came with a smile, engaged us, our food was delicious, and we had a great time &amp; good food for a spur of the moment decision to drive 2 hours for dinner was a good plan for the evening. I only hope I can get ahold of someone there &amp; arrange to get the photographs that I bought that my boy left at the table.

I hate my friends and family because they insist on Cheesecake Factory every time they vist from up north I live a block away from it and I&#39;m cursed because this place sucks. I still have not found an edible item on there HUGE menu. LORD HAVE MERCY ON ME!!!! This is the Fort Lauderdale location I speak of.

Like the rating states; &#34;Meh, I&#39;ve experienced better&#34; Go somewhere else, very expensive, no parking - if you drive downtown your parking for at least $20+ and the prices are very expensive for low quality and little quantity. <br><br>Go somewhere else; there are plenty of other wonderful places to dine in downtown Chicago.

I brought my mom in for dinner, and this was her first time at the cheesecake factory. Unfortunately our experience was very lack luster. Our waiter was friendly and gave us good service however the quality of the food was bad. The bread that was brought to our table was cold and hard.  I ordered a Pineapple Mojito, and it was made poorly, it mirrored coconut water, sugar, and a few mints.  I sent it back and ordered a Mai Thai, which was also made incorrectly. My mother ordered a Mai Thai which was perfect , mines tasted like a completely different drink.  I requested that it be remade, I am assuming the bartender finally put a little passion and focus into the drink, because the third drink was great.  I typically order the chicken madeira but decided match it up (Factory Combination) with the shrimp scampi. My mother ordered the Southern fried catfish, which was overcooked. My chicken maderia was prefect as usual, however the shrimp scampi was not freshly made. It was obviously prep and left to sit, the shrimp texture was soggy and room temperature.  I am really disappointed  in the lack of attention that went into the food and drinks. I did not expect to receive fast food quality food.  We ordered two more Mai Thai  and finished our appetizer of buffalo wings, it was the only item that was made correctly. My mom made it clear she would not return, the food will not have me returning anytime soon. Not sure what happened with them.

Living in Chicago aka &#34;land of many options&#34;, I&#39;m not a huge fan of chain restaurants.  The few times I&#39;ve been here have been 1) for work (I used to work in the Hancock), 2) because an out-of-town visitor insisted on coming here, and 3) when a friend has a craving for their cheesecake.<br><br>Last night a friend had a craving for their food.  This is something I just don&#39;t understand because of all the wonderful restaurants we have in this great city!  But anyway...<br><br>We started out with the avocado eggrolls.  Strange, but tasty.  I ordered the meatloaf while my friend ordered a salad.  The portions are GI-NORMOUS!!!  Good grief...  I forgot about that!  No wonder we have an obesity epidemic in this country.<br><br>The meatloaf was OK...  Not the best I&#39;ve ever had.  When I saw the plate, I knew it was too much.  The portion was too big, sauce was overflowing on everything, and once I tasted it, there was too much salt.  We also ordered dessert - the tiramisu.  Holy whipped cream!  There was a small slice of tiramisu with FIVE huge dollops of whipped cream on top and on the sides.  Yuck...  Too much whipped cream.    Ummm...  Are you noticing a theme here? Yes, TOO MUCH.<br><br>The service was friendly and fast, which was nice.  I&#39;ll give them that.  Our server even went the extra mile to get the tirimisu from the main kitchen since they didn&#39;t serve it in the cafe section (on the 1st floor) where we were sitting.  Bonus points to him!<br><br>The decor is very much like Alice in Wonderland.  I recommend laying off the hallucinogenics before coming here.<br><br>Parking in the area is terrible, so you have to pay a high fee to park in their garage.  It&#39;s something you can&#39;t avoid unless you have access to public transportation (<a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.transitchicago.com&amp;s=0d7686e8d623488fd4cb7845df76e300c895a3c259ca85c7b00f552ea7d4c9ac" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">transitchicago.com</a>).<br><br>Overall, my experience here was OK.  Will go back?  Only if you make me.  In the meantime, I will continue my practice of avoiding chain restaurants as long as I live in this town!
Nice lite menu.  Really made my trip enjoyable. Good service too. They had Ginness

God do I love the cheesecake factory.  Notable features of this one that set it apart from others I have been to:<br><br>10 foot tall mahogony doors with gigantic nickel doorknobs and heavy brass locks... ON THE BATHROOM STALLS.  My dining party surmised that this may be due to the abnormally high amount of purging that occurs in cheesecake factory bathrooms.<br><br>Interior that over and over again makes you wonder if the designers who created this particular dining environment wanted you to feel like you were in fact inside a gigantic cheesecake.<br><br>Newly installed computerized kitchen which, no shit, led to our food being delivered about 3 minutes after we ordered it even though there were easily 100 people in the restaurant.

If you&#39;ve been to ONE cheescake factory.. you&#39;ve seen them all.<br><br>Food is really good (not great) and the portions are HUGE.<br><br>Don&#39;t fool yourself.... share a dang main dish and get some CHEESECAKE!<br><br>My favorite..... 25th anniversary Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake...<br><br>Hmmm.... you WILL WAIT to sit so do what I do... GO TO THE BAR! <br><br>I have no shame, I&#39;ll eat at the bar and order a coke!

Got stuck going here for a work lunch today.  To add to my list:<br><br>5.  The bathrooms were GROSS.  Like Chinatown gross.  It felt like they hadn&#39;t been cleaned since I was last there a year ago.  <br>6.  You can&#39;t make a freaking reservation if you have a big group.  There were 16 of us from my office, and we got split up.  For a freaking celebratory luncheon.  After we were told we&#39;d all be able to sit together on the phone.  <br>7.  Did I mention that the food sucks?  Blech.

This place is so nostalgic of dinners following high school dances, but you know what? I&#39;ve never liked it. Not even the cheesecake.<br><br>The food is average. It&#39;s pretty much the same exact stuff you could get at Houlihan&#39;s or any of your &#34;fancier&#34; Applebee&#39;s-type places. It&#39;s not bad, but nothing is ever very memorable and there isn&#39;t a single dish that I&#39;d return again and again for. THAT&#39;s what I look for in a restaurant, and obviously The Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t have it.<br><br>I really don&#39;t like heavy cheesecakes at all. I&#39;m probably a bit of a cheesecake snob, but I much rather prefer the real deal. I like the light, fluffy Italian-style cheesecakes made with mascarpone and ricotta--the kind of cheesecakes you can actually savor throughout the process of eating a slice! Here, you have 6 pounds of cream cheese mixed with some sugar. I mean, obviously it doesn&#39;t taste bad, but it&#39;s just so gosh-darn rich that after one bite, your mouth goes numb and you lose all taste. <br><br>And for me, the worst part is, they always get me on these awesome-sounding cheesecake flavors, so of course, I have to get a slice. How could you pass up chocolate coconut or chocolate peanut butter cookie dough or even fresh banana? But then I try a bite or two and I&#39;m sick of cheesecake for the next year-and-a-half. <br><br>I don&#39;t know. Maybe I just don&#39;t have enough estrogen flowing throughout my body to truly appreciate The Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ll probably love it once I hit menopause. Or maybe I&#39;ll just go there after I watch a Golden Girls marathon on Lifetime. I&#39;m sure it will hit the spot.

The cheesecake factory was very good. I know, I know, many of the reviewers on Yelp have a repulsion towards corporate chains. Sometimes, I feel the same way. But good food is good food.<br><br>Located in downtown Chicago, it is an easily accessible and affordable place to grab lunch or dinner. Yes, it is touristy, if that also includes suburbanites. But the service is always great and I have yet to be let down by anything I have eaten. <br><br>The avocado egg rolls are outstanding!<br><br>I could do without the decor. And, I don&#39;t like cheesecake. But besides that, the Cheesecake factory has solid food at reasonable prices for downtown Chicago.

Let me start by saying I need for everyone to get over this whole &#34;chain restaurants are the devil&#34; attitude. Yes it&#39;s a chain. Get over it. Oh and get over yourself too. If you were that much of a foodie you would have never stepped foot in this place to begin with.<br><br>Okay! So now that we&#39;ve got that out of the way on to the review... :-)<br><br>So, I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake plenty of times. Overall, it&#39;s not a bad spot. I think the ambiance is cute...in a weird but whimsical sort of way (Yes I said whimsical). <br><br>The menu is overwhelming and it&#39;s hit or miss. Once you find something you like you should probably just stick with it every time. Keeps the disappointment down you know?<br><br>Last time I was in this place I had the most excellent server. She was amazing. Every recommendation she made was spot on. Oh and they have a new pineapple upside down cheesecake that is TO DIE FOR. I rarely eat their cheesecake but this one is definitely worth a trip back.<br><br>Overall, this place isn&#39;t bad. It&#39;s super crowded and touristy so I&#39;d say stick to going during off peak hours. Also, once you find that meal you love...stick with it. Oh and leave your food snob friends at home. They&#39;ll only ruin the experience for you.
While the cheesecake is wonderful, the quality of their food otherwise leaves a lot to be desired - lots of additives, sugar and the like

If this place wasn&#39;t a chain, I&#39;d probably give it more stars. I&#39;m so unfair, I know.  My cuz and I stopped in for cheesecake and coffee while shoppin on Michigan Ave yesterday. We were seated immediately, received great service while sharing a slice of the always dependable Banana Cream Cheesecake. YUUUUUMUMS.<br><br>I&#39;ve been to Cheesecakes all over the country-- the waits are always long on the weekends but it&#39;s a nice, dependable restaurant. The menu is so extensive that everyone at your table will find what they&#39;re craving. <br><br>I know this Cheesecake Factory was built for tourists but I couldn&#39;t help but stop in to give my sweet tooth a tasty fix! :)

I&#39;m usually not up for the limited chain establishments in Chicago, but I&#39;ve been walking past the place quite frequently for the past 5 years and I&#39;m intrigued by the general look of the place so finally I decided to take a stab at Cheesecake.<br><br>My friend and I went on Wednesday night and the place was pretty busy, not to mention...it&#39;s HUGE. It was freezing outside and snowing heavily. They seated us at a nice table right by the window (which in my opinion is one of the only spots I would ever sit). The views are nice and with the snow falling it was nice and peaceful. <br><br>Our waiter was really friendly and he helped us narrow down some items on the menu. Did I mention that this menu has the most serious case of A.D.D that I&#39;ve ever seen? They have Italian food, Asian, Mexican, American...possibly more..but I started losing patience. I&#39;ve never seen so many random items at one place. I guess they have over 200 menu options. I would much rather go to a place that specializes in one type of cuisine (otherwise I wonder about quality control). <br><br>We ordered some Pot Stickers, Thai Lettuce Wraps and Roasted Stuffed Dates. I was impressed. The stuffed Dates were wrapped in Bacon and they had a great combination of sweet and salty taste. The Thai Lettuce Wraps is what I really enjoyed. The Peanut sauce is to die for and the chicken had a great marinade on it. All of the apps were pretty simple.<br><br>After the apps, we were stuffed, so I can&#39;t comment on the entrees or sandwiches but the Cheesecake is something I was personally looking forward to! <br><br>I get excited when restaurants have a nice list of coffee drinks (especially when it&#39;s collld out). I had the Cafe Mocha with the following Cheesecake selections: Lemon Rasberry Creme, Peppermint Bark and the Peanut Butter Fudge Ripple. Of course the Peanut Butter was my favorite...but they were all SO good. Bad news for those of us trying to stick to a healthy diet, but a little slice of heaven here and there wont kill me!<br><br>The overall ambience of the place wasn&#39;t bad either, but for the most part I try to stay away from the tourist-trap dining establishments on Michigan Ave during most times of the year. <br><br>If you&#39;re wondering what all that gold chrome all over the place is, I was wondering the same thing. I felt like I was inside a pie (the waiter told us it was supposed to be the inside of a Cheesecake) hmm..either way, cool place for a tourist-trap chain. I&#39;ll be back,

Eye candy AND good eats!<br><br> This place has anything you could dream up on the menu for lunch or dinner or brunch. The drinks are crazy exciting. The portions are huge. Unless you&#39;re having steak or lobster, everything is $10-$15. AND THEN there is the cheesecake!! Like 30 different flavors. <br><br>Indoor seating outdoor seating. Our waiter was four star in his manners, ease, friendliness, and attentiveness. Even tough it&#39;s very busy (you will wait 15-10 minutes), they encourage you to take your time, enjoy yourself, and stay as long as you like.
The Crispy Chicken Costoletta was SOOOO great!! Along with this, the grilled fish tacos were also amazing! great size of dish and cooked to perfection.

I&#39;m not a fan of Cheesecake Factory, but I was pleasantly surprised by this location. Service was great, food presentation was great, and the food itself was really delicious. I tried two different pastas, and I really liked both of them, especially the Chicken Chipotle Pasta which I thought sounded okay, but tasted pretty great.<br><br>As expected, the place was crowded and loud even during a weekday dinner. My only complaint is the level of loudness and it was much too dark for me- I wish they had lit up the place a little more.<br><br>All in all, great food, great service, a little lacking in atmosphere.

This place is like tourist central in Chicago. It&#39;s below the Hancock and people just can&#39;t help themselves. Personally, when I travel to a city I try to eat some of the food that has made it famous or is unique to that location so I don&#39;t quite understand the rush to this place but who am I to judge. I&#39;ve been here and I&#39;ve waited almost an hour to be seated since they don&#39;t take reservations. Unlike other locations, you can stray too far from the bar area or your pager won&#39;t go off. It kind of feels like a cave in here since you are pretty much in the ground and the base of the Hancock. They have everything that all of the other CFs have and I normally go with quesadillas or the bow tie pasta chicken dish. It&#39;s easy to split something here or order an entree for yourself and be prepared to have lunch for at least a day or two on leftovers alone. The menu here is ridiculous. If you can&#39;t find something on it, you need to never eat out again because you will never be happy anywhere. The cheesecake is slightly overpriced but they come in way too many flavors to count. The red velvet is a personal favorite, as is the Oreo.

Are you a tourist?<br><br>Then don&#39;t go..screaming kids will scream no more! Its always packed with 300 pounds of tourists and for what? The payoff is comparable or lower then most Chicago joints off the Mile. <br><br>I got the hamburger.. cant remember the name, the waiter didnt warn me at all that the whole cow is included. Normally that wouldn&#39;t phase me one bit. But they put all kinds of junk on it. Tasty no...

Decided to have a nice lunch before heading back to the &#39;burbs.  There was a 15 minute wait for outdoor seating so we opted to dine in with no wait!  The waitress was very accommodating, food was fabulous. We all had the lunch portions, and seriously they would have been adequate for dinner!  The herb encrusted salmon with mashed potatoes and asparagus was perfect. The fettuccine was delicious as well. We will definitely be back.

This place would have gotten 5 stars except the hostess was terrible and the ladies restroom was gross. <br>When we entered the hostess didn&#39;t even greet us. She told us a table (Saturday night at 10pm) would be a 40 minute wait to sit inside or outside. About 10 minutes  later our buzzer goes off for our table to be ready.  Either someone made a mistake or the girl was a big moron. As we were walking to where they were seating us we heard another host tell a table of 2 the wait would be 15 minutes. So I am thinking our hostess was an idiot.  <br><br>Our server Keith was AMAZING!!!!!  He was friendly, knowledgable about the menu, the food, the drinks!!!  Overall he made our experience that much better. He is what I expect out of every server I encounter. I can not say enough great things about Keith. If you go here ask to be in his section. <br><br>Overall the food was good, the fried Mac and cheese was Fantastic. But I mean can you say anything bad about fried cheese and pasta. The entree sizes were huge, but the taste of them was good, they would improve a bit.

I know I can be so anti-chain restaurants, but this place has such a huge menu and variety that there&#39;s usually something for everyone.  Plus, the service I had here was pretty good.  Even though there was a wait, the host let us know that there was an empty table at the bar.  This was great because we were looking to eat and head out to see a musical.  I had a margarita that tasted like lemonade.  It definitely makes it different, and I&#39;m not quite sure if I ike that or not.  I ordered the griled chicken and avocado sandwich substituting the fries with a salad.  It was very tasty!  I love avocados.  Our waiter was quick and very friendly, and he was quite charming.  If the line isn&#39;t long, I don&#39;t mind coming here, and during the summer it usually is..

The food is pretty good for a slightly nicer TGIFriday&#39;s-ish place, but the portions are ridiculous.  I completely agree with Katie H.&#39;s review. Since when did enormous portions = good cuisine?  <br>Not for me.  <br>Kids and tourists seem to like it though.  <br>Guess the restaurant itself looks pretty cool.  <br>Other than that.  Blah.

Coming from any direction, You pass at least 500 hundred restaurants that are superior to The Cheesecake Factory.  If a good restaurant is Walt Disney World, then The Cheesecake Factory is Euro-Disney.<br><br>Just get the cheesecake to go.  Don&#39;t subject yourself to the hit or miss qualities of this suck-hole of an eating establishment.<br><br>The cheesecake gives them 3 stars.  If not for that, Negative 20 stars.

One of my wife&#39;s and my favorite places to eat when we&#39;re on Michigan Ave.<br><br>The food is delicious and they have the best cheesecake around. Their menu is abnormally large, which can be great, but if you don&#39;t necessarily know what you want, it can take a while to make a selection.<br><br>The service is usually very good; however, they are usually always packed so expect at least a 30-40 minute wait. They do not allow reservations after 5pm. We usually get a pager and then go up to The NorthFace or Best Buy above and look around to kill time.<br><br>The place is a little loud because it is hoppin&#39; so don&#39;t expect a quiet environment.

I expected slow service, average food, and overpriced drinks when I took my family here to eat  at this &#34;tourist-tastic  place - I was right!<br><br>So why the 4-star review?  There is a charm about this restaurant on how it handles tourists, ridiculous requests (&#34;make my latte 105 degrees please&#34; - the table behind us), and the apologetic wait-staff.  It&#39;s very humorous watching the wait-staff handle these situations - they are very tolerent and should be rewarded for their patience. <br><br>I would recommend coming here for dessert during a restaurant crawl of some sorts.  One cheesecake is enough for two people.  Just order a cheese-cake and two coffee&#39;s and your set.  Sit at the bar too - they have a nice bar menu just in case you don&#39;t want to wait.

I did a very positive review the other day after a great lunch visit. We had such a great time we decided on dinner there tonight. Completely different experience. The staff wasn&#39;t as friendly. Food was overly salty. I got the petite filet and the outside was charred and burnt. Side choices are poor. No option for baked potato or side salad.
